expertTips: Qspice contains no additives, preservatives, fillers, emulsifiers or MSG; only herbs, spices, minerals and vegetables; so guess what?  It’s normal for the seasoning to clump and the salad dressings to separate, but it’s nothing a vigorous shake won’t rectify.

Use 40% or less total oil as olive oil when making your Qspice vinaigrette if you don’t want it to solidify in the fridge.    

Alternatively, just remember to take your dressing out of the fridge 20 mins prior to warm up the oil so it will temporarily re-emulsify.
Sprinkle a little more Qspice on marinated meat before cooking.

ingredient: 1 ½ lbs asparagus, chopped (600g) - reserve tips
4 cups vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon

directions.direction: Sautee first 7 ingredients 10 minutes on medium high heat.
Add vegetable broth to pot, cover and gently simmer 10 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Stir almond milk and almond butter into pot & puree with immersion blender until velvety.
Add asparagus tips and gently bring soup back to simmer.
Stir in parsley and lemon juice and serve.

expertTips: For cream of spinach soup, substitute asparagus with 312g clamshell spinach, increase peas to 2 cups.
The immersion blender takes time to achieve a velvety texture but it’s less clean up than the Vitamix. Pick your poison!
shortDescription: Served hot or cold, asparagus soup is a spring thing! Our creamy soup celebrates one of the most precious vegetables in a way that is comforting and healthy at the same time.

recipeName: All Dressed Corn on the Cob
shortDescription: Sink your teeth into one of summer’s simplest pleasures; succulent corn hot off the grill! It’s convenient to dress the corn in advance and char it off with the rest of the meal.

ingredients.dish: All Dressed Corn on the Cob

directions.direction: Parboil corn 2 minutes.
Try our homemade mayonnaise﻿! Refrigerate leftovers.
Smear each corn with mayonnaise then sprinkle with a fair amount of Qspice.
﻿Grill on 425F BBQ turning 3 times every 1 1/2 minutes.
Optional: To transform this base recipe, slather Qspice Alldip on the corn instead.

expertTips: Alternatively corn may be roasted in the oven.

For street corn on the cob like you’d find in Mexico called elote, mix a pinch of cumin and sriracha into the mayonnaise then garnish cooked corn with a fresh squeeze of lime, parmesan and minced cilantro.

directions.direction: Heat coconut oil on medium-high heat in large pot and add a couple of kernels of popcorn. When the kernels pop, add the remaining kernels and sugar and cover.
Keep the pot moving, constantly shaking back and forth over the burner to prevent burning. Pay attention for the popping to slow down to every second or two.

QUICKLY dump all of the popcorn in large roasting pan and shake on ½ of Qspice Bouillon, toss then sprinkle rest of Qspice Bouillon tossing until evenly distributed.

NOTE: The Qspice Bouillon needs to be added quickly before the popcorn cools & crystalizes otherwise it won't stick to the snowflakes.

expertTips: Accept that you’re likely to burn a couple batches while you’re learning.  Don’t be worried if there are a few unpopped kernels at the bottom of the pot. It’s better to have a few kernels left than to have burnt snowflakes.
shortDescription: White popcorn makes a hull of a difference! Most of the thinner hull disintegrates when popped generating irregular, delicate flakes that crumble easier but are far less irritating to the teeth and gums. Yellow popping corn kernels produce a tough, mushroom-shaped flake while the white variety produce a soft, snowflake-shaped flake. And just like snowflakes, no two popcorn flakes are alike.

directions.direction: Cream coconut oil.
Beat in order - peanut butter, bananas, honey, eggs, vanilla & almond milk.
Layer dry ingredients in order on top of wet mixture - baking powder, Qspice, cinnamon, nutmeg & oats.
Beat until all ingredients are blended.
Pour batter into parchment-lined 9X9 pan.
Mix topping ingredients and sprinkle evenly over batter.
Bake @375F for 25-35 minutes depending on the desired firmness.

Scoop hot baked oatmeal into a bowl and dig in.

NOTE: Centre will be gooeyer than edges.
Option to garnish with a dollop of yoghurt and sliced fresh fruit.
Cut cooled baked oatmeal into bars for snacks.

expertTips: Double this recipe and bake in 9x14 parchment lined pan for 1 hour.

If using frozen raspberries, crush them a bit then sprinkle them over the poured cake before sprinkling coconut mixed with coconut oil on top.  Coconut oil will seize if you try to mix frozen raspberries in it.

The level of sweetness is partially due to using very ripe bananas, but did you know that freezing and thawing overripe bananas converts more of their starch into sugar leaving them even sweeter tasting!?  Peel overripe bananas and freeze some sliced and single layered on a cookie sheet then stash them into a plastic bag for later when you can blitz them into smoothies or stir them into hot porridge.  Others you can freeze whole for baking into muffins, breads and cookies.  To use frozen bananas in baking, completely thaw bananas in a bowl so not to lose any of the melted sweet syrup.

Sandwich the topping in the middle by first omitting the coconut oil listed for topping.  Pour half the batter then sprinkle raspberries and coconut evenly and cover with spoonfuls of the remaining batter.
shortDescription: This breakfast casserole is a cozy and filling way to start the day. Out of the oven, scooped baked oatmeal has the characteristics of a crumble but as it cools, it gels making it easy to cut into squares and pop in the fridge for a ready-to-eat cold breakfast. Double up because this hot brekkie kills two birds with one stone, leftovers serve as an anytime snack!

ingredient: 2 Tbsp sesame or poppy seeds (15g) optional

directions.direction: ﻿Mix psyllium husk with water and let sit 15 mins.
﻿Beat one minute on low to get air in gel.
﻿Add carrot, potato, oil, salt & Qspice and beat gently (so as to not collapse the gel) until combined.
﻿Add oats, buckwheat & rice flours and beat until just incorporated.
﻿Use your floured hands to knead a bit incorporating the wetter dough from the bottom.
﻿Drop by #24 (1.5 oz) trigger-release scoop onto parchment lined cookie sheet.
﻿Brush with olive oil & top with seeds if using.
﻿Bake 45 mins for 2″ / 1.5 oz scoop @ 375 F (65 mins for 2 1/2″ / 2.6oz scoop); until hollow when knocked.

expertTips: This bun needs to get hard and brown to be fully baked inside; otherwise the centre will be a doughy ball.  They will soften up after completely cooled and placed in plastic bag.
The texture of this bun is dependent on fine grating the potato and carrot.
No need to peel the potato and carrot.  Just scrub them well leaving the nutrients just beneath the skin.
Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the structure of this dough.
Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago, I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
shortDescription: Longing for the taste of artisan whole grain bread? Our rustic buns will hit the spot. The soft centre encapsulated by a chewy crust sides well with hearty soups and stews. This non-leavened bread recipe appears daunting but it’s worth tackling; in a couple of tries you’ll nail it!

directions.direction: Saute mushrooms and onions in olive oil and Qspice until almost cooked - about 6 minutes.
Meanwhile toast bread...
And poach or fry eggs dusted with Qspice.
Top a quarter florentine and an egg on each toast then sprinkle with parsley.

expertTips: Browned, flavourful mushrooms can be tricky to achieve.  Moisture is the problem, high heat is the solution.  If the heat isn’t high enough and/or the mushrooms are wet, they boil and steam in their own released water.  The water must evaporate the instant it is released.
shortDescription: The flavour or mushrooms, onions and spinach mingle really well then Qspice marries them all! If you're only eating eggs at breakfast, you're missing out on an easy, protein-packed meal for any time of day.  This recipe is quite versatile; serve as-is or over steamed rice, pasta, baked potato, or gnocchi.

ingredient: 7 cups vegetable stock or Qspice Bouillon

directions.direction: ﻿Brown onion with coconut oil and Qspice about 10 minutes.
﻿Add carrots, parsnips, garlic & Qspice then sautee on medium heat about 20 minutes to get nice caramalization.
﻿Deglaze with wine.
Add broth or try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes. Gently simmer covered 20 minutes.
Puree to desired texture with immersion blender or vitamix.
﻿Stir in nutmeg, parsley & coconut milk.
﻿Popcorn garnish adds a fun texture to velvety pureed soups. Takes only a minute and a half to pop some kernels in a paper bag in the microwave.

expertTips: A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.
shortDescription: Soup season… bring it on! This complimentary root vegetable duo carries off a mildly sweet element while the oft-ignored parsnips bestow their earthy, spiced notes to our blended soup. Eating your vegetables never tasted so good.

directions.direction: Mix first 6 ingredients.
Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
﻿Cream coconut oil, then beat rest of ingredients in in order.
﻿Add wet to dry and form dough.
﻿Shape into 12″ log and bake on parchment lined cookie sheet 25 mins @ 350F.
﻿Take log out of oven, reduce heat to 300F and let log cool 15 minutes.
﻿Slice one inch thick with very sharp knife.
﻿Place back on cookie sheet and bake 30 minutes more turning once.
Enjoy!

expertTips: Add 1/4 cup dried cranberries for festive flare.
shortDescription: Biscotti are to cookies what croutons are to bread. These sophisticated Italian biscuits are twice baked crunchiness that are slightly sweet and perfect year round with a coffee… and makes for delightful holiday gifts!

ingredient: 1/4 tsp sage leaves (use half amount if powder)

directions.direction: ﻿Blend in coffee grinder.
﻿Flavour soups as is or make broth using 1 Tbsp Qspice chickeny bouillon per litre water.
﻿Stir ½ tsp in ¾ cup boiling water for a comforting warm mug.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique chickeny umami flavour when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
This recipe scales well so double, triple, or quadruple it using a dry blade.  Most blenders come with this extra blade and now you'll actually have a use for it!
Use our bouillon to soup up your soups, buy some gravy insurance, make world-class meatballs and stews or promote potatoes and rice to quintessential.
When seasoning popcorn, a little goes a long way so you can be frugal.  Put the Qspice Bouillon in a shaker with small sprinkle holes and start with a light dusting then adjust to your taste.
shortDescription:
Looking for a better option for broth that's bursting with crisp flavour? Qspice Bouillon, our solution to over-packaged, over-processed and over-priced commercial broth, makes everything old new again! It’s vegan and an ideal pantry staple that keeps for months.

And what's more... it doubles as a clean popcorn seasoning plus makes healthy clean Ichiban Soup. Qspice Bouillon pouch is conveniently available for sale in the shop!

ingredient: 400g pkg extra firm tofu, cubed 1 cm

directions.direction: ﻿To prepare rice, melt coconut oil then add rice, Qspice and turmeric.
﻿Toast 2 minutes on medium heat stirring.
﻿Add water & bring to simmer.
﻿Cover, reduce heat to lowest and steam 20 minutes.
﻿Meanwhile toss tofu, olive oil, curry, yeast and Qspice together in bowl.
﻿Roast on parchment lined cookie sheet at 450F for 15 minutes.
﻿Fluff rice with fork once done and replace lid until ready to serve.
﻿For masala spinach, heat olive oil in heavy bottom pot, bloom 4 spices then add onion, red pepper, garlic and ginger.
﻿Cook out over medium heat 5 minutes.
﻿Add spinach and saute until reduced.
﻿Stir in coconut milk, , honey & roasted tofu. Cover and gently simmer 5 minutes.
﻿Stir in lemon juice.
﻿Serve with a side dish of rice.
Optional: Enjoy with our delicious naan bread, which goes famously with this meal.

expertTips: Sub caulirice or squaghetti if you’re watching carbs.  Simply saute 4 cups riced cauliflower or eldente microwaved scraped spaghetti squash in same amounts of coconut oil, Qspice and turmeric.
The meaty texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.
Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
You can add any cooked meat at the same time as you add the rice to the pot.
Garam Masala is a staple blend of spices used in Indian cuisine – the equivalent of Chinese 5 spice.
Tame the heat by adding only half the red pepper flakes.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: A classic vegan Indian dish of creamy spinach studded with cubes of roasted tofu. This hearty meal that’s bursting with fragrant flavour gives way to meatless Mondays!

directions.direction: Make Qspice Lemon Dill dressing.
Butterfly chicken breasts.
﻿Lightly spritz chicken with olive oil then season with Qspice and place on indoor grill on high heat.
﻿Do the same with the mushrooms and asparagus and place on grill next.
﻿Remove when cooked – about 6 minutes.
﻿Arrange baby kale in centre of plate, spoon quinoa around then top with mushrooms, asparagus, tomatoes and sliced chicken.
﻿Divide dressing among 4 salads and garnish with parsley.

expertTips: For vegan version, grill extra firm tofu cutlets instead of chicken.  The meaty texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.
shortDescription: Assemble quinoa with a bit of chicken and leafy greens for a salad that eats like dinner. Easy to prepare and versatile, the quinoa (keen-wa) seed is a great wheat-free alternative to starchy grains. It’s loaded with protein and fibre to keep you full without weighing you down!

ingredient: 1/2 cup red wine or pomegranate juice (125g)
2 red potatoes, scrubbed and small cubed (300g)
1 medium turnip, peeled and small cubed (250g)

directions.direction: Mix first 5 ingredients in large bowl.

Sear in batches in instant pot.

NOTE: Making great stew is about proper searing and deglazing to keep the rich flavour the maillard reaction creates. Visit the link if you’re not sure about this technique.
After last batch, put cooked meat back into intant pot and deglaze with wine or pomegranate juice lifting fond from bottom.
Add water and bay leaf then pressure cook on low for 30 minutes.
Natural release instant pot, add next 4 vegetables and Qspice then pressure cook another 10 minutes on low.
Natural release again and stir in peas and parsley. (Peas are already cooked so just need to be warmed up in the hot broth.)
Reheat leftovers and serve over creamed polenta or add cooked barley to make a new meal.

expertTips: No problem if you don’t have an instant pot.  Just do everything the same in a heavy bottom pot stovetop only the cooking time changes.  Cover your pot and gently simmer meat for one hour then add vegetables and gently simmer 1 hour more.

The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Deglazing lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
Pomegranate juice has tannins just like red wine vinegar that add a complex undertone to the au jus.

Start with the basic stew method of this recipe then expand from there making a new stew every time.  You can add other herbs and spices like garlic and thyme along with Qspice, change the meat to pork, deer or moose and switch out some vegetables for parsnips, string beans or sweet potatoes.
shortDescription: Stews are found in virtually all of the world’s cuisines and there are as many versions of them as there are cooks to make them. Stew is typically a dish of browned meat and larger-cut solid vegetables cooked slowly in liquid in a closed vessel and served in the resultant broth. Don't overthink the seasoning; Qspice and a bay leaf perfectly flavour any stew!

ingredient: 798ml can tomatoes crushed, pureed or fresh 2 cups
3 cups vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon

directions.direction: ﻿Bloom 5 spices in oil in large pot.
﻿Add celery, onions & carrot and sweat about 7 minutes.
﻿Add tomatoes and cook out about 7 minutes.
﻿Add next 4 ingredients and simmer gently uncovered for 30 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
﻿Stir in peas and spinach.
﻿Bring soup back to simmer then take off stove.
﻿Stir in cilantro and serve.
Optional: Enjoy with our delicious naan bread, which goes famously with this meal.

expertTips: Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
Garam Masala is a staple blend of spices used in Indian cuisine; the equivalent of Chinese 5 spice.
shortDescription: Chunky vegetables enveloped by a perfectly spiced creamy tomato bisque. Just another quintessential example of simple ingredients creating incredible flavour! Thicker than soup, thinner than stew, stoup is a full meal on its own for lunch but only half-finished without an accompaniment for dinner. Polenta, rustic buns, steamed grain, pasta or mashed potato, you decide.

ingredient: 1-798ml can diced tomatoes without salt, or fresh

directions.direction: Heat oil and saute everything up to the green pepper on medium high heat for about 10 minutes or until browned.
Add garlic, potatoes and green onion and saute 5 minutes more scraping as the starch from the potatoes will stick to the bottom.
Add tomatoes and cook out 10 minutes on a low simmer scraping all fond from bottom.
Add next 4 soup ingredients and simmer 15 minutes.
Mix in garnishes and serve.

shortDescription:
Our minestrone with farro, is ubiquitous in Lucca, a city in Tuscany.

You'll love this simply healthful one-pot meal that comes together in under an hour.

Whether you serve it up with crusty focaccia or creamed polenta, it'll become a chilly night favourite.

Since this recipe makes a big pot, plan on leftovers or freezing some for a quick weeknight meal another day.

directions.direction: ﻿Cream coconut oil first then beat in next 8 ingredients in order.
﻿Beat in egg.
﻿Blend in almond flour & flax meal.
Drop by tablespoon small trigger-release scoop onto parchment lined cookie sheet.
﻿Press slightly with flour-dipped fork.
﻿Bake 12 mins @350F on middle rack.

expertTips: For straight up peanut butter cookies, omit the turmeric if that’s not a flavour for you.
Recipe doubles nicely but these are so easy to make, I prefer fresh every time!
Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago, I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
Nothing ruins the flavour of baking quicker than rancid flax. The off taste is very distinguishable; always taste flax meal before adding it to recipes.
For chewier cookies, allow dough to ripen in the fridge 24 hours before baking.
Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago, I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
shortDescription: A classic cookie turned on its head! The fusion of natural peanut butter and turmeric is pure flavour genius never mind that it’s a nutrition bomb. Drop style cookies are named for the way the cookies are traditionally shaped by sliding a heaping tablespoon of cookie dough onto a prepared baking sheet, spacing them 2″ apart.

directions.direction: Whisk dressing together.
Toss salad ingredient with dressing in a large bowl.
Top with grilled meat, fish or halloumi for a delightful summer meal.

expertTips: Use hay-cut kohlrabi or fennel, packaged coleslaw or shaved brussels sprouts (or any combination of) in place of red cabbage.
Fresh lemon and lime juice has brighter flavour for for making salads but bottled will do in a pinch.
shortDescription: You'll surely be enchanted by the warm earthy flavours of Lebanon in our crisp salad. Healthy and bright, it's the perfect addition to any meal or add grilled protein to make it a delightful main course itself.

ingredient: ½ cup nut butter of choice (150g)
¼ cup dried minced apricots or figs (35g)

directions.direction: Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
﻿Blend first 8 ingredients well.
﻿Add and mix next 5 ingredients with wooden spoon until completely incorporated.
Scoop with tablespoon or small  trigger-release scoop and press into 1” balls.

expertTips: Nutritional data is calculated without chocolate chips.
Store your muesli power balls in the fridge up to two weeks.
shortDescription: Raw oats, nuts, seeds and dried fruit are what muesli is made of. Power balls are portable for the perfect healthy on-the-go breakfast or pre/post workout snack. We upgraded muesli power balls to something fancy with a simple sprinkle of Qspice! Just a little touch of unexpectedness brings out the swavoury.

ingredient: Qspice melting cheese OR regular cheese

directions.direction: ﻿Cut green peppers in half, deseed and place on parchment lined cookie sheet.
﻿Roast peppers 25 minutes @ 400F then reduce heat to 350F.
Take Qspice melting cheese out to partially thaw.
﻿Put all avocado chimichurri ingredients in smoothie cup and puree.
﻿Mix rice, corn and beans with Chimichurri and stuff into par-cooked peppers.
Grate Qspice melting cheese over stuffed peppers, garnish with tomato and bake another 25 minutes @350F.

expertTips: If dairy is permitted in your diet, use 1 1/2 cups grated sharp white or orange cheese here.
shortDescription: Peppers are the ultimate vessel for leftovers and never go out of style! Pull everything together with avocado chimichurri and Qspice melting cheese then roast them into supple submission.

ingredient: 8 cups broth or Qspice Bouillon ( 2 L)

directions.direction: ﻿Fry sausage and set aside. Try our easy homemade chorizo sausage recipe below in tips.
﻿Sweat onions & Qspice in same pot to lift fond then add yams and red pepper flakes leaving garlic to saute in the last minute.
﻿Add broth or try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes. Simmer 20 mins.
﻿Add kale and simmer 5 minutes more.
﻿Stir in paprika, cilantro, parsley & mint.

expertTips: The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Sweating vegetable in the same pan lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the broth.
Adding garlic near the end of the sautéing process reduces the odds of burning it; which creates an unpleasant bitter taste.
For vegan, substitute vegan sausage of preference.
*CHORIZO SAUSAGE MEAT* - 1 lb (454g) - Homemade sausage is simple and leaves out harmful additives and preservatives.
1/2 lb each - lean ground beef and pork (225g each)
3/4 tsp Qspice (3g)
1/8 tsp of each – celery salt, nutmeg & red chili pepper flakes
1/2 tsp of each – garlic powder, chipotle pepper & oregano
1/4 tsp of each – pepper, cumin, chili powder, onion powder & coriander
4 tsp white vinegar (20g)
Mix spice in a large bowl then stir in vinegar.  Add ground meat and blend well.  Use baby scoop to form meatballs then flatten into coins.
shortDescription: The flavour of sweet yam mingled with spicy sausage gets rounded out with onion and kale. Orange and emerald colour combination is gorgeous in a bowl. Thicker than soup, thinner than stew, stoup is a full meal on its own for lunch but only half-finished without an accompaniment for dinner. Creamed Polenta, rustic buns, steamed grain, pasta or mashed potato, you decide. It’s perfect on a rainy summer day or brisk fall day. While you are at it, why not try your hand at homemade chorizo sausage?!

ingredient: 8 cups vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon (2L)

directions.direction: In large heavy pot heat olive oil on medium high then add onions and next 4 spices and saute 6 minutes.
Add garlic, bell pepper and carrot and saute another 3 minutes.
﻿Add next 7 ingredients and simmer gently uncovered for 40 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Stir in cilantro. Option to serve with toppings like chopped avocado, grated cheese, pickled jalapeno pepper rings, minced red onions and splash of lime juice.

expertTips: Double the recipe and freeze for easy weeknight meals.
Nutritional data is calculated using Qspice Bouillon broth.
shortDescription:
Our vegan chili recipe is filled with the chili quintessentials and little legume rockstars that beautifully stand in place of ground meat. Brown lentils are a cook's best helper when creating satisfying meatless meals anyone can love.


It's hearty and flavoursome on its own.. but oh so remarkable topped with diced avocado and accompanied by a wedges of roast sweet potato or Skillet Cornbread!

directions.direction: ﻿Mix all ingredients in plastic bag.
﻿Pat dry drumsticks then shake and place on parchment lined cookie sheet.
﻿Bake at 425F uncovered for about 40 mins.

expertTips:
Many cuts of meat come out delicious using this method only adjust cooking times:

FISH 9-12 mins
boneless CHICKEN THIGH / BREAST 20-25 mins
bone-in CHICKEN / 3/4″ PORK CHOP 35-45 ms
PORK, TURKEY or VEAL CUTLET / TOFU 15 mins
It seems counter intuitive to pat dry meat when you want coating to stick to it but that’s actually the key to getting an outer crisp.  Moisture makes the coating sticky.
Oil mist softer vegetables like bell peppers, mushrooms and zucchini, toss in the crumb and roast at 425F for 15 mins.  Serve with Qspice Ranch dressing for dipping.
Sumac is a ground African red berry that gives a light lemony tartness.  It’s available at the Bulk Barn.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
shortDescription: What to cook when you’re tired of cooking? Our homemade oven fried chicken recipe is handy to have on hand! Shake & bake is a healthy go-to you can switch up each week with a variety of meats. See the TIPS section to adapt this coating to different cuts. Serve with Qspice Ranch Dressing for dipping.

ingredient: 1 cup vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon (250g)

directions.direction:
Place all jam ingredients in small pot and simmer gently 30 minutes.

Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Stir in basil.

expertTips: There are so many delicious ways to enjoy tomato jam:
-Spread on burgers and sandwiches (like grilled cheese and avocado toast).
-Include a ramekin of jam on charcuterie boards.
-Serve as an appetizer with cheese and crackers
-Spoon onto fried or scrambled eggs.
-Dollop in wraps.
shortDescription: Time to ketch-up with an old favourite, our savoury jam that’s brimming with deep, slightly sweet flavours and a wonderfully chunky texture. There's nothing more satisfying than smearing a sandwich or cracker with a spoonful of preserves that you made yourself from scratch!

directions.direction: Put all ingredients in food processor and process to desired texture.
Serve with roasted radishes, pasta, rice, potatoes, soup, bread, eggs, grilled meat, flatbreads or roasted vegetables.

expertTips: Give radish stems and leaves a double wash to remove all the soil.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Did you know that radish greens are not only edible, but they're also delicious and strikingly more nutritious than the radish roots?! The texture of the leaves and tamed bitter heat is what make them perfect in this peppy pesto.

directions.direction: Separate radish bulbs from greens and thoroughly wash and dry both.
Toss radishes in half the olive oil and Qspice.
Roast on parchment lined sheet @425F for 10-15 minutes depending on size.
Toss radish greens in other half of olive oil & Qspice then mix with cooked, hot radishes and return them to the turned-off oven to wilt for 5 minutes.
Another nice way to serve roasted radishes is with our Radish Greens Pesto.

expertTips: Give radish stems and leaves a double wash to remove all the soil.
For an Asian slant on this recipe, sub 1 tsp avocado oil with sesame oil and add a minced garlic.  Serve over steamed rice with a splash of soy sauce.
shortDescription: Roasting radishes bulbs neutralizes the sharp bite that raw ones have. If you make them right, they get the same crispy exterior and soft inside as a potato so you can use them as a low carb replacement. Delightfully bitter radish greens expand this dish.

ingredient: 3 Tbsp pumpkin seeds or slivered almonds (25g)

directions.direction: Whisk first 7 wet ingredients until smooth then blend in almond milk last.
Stir in dry ingredient.
Cover and place in fridge overnight.
Serve porridge cold like a breakfast parfait or heat in the microwave and eat as hot porridge.

expertTips: Our recipe doubles nicely making excellent ready-made breakfasts.  Once the porridge has set 8 hours, pre-portion individual servings in containers and place in freezer to enjoy yet another day.

Pumpkin Pie Spice recipe:                                                 
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon,
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg,
1/4 tsp ground ginger,
1/8 tsp ground cloves,
1/16 tsp allspice
shortDescription: Rise and shine to pumpkin pie overnight porridge! If you’ve never had overnight porridge, it's basically a no-cook method of making oatmeal. You soak raw oats with milk and condiments to flavour and soften them enough to eat uncooked. The next morning you have a ready-to-eat luscious bowl enticing you to get out of bed. Enjoy warmed or cold, whatever the day dictates.

ingredient: 1 Tbsp lemon juice or apple cider vinegar (15g)

directions.direction: ﻿Layer ingredients in order in a 2 cup mason jar or measuring cup - see chefs tips.

﻿Place immersion blender on very bottom, pulse 10 or 12 times to start emulsification then slowly lift and whip entirely. NOTE: This step is equivalent to slowly whisking the oil in and is crucial for proper emulsification. Don't rush it! And if your immersion blender is too powerful, you will need to use the lowest speed and possibly even pulse the entire batch. See the “water fix” in chefs tips if you get a broken batch.
﻿Refrigerate up to 2 weeks.

expertTips: An immersion blender is the soup wand you use to puree soups in the pot.  Never, ever touch the head without unplugging it!

Make sure immersion blender just fits your blending container diameter wise and the head sits flat on the bottom. This is important for the egg droplets to slowly coat the oil droplets allowing the proper emulsion.  Think snowball here.

The addition of another tsp Qspice (4g), 2 Tbsp olive oil (30g) & 2 minced garlic cloves (8g) transforms this mayonnaise to aioli.  Then if you add to your aioli 2 minced green onions, 1/4 cup minced cilantro, 1/4 cup minced parsley, 2 Tbsp lime juice, 1 Tbsp sherry vinegar & 1 tsp minced jalapeno… you have chimichurri aioli!
Any oil works in this recipe.  Olive oil gives a heavier flavour and thicker texture.
For the vegan version called fabannaise, simply replace the egg with 1/4 cup aquafaba (60g); the liquid from a can of chickpeas.
If your mayonnaise is thin or broken (oil and eggs did not bond fully), add one tablespoon at a time of water and reblend slowly.  The water helps the egg to set and re-emulsify with the oil.
shortDescription: Ridiculously easy homemade dreaminess in 3 minutes! Real mayonnaise with healthy fats is good for you; you haven’t lived until you’ve tasted bread topped with a smear of fresh mayonnaise. And bread swiped with mayonnaise is a sure-fire way to up your grilled bread game. See chef’s tips to make vegan fabonnaise and aioli from this base recipe.

ingredient: ¼ cup coconut oil, room temp (55g)
1 ½ cups soft tofu, room temp (300g pkg, drained)

directions.direction: Turn oven on to 400F then place well-greased 12" cast iron skillet on middle rack.
Blend dry ingredients well and set aside.
Cream coconut oil then beat in tofu.
Beat in last 3 wet ingredients.
Fold wet mixture into dry until just blended.
Spoon batter into hot skillet from oven then bake for 22 minutes.
Let cornbread sit 5 minutes before slicing.

expertTips: Heating up the cast iron pan before adding the cornbread batter ensures a crispy crust.  If you skip this step, add 2 minutes to the baking time.

Seek out high-quality cornmeal, the difference is staggering. 
Good stone-ground cornmeal produces a bread that's light and fluffy, interspersed with pleasantly crackly bits of corn grit, and loaded with a rich corn flavour.
shortDescription: What was originally designed as a flour-less bread of necessity has evolved into a delicacy. Cornbread is quick bread made wholly or partly with cornmeal making it by nature a bit crumbly. Our contemporary recipe for moist crumb and crispy crust comfort food has all the right ingredients!

directions.direction: ﻿Mix all ingredients except last two in a litre wine carafe.
﻿Refrigerate 2 hours.
Rub rims of 4 glasses with fresh lime wedge then dip in Qspice on a plate.
﻿Add an asparagus spear first to each glass then two ice cubes.
﻿Stir caesar mix again and fill glasses.
﻿Hang a shrimp on each, tail sticking outside the glass (to avoid drips on clothing).

expertTips: It is not necessary to rim the glass if salt is an issue.
They don’t look as pretty but I like to take the tails off the shrimp for the convenience of my guests.
Caesars must be served ice cold. Refrigerating the drink ahead of time requires less ice keeping the full flavour longer.
Don’t use creamed horseradish – it makes the cocktail visually unpleasing.
Our cocktail is equally satisfying as a mocktail!
shortDescription: Caesar the moment with our remix. Bloody caesars are sweet, salty, sour, bitter and umami in a glass! Tasty and filling, shrimp caesar shooters get the party started… just serve in shot glasses instead.

ingredient: 5 Tbsps olive oil at room temperature (75g)

directions.direction: Drain juices from turkey cavity and pat dry with paper towels. Do not rinse - see chef's tips.
Trim turkey by removing any lumps of fat, offals (organ meats) and neck and cut off wing tips at first joint.
Sprinkle half the salt and Qspice all over turkey and sprinkle rest around inside body cavity. Stuff extra trimmed parts in the cavity.

Place in uncovered roasting pan and chill 1-2 days. This will ensure that the skin crisps well during roasting. NOTE: It won't make your refrigerator smell like turkey, nor your turkey like your refrigerator.
Remove turkey from fridge and let sit at room temperature 1 hour before you plan on cooking it.
Preheat oven to 315F depending on how hot your oven is (not convection).
Replace goodies from turkey cavity with fresh poultry sprigs, lemon and garlic.
Spread 3 Tbsps olive oil under the skin of the breast then brush last 2 Tbsps lightly over top of turkey including legs and thighs.
Coat a V-shaped rack with oil and set in a 12×17” roasting pan wiping any oil from the bottom of the roasting pan as it will burn leaving no fond for gravy.
Place turkey, breast down, on the rack and tuck offals, neck and wing tips under the rack to roast for gravy.
Roast turkey 1 hour and 45 mins uncovered. Make sure the bottom juices are getting dark brown but not burnt (reduce temperature if that’s the case).
Remove turkey from oven and turn breast side up.
Remove small roasted pieces from bottom and put in the pot you’ll use to finish your gravy.

Return turkey to oven uncovered until a meat thermometer inserted straight down through thickest part of breast registers 165F and the thigh registers 173F (about 1 1/2 hours longer). The carry-over cooking will cook it to about 5 degrees more.

Tip turkey to drain juices from cavity back into roasting pan and transfer to a platter.  Let rest uncovered in a warm place (do not cover as the steam will make your crispy skin soggy), 30 minutes for juices in the meat to redistribute while you finish gravy.
Add water along with small roasted turkey parts to the empty roasting pan.
Lift fond from your roasting pan by gently simmering 15 minutes until cooked bits release from the bottom.
Mix slurry and set aside.
Strain turkey au jus into your gravy pot and check for seasoning adding salt if needed and set aside.

Carve turkey & place in covered casserole with a couple tablespoons of turkey jus @ 200F to keep warm while you get rest of dinner on table (turkey will not cook further, steam or dry out at this low temperature).
Lastly, bring gravy jus back to simmer and slowly whisk in slurry until desired thickness is reached.
Immediately take off heat and serve piping hot.

expertTips: For even seasoning and curing, it’s important to distribute the seasoning as evenly as possible.

The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces.  Deglazing with liquid then gently simmering lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.

If you want to cook your turkey the day before, do it the exact same way only allow it to cool in partly covered casserole after carving then refrigerate.  Remove casserole from fridge an hour before reheating 45 mins @ 300F.

DO NOT RINSE YOUR POULTRY.  I’ve got science on my side on this one.  Rinsing your poultry, any bird, not just turkey, can actually cause bacteria to aerosolize and spread around your kitchen up to three feet!  What's within three feet of your sink?  Plus, it is completely unnecessary.  Rinsing poultry does nothing to get rid of most bacteria – the bacteria that it does eliminate are now splashed around your kitchen.  What DOES eliminate bacteria is proper cooking.
Store seasoned turkey on bottom shelf of fridge.  The skin will look dried-out after 1-2 days but don't worry, it will cook up beautifully.
If you need to limit sodium in your diet, avoid the gravy.  That's where the concentrated sodium will be.  The nutritional analysis only accounts for the turkey.
shortDescription: Want the most succulent turkey? Try dry brining. All you do is season the big bird, let it hang out in the fridge for 24-48 hours and roast. It’s easy to overcook a large piece of meat like a whole turkey but with this simple method, it doesn’t matter if this is your first time cooking turkey dinner. The resulting moist, tender bird will make you look like a seasoned veteran!

directions.direction: ﻿Sweat onions and olive oil in heavy bottom pot.
Let onions caramelize on medium low scraping and reincorporating fond from bottom about every 5 minutes for about 45 mins.
﻿Stir in date, vinegar, water and Qspice then cook on low covered 15 mins more.
﻿Cool, jar and refrigerate. Keeps for weeks.

expertTips: The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan from caramelizing meat and vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour booster and deep brown colour developer here.
shortDescription: A batch of this condiment goes a long way. Our lavish onion date jam is the perfect accessory to any antipasto, charcuterie or mezze board. Daub it on pizzas, and focaccia, or jazz up burgers and wraps. And if baked brie is that ever-reliable appetizer, then onion date jam is the go-to brie topper!

directions.direction: Bloom spices on medium high heat in heavy bottom sauce pan.
Stir in onions then add green chilies, ginger and garlic on top and saute 5 minutes to start sweating.
Add tomatoes, Qspice and salt and cook out 10 minutes.
Mix in last 3 ingredients and simmer on low for 30 minutes.
Puree to desired texture with immersion blender then add eggs and simmer 5 minutes more.
Serve with steamed vegetables and rice.
NOTE: Go the extra mile on special occasions or if you need to stretch the meal, make a batch of our naan bread, which goes famously with this dish.

expertTips: To cook out ingredients is to gently simmer them uncovered which allows for flavours and liquids to pervade each other.

Curry leaves are an herb and they are not related to curry powder.  Curry powder is a blend of different spices which likely does not include curry leaves.   When cooked, they release a delicious, nutty aroma that brings flavour over the top!  Buy them at Indian or Asian markets and freeze them.
Morph this dish by subbing the eggs for 2-170g cans tuna, 400g cubed tofu or paneer, or 1-565g can young green jackfruit.
shortDescription: Egg korma is a simple dish made by smothering boiled eggs in a modestly spiced coconut tomato gravy. Treat your taste buds to this easy-to-cook brunch or dinner recipe that's healthy to boot!

directions.direction: Place brussels sprouts and 1/2 cup water in a wide saucepan with cover.
Turn heat to high and steam for about 5-8 minutes depending on size.
Drain well, toss in oil and Qspice.
Serve immediately.

expertTips: Smaller brussels sprouts can be cooked whole, just remember that they will take a bit longer because their inner leaves are tighter.
shortDescription: Smaller is better when it comes to steamed brussels sprouts. They're more compact and mild compared to their larger counterparts so when you have the luxury of choice, pluck out the small ones at the grocery store. Qspice gets a misunderstood vegetable back to basics!

directions.direction: Make Qspice Bouillon if you haven't purchased any.
﻿Over high heat, melt coconut oil in pot adding 3 test popcorn kernels.

﻿When test kernels pop add rest of popping corn to cover bottom of pot. NOTE: This method brings all of the kernels to an even temperature so they all pop at about the same time resulting in almost no unpopped kernels.
﻿Cover pot, remove from heat and wait 30 seconds then return pot to heat.

﻿Listen for kernels to start popping then shake pot back and forth over burner until the popping slows down. TIP: Try to keep the lid slightly cracked to let the steam escape from the pot keeping the popcorn drier. It's a knack that ensures crisp, light popcorn.
Take off heat, remove lid and quickly pour into a large bowl.
Sprinkle popcorn with Qspice Bouillon in 3 layers dumping it back into the warm pot to stir as you go. Adjust amount of seasoning to your taste then portion into serving bowls.
﻿Smile and dive in!

expertTips: White popcorn makes a hull of a difference. Most of the thinner hull disintegrates when popped generating irregular, delicate popcorn sometimes called flakes that are far less irritating to the teeth and gums.
To substitute the salt, sprinkle nutritional yeast on hot popcorn as soon as it goes into the bowl. Stir well.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
You may have gathered by now that a popped kernel of popcorn is called a flake.
shortDescription:
Stovetop popcorn is infinitely better than microwave popcorn or air-popped popcorn. All you need are popcorn kernels, a pot with a heavy lid, oil and seasoning.

Savoury popcorn flakes flavoured with coconut oil, nutritional yeast and turmeric, one of the touted healthiest anti-inflammatory spices, is a healthy whole grain snack that will make your popcorn world explode! And for intrigue, try spiking your next bowl of squash, tomato, mushroom, cauliflower, broccoli or potato soup with a handful.

ingredient: 1 cup frozen edamame or any vegetables (180g)
boiled egg, tofu or any cooked protein

directions.direction: Make Qspice Bouillon if you haven't purchased any.
Simmer first 3 ingredients in a small pot for 3 minutes.
Separate noodles with a fork.

Add vegetables and bring back up to boil. Simmer 3 minutes more or until noodles are done. NOTE: Fresh vegetables can be used. Choose quick-cooking ones like broccoli/cauliflower florets, mushrooms or zucchini and cut them small. Or julienne cut longer-cooking vegetables like carrots and beans.
Garnish as desired adding more Qspice Bouillon if your taste requires. NOTE: Nutritional analysis is based on edamame and does not account for garnishes.

expertTips: Find Lotus brand rice ramen noodles in the natural food aisle of the grocery store or in a family package at Costco.
This recipe scales well.  Halve it for 1 portion or double it for 4 portions.
To reduce the carbs in our Ichiban Soup recipe, sub one or both rice ramen pucks with zucchini and daikon noodles and enoki mushrooms.
shortDescription:
The Japanese word ichiban is used to describe the best of something. How fitting for our healthful chickeny broth infused with a splash of soy sauce and the aroma of sweet vegetables and a hint of garlic. The soup mingled with the bouncy texture of rice ramen noodles balances out to make one very satiating bowl.

Slurping your way through the noodles along with the broth is culturally accepted!

directions.direction: Try our homemade mayonnaise! Refrigerate leftovers.
﻿Mix all ingredients well and refrigerate an hour to marry flavours.
﻿Serve with crackers, bread, tortilla chips or crudites.

expertTips: Alternatively, place whole boiled eggs and avocado halves in manual food processor along with the rest of the ingredients and twirl to desired texture.
Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
shortDescription: This Salvadoran guacamole isn’t only for dipping into; you can skip the chips and spread it on a soft tortilla, roll up, slice and serve on a brunch platter, or fold it with lettuce and tomato in a pita or smack a big gob atop your taco salad or rice cake. A fancy guacamole that's easy to put together and has an impressive nutritional resume... sounds like the quintessential go-to snack or side dish!

ingredient: 2 Tbsp bacon fat or olive oil (30g)

directions.direction: ﻿Simmer potatoes in 2 litres salted, cold water until soft. Drain well, cool and dry 20 mins.
﻿Smash each potato to ¾ cm thickness with flat bottom of glass on parchment lined baking sheet.
﻿Brush each potato, both sides, moderately with fat and season lightly with Qspice.
Roast 20 mins @425F, flip and roast another 10 mins or until brown and crispy.

expertTips: Don’t be afraid to use salty water when boiling potatoes (or pasta).  Only a fraction of the salt gets absorbed and nicely seasons them.
Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!
shortDescription: Crispy taters nuggets that are easier to prepare than you might think. Make appetizers from these gems by topping them with parmigiana or bruschetta or dipping them in our Qspice Alldip.

ingredient: 2 small tomatoes, peeled and fine diced (300g)
200g chopped artichoke hearts or jack fruit

directions.direction: ﻿Sweat onion in oil.
﻿Add curry powder & Qspice and bloom.
﻿Add garlic, red pepper, chickpeas and saute a couple mins.
﻿Stir in tomato then simmer until half liquid absorbed – about 5 mins.
﻿Add mango & lemon juice and simmer just to saucy stage – about another 7 mins.
﻿Mix in cilantro & artichoke, let cool to room temperature then refrigerate.
﻿Serve with crackers, naan, bread cubes and/or crudites (pairs especially well with raw cauliflower florets and green & yellow zucchini coins).
Optional: Make it a meal by adding a can of drained flaked tuna and serving this antipasto warm over steamed rice or caulirice.

expertTips: Green chickpeas are young, fresh chickpeas that are found in the freezer section at Costco and most East Indian grocery stores.
Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.

To bloom spices, simply means to saute 30-60 seconds before blending with other ingredients.  This breaks through the rawness and allows the bouquet of that spice to marry with the other flavours in your dish.  This is a crucial step in east indian cuisine.
shortDescription: When you’re looking for something interesting but simple to bring to a function, this antipasto sparks foodie talk! Crostini pack all the antipasto into a bite size appetizer and baby pita pockets stuff it into a tasty light lunch!

ingredient: ¾ cup stock (190g) or Qspice Chickeny Bouilllon

directions.direction: ﻿Sautee pork, garlic, onion, salt, caraway & QSice on low.
﻿Add potato, broth and milk. Try our homemade Qspice Chickeny Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Gently simmer covered 45 mins.
﻿Add oatmeal and simmer 10 mins more.
Add chia and beat to desired creaminess and consistency. Pour into containers.
﻿Sprinkle pepper over surface & refrigerate 24 hours to set.

expertTips: To each his own… we like our cretons on the coarse side but many prefer them smooth like liverwurst.
Make the pepper crust on top as thick as you like and/or fancy with cracked pink, green & black corns.
shortDescription: An old French Canadian meat spread for hot crisp toast that’s too good to be kept exclusive! Our upgraded recipe uses lean ground pork to reduce the saturated fat and bumps up the flavour with spices. Double the recipe and keep frozen portions handy for an impromptu charcuterie board, crackers and pate or snacking on a bun with hot banana peppers. Mustard of any sort is the perfect condiment whichever way you’re eating this deliciousness.

ingredient: 1 Tbsp nutritional yeast or parmesan cheese (6g)

directions.direction: Spritz asparagus and tomatoes with olive oil then sprinkle with Qspice and nutritional yeast.
Roast in 400F oven uncovered for about 12-15 minutes depending on thickness of asparagus.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique chickeny umami flavour when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: This simple roasted asparagus is paired beautifully with bright cherry tomatoes. A dusting of Qspice rounds everything out. It's a great side dish whatever the season and the perfect compliment to any meal!

ingredient: 8 cups vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon

directions.direction: ﻿Saute mushrooms, snap peas, daikon and carrot coins in sesame oil with Qspice, ginger and garlic for 3 minutes.
Add broth into the pot with ramen noodles. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Add Nori. Nori is dried seaweed sheets. Toasting nori brightens its briny umaminess and crisps it so it can be crumbled on top of dishes.
﻿Simmer just long enough to cook ramen noodles.
﻿Add tofu in last minute of simmering then turn off heat.
﻿In a cup, whisk hot broth 2 tablespoons at a time into the miso to loosen the paste (for easier dissolution) then stir into soup.
﻿Evenly portion into bowls and garnish with parsley and boiled egg. Option to garnish with any cooked meat.

expertTips: Miso is traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with salt and rice or barley malt. Buy organic miso to avoid GMOs. Don’t do soy? Chickpea and rice based miso is similar in flavor and texture to white and yellow misos and can be used in the same repertoire of dishes.

Daikon is a root vegetables that resembles a large, white carrot with a pungent peppery flavour similar to radish when eaten raw.   When cooked, it has a concentrated sweet flavour similar to cooked turnips.
Adding miso to boiling water will kill the probiotics in it, nixing the health benefits it typically offers, like better digestive health.
shortDescription: Miso ramen is a Japanese noodle soup with a miso seasoned broth crammed with a variety of vegetables and garnishes. Ours has fried enoki mushrooms to impart caramel umami and balance the natural sweetness of the miso and the other vegetables. This basic Japanese dish is easy to make in your own home kitchen.

directions.direction: ﻿Layer all ingredients in manual food processor then twirl to desired fineness or chop by hand. See my blog about the Trudeau manual food processor for helpful guidelines.
﻿Top if desired and serve.

expertTips: Start with this chopped salad base for a meal or poke bowl, then top it. Suggestions from the myriad of topper options: avocado, tofu & edamame, nuts & seeds, dried & fresh fruit, whole grains, falafel, grilled polenta, torn pita & tortilla, beans & legumes, cheeses, eggs or grilled fish & meat.
shortDescription: Your portal recipe to fresh, raw vegetable salads. Chopped salads are just like regular salads, only with a different presentation. The ingredients are chopped, greens and all, and incorporated together instead of layered. One minor detail puts you five minutes away from a chopped salad… a manual food processor. Avoid throwing out vegetables and get a different salad anytime by scoping out the fridge every couple of days.

directions.direction: ﻿Add all ingredients to manual food processor then twirl to desired fineness. See how to zest and orange.
﻿Allow to sit one hour for flavours to marry.

expertTips: Fresh cranberries were used in the picture. Use frozen cranberries for a juicier relish with a deep ruby-red colour.
Orange zest is the colored outside portion of its peel. It brings a citrusy, tangy flavour to recipes.  Be careful not to include any of the white pith beneath the peel - it's unpleasantly bitter.
shortDescription: A fresh, raw condiment that everyone will, well, relish! Easy peasy… five minutes to make any roast meat, baked brie, salad or sandwich seem extravagant.

directions.direction: ﻿Process yam and oatmeal to coarse meal.
﻿Add rest of ingredients to food processor blending and scraping until dough formed.
﻿Spoon into greased 9 “ pie plate or 3 individual ramekins, spread into shape and bake 25 minutes @ 400F.
﻿Fill with cooked stew and topper then bake another 12-15 minutes.

expertTips:
Pot Pie Suggestions

Tamales – ground pork, salsa, raisins & corn bread

Chicken or Turkey – poultry, gravy, peas, carrots & stuffing

Shepherds – ground beef, cream corn & mashed potatoes
shortDescription: Our sturdy single bottom crust is a catch-all for stewy dishes. Think “ingredients” for pot pie, not “leftovers”! Starchy toppers of mashed potatoes or breadstuffs seal it with a kiss!

directions.direction: Layer all ingredients in order in narrow cup or container that just fits the immersion blender diameter wise.
﻿Place immersion blender on very bottom and start by pulsing then very slowly lift as sauce emulsifies.
﻿Drizzle at room temperature.
﻿Store in fridge up to one week.

expertTips: Hollandaise sauce should just coat the back of a soup spoon but if you like it thicker, add more oil two tablespoons at a time.
Get in the habit of making hollandaise sauce whenever you open a can of chickpeas.  It's my favourite use of aquafaba.
shortDescription: Do you love eggs benedict but only eat it at the restaurant? Our foolproof lemony, satin hollandaise sauce that has the bonus of good fats is indeed standard home fare! And a little goes a long way to liven up eggs, asparagus, spinach, brussels sprouts, potatoes, cauliflower, tomatoes, broccoli, fish and seafood.

ingredient: 1-398ml can chickpeas, drained (260g or 1 ½ cups)

directions.direction: Blend Qspice Mediterranean Dressing ingredients in smoothie cup.
In a large bowl, toss salad ingredients with 3/4 cup dressing.
Refrigerate 2-3 hours to marry flavours.

expertTips: Mediterranean Dressing recipe makes 1 1/4 cups.  Use entire batch if making pasta or panzanella salad.  Toss 3 cups cooked pasta or small pita bread strips with vegetables and full recipe of Greek Dressing.
shortDescription: A versatile salad of fresh vegetables and nourishing chickpeas that’s perfectly balanced with a Mediterranean sundried tomato vinaigrette. You might want to gussy it up with proteins, cheese or nuts for a dinner salad or to bring to a party… Or transform it into a pretty pasta salad with farfalle or a panzanella salad with pita strips!?

ingredient: 2 Tbsp olive oil or bacon grease (30g)

directions.direction: Gently sear Qspiced cabbage wedges in fat in a large skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes each side.
Pour water and vinegar over then sprinkle caraway seeds.
Cover and bake 1 hour at 325F - longer for softer texture.

expertTips: Don’t worry if some of the wedges fall apart as you are cutting or cooking them; just scoop up all the pieces and toss them into the pot. When you serve it, try to arrange it so the prettiest wedges are on top.
There are so many ways to tweak this recipe! Raisins, figs, onions, leeks, apples, and pears are just a few things that rock in this dish
shortDescription: Cabbage is brilliant! Versatile and economical, it can be found in the winter when the variety of fresh vegetables is low. In our recipe, a head of cabbage is cut into wedges, Qspiced, seared and then oven-braised in a bit of vinegar. It emerges tender and buttery and as tasty as can be.

directions.direction: ﻿Soak cashews in water 4 hours in small smoothie cup.
﻿Add next 6 ingredient and puree perfectly smooth.
﻿Pour into a small container scraping sides well and freeze 6 hours. Should fill to about 2cm thick.
﻿Thaw 15 minutes before slicing or grating for cooked recipes.
﻿Grate Qspice melting cheese evenly and directly over casseroles, pizzas, quesadillas, omelettes, paninis and pasta – it sticks immediately upon contact.

expertTips: This recipe scales up well. Just double, triple or quadruple amounts of ingredients.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Of the dairy free ingredients, one of the hardest to replicate is cooked cheese because of how it transforms when heated. Most vegan cheeses on the market are highly processed to pull off the desired texture. Qspice melting cheese offers a cheesy flavour, melt and stretch using recognizable ingredients!

ingredient: 4 lbs beef rump or outside round roast (1800g)
1 cup pomegranate juice or red wine (250g)

directions.direction: ﻿Pat roast dry with paper towel.
﻿Rub roast with oil, season with Qspice & sear all sides in 6 quart instant pot on medium.
﻿Set aside.
﻿Saute onions with next 4 spices in instant pot until caramelized and all fond lifted from bottom.
﻿Push onions to edges of pot then add roast back with last 4 ingredients.
﻿Pressure cook on high 60 minutes.
﻿Remove roast, slice roast thin & put back in au jus.
﻿Serve with mashed potatoes and any green vegetable.

expertTips: Alternatively, pile beef and onions on toasted sub buns and broil swiss or gruyere cheese over top… French onion beef dip extraordinaire!
Pomegranate juice has tannins just like red wine that add a complex undertone to the au jus.
Make French Onion Beef in the oven by following the exact same instructions for searing beef and caramelizing onions only in a Dutch oven on the stovetop. Then cover and roast 4 hours at 300F.
Cook potatoes and vegetables while roast is pressure cooking.

The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Sweating vegetables on medium heat afterwards slowly lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
shortDescription: Full-flavoured, moist beef with sweet, caramelized onions… is your mouth watering yet? An electric pressure cooker makes fork tender, tasty beef au jus easy. You’ll hit the jackpot with this one!

ingredient: 2/3 cup red wine or pomegranate juice (160g)
2.4 kg chopped peeled ripe tomatoes (or 3 cans)
1/3 cup Qspice parmesan cheese or store-bought

directions.direction: If using Qspice melting cheese, prepare day prior.
﻿Saute first 5 ingredients on medium heat until caramelized.
﻿Deglaze with wine.
﻿Add tomatoes, garlic and bay leaf. Simmer 1 hour.
Meanwhile prepare eggplant. Brush rounds with mayonnaise, season with Qspice and sprinkle with Qspice parmesan cheese. Try our homemade mayonnaise! Refrigerate leftovers.
﻿Roast eggplant single layered on 2 parchment lined cookie sheets for 20 minutes @425F or until browned and liquid evaporated.
﻿Remove bay leaf from marinara sauce and rough puree with immersion blender.
﻿Stir in vinegar and basil.
﻿Spread 1/4 cup marinara sauce on bottom of large, greased casserole dish.
Layer half of eggplant rounds, 3/4 cup marinara sauce, 50g Qspice melting cheese, rest of eggplant rounds, 1 cup marinara sauce & 50g more Qspice melting cheese.
﻿Bake 25 minutes @375F
﻿Let rest 10 minutes before cutting.
Serve sprinkled with more Qspice parmesan cheese.

expertTips: 2 cups of your favourite store-bought marinara sauce can be substituted for homemade.
shortDescription: A layered casserole much like lasagna where eggplant takes the place of pasta. Roasted eggplant slices make our Italian-style eggplant parmesan lighter than most and tastes of self-love! What a great way to have a hearty meal without meat. The homemade marinara is a little work and worth the lively tomato flavour but there’s no shame in using your go-to jar marinara sauce.

ingredient: 1/3 cup hemp hearts or roasted sunflower seeds

directions.direction: ﻿Pulse all ingredients in food processor to desired fineness.
﻿Store in fridge.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique flavour and similarity to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: You don’t have to miss out on sprinkling parmesan cheese because you cut out dairy! Whip up this quick rendition that’s long been popular with vegans. Nutritional yeast is the natural source of umami cheese-like flavour and golden yellow colouring.

ingredient: 10 cups broth or Qspice Bouillon (2.5 L)

directions.direction: ﻿Sweat first 8 ingredients on high in instant pot.
﻿Add chicken, sausage, zucchini and okra and continue to saute until cooked.
﻿Stir in tomatoes, garlic and worcestershire sauce then cook out 5 minutes more.
﻿Add stock and rice and pressure cook on high 5 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
﻿Stir in corn, sriracha, paprika and vinegar then pressure cook 1 minute more.
﻿Stir in parsley and serve.
It's hearty and flavoursome on its own.. but oh so remarkable accompanied by a wedge of Skillet Cornbread!

expertTips: For a thicker broth, add 1 Tbsp raw quinoa when adding the rice.
Young and tender okra are 2-3 inches long. Find it fresh with the produce or frozen.
Sub 2 1/2 cups caulirice if you’re counting carbs.
*CHORIZO SAUSAGE MEAT* - 1 lb (454g) - Homemade sausage is simple and leaves out harmful additives and preservatives.
1/2 lb each - lean ground beef and pork (225g each)
3/4 tsp Qspice (3g)
1/8 tsp of each – celery salt, nutmeg & red chili pepper flakes
1/2 tsp of each – garlic powder, chipotle pepper & oregano
1/4 tsp of each – pepper, cumin, chili powder, onion powder & coriander
4 tsp white vinegar (20g)
Mix spice in a large bowl then stir in vinegar.  Add ground meat and blend well.  Use baby scoop to form meatballs then flatten into coins.
shortDescription:
There’s a melting pot of styles of gumbo but a hint of smoke, a bit of heat and a whole lot of flavour are standard! At the heart of our aromatic soup-stew characteristic of the Creole cuisine of Louisiana, is the humble holy trinity – bell pepper, celery and onions. Beyond its taste, the gooey nature of cut okra is highly desirable here as a natural thickener.

While you are at it, why not try your hand at homemade chorizo sausage meatballs? They go nicely in this recipe.

ingredient: 1 kg butternut squash, cleaned and quartered
3/4 tsp dried sage leaves or 1/2 tsp ground sage
4 cups vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon

directions.direction: ﻿Mist first 6 ingredients with olive oil & roast 40 mins @ 400F on parchment paper.
Make Flash-fried sage leaves. They garnish dishes with a toasty-warm crisp texture and more approachable flavour than fresh sage… a nice touch here.
﻿Let squash rest then peel skin.

﻿Add roasted ingredients with broth, nutmeg and more Qspice to pot and bring to simmer. Gently simmer 10 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
﻿Add warmed milk to soup and puree with emersion blender or in Vitamix.
﻿Ladle up the soup, garnish with fried sage leaves and enjoy!

expertTips: Make sure to warm milk in microwave otherwise it will split when you add it to the hot soup.
The immersion blender takes time to achieve a velvety texture but it’s less clean up than the Vitamix. Pick your poison!
shortDescription: Ultra-cozy butternut squash soup is fall in a bowl! Roasting these simple ingredients before making the soup is key to building that caramelized, deeply sweet flavour that we hanker for.

ingredient: or parsley (½ tsp flakes) to sub for cilantro

directions.direction: Try our homemade mayonnaise! Refrigerate leftovers.
Mix all recipe ingredients well and refrigerate up to 2 weeks.
Serve on crudites platter.

expertTips: See how to make the vegan version called fabonnaise in the Tips of our mayonnaise recipe.
Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
Tomato paste + maple syrup may be substituted with 3 Tbls ketchup (50g).

Brush Qspice Alldip on 60% steamed cauliflower or corn on the cob then finish grilling on bbq at medium heat for about 10 minutes turning a couple times.  This gives great flavour and the charred summer eats look.
Sub half the amount of mayonnaise with Greek yoghurt for a fresher tasting dip to go on vegetable platters.
Add crumbled blue cheese and let  sit for a couple hours for cheese flavour to infuse.  Serve with buffalo anything!
Add horseradish to make a dip for beef shishkebabs or meatballs.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique flavour and similarity to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: The dip of all dips; it also makes finger licking creamy coleslaw or devilled eggs a breeze! An ideal fondue dipping sauce… serve it with raw & cooked vegetables, shrimp cocktail, any cooked fish & meat, potatoes, bread, chips and crackers. Spread it on burgers, sandwiches or grilled bread. Add minced dill pickle and voila… best ever thousand island dressing.

ingredient: 2 medium sweet potatoes, thin wedge cut (600g)

directions.direction: Toss first 7 ingredients together then roast on parchment lined cookie sheet about 25 minutes @400F.
Meanwhile, mix next 5 in shallow roasting pan.
Slather trimmed  pork tenderloin  with Dijon then sprinkle with Qspice & sage.
Place pork in pan over sauce, increase oven to 425F and broast uncovered 25-30 minutes depending on desired doneness.
Let pork rest 6-7 minutes before cutting for juices to redistribute throughout the meat.

expertTips: It’s important that your roasting pan be large enough for the pork tenderloin to roast in a little braising liquid.  If there’s not enough room between tenderloins or the liquid comes up higher than a third the height of the pork tenderloins, it will steam or simmer in the liquid making it rubbery.  Use 2 roasting pans if need be.  I call this technique broasting and only use it for very tender cuts of meat.
Trichinosis is an antiquated disease so it’s perfectly safe to eat medium done pork now even though it freaks a lot of people out.

A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.
shortDescription: Quick cooking pork tenderloin is easy to keep juicy and couples nicely with sweet sage apple and tender potato. Here you have yourself a scrummy Sunday roast dinner without the fuss!

ingredient: 4 large Russet, Yukon Gold or Red potatoes (900g)

directions.direction: Scrub potatoes well and remove blemishes and eyes.

Score potato skins in tiny waffle pattern with a fork by firmly scraping all the way down the long side of the potatoes then down the short side turning as you go. The less texture you want, the more scoring is required.
Cube potatoes into 1" squares, cover with cold water in a pot, stir in salt.
Bring to a boil then cover and turn down to gently simmer - about 8 minutes or until soft.
Drain well and mash with add-ins.

expertTips: Waxy red or Yukon Gold potatoes make a buttery potato mash while russets make a fluffy one.
Why include the peel?  It has a lot of fiber and nutrients that offset the starchy flesh reducing the glycemic index of potatoes.  Our method makes the peel hardly detectable by texture.
shortDescription: Go the rustic route. We've figured out how to maintain the concentrated fiber and nutrients from the skin yet keep it real, without the chunks! Our scalable recipe with pure flavour is a total winner side dish as is but go ahead and change it up with add-ins like sour cream, cream cheese, chives, garlic, nutritional yeast, bacon bits or parmesan cheese.

directions.direction: Cover cashews with water and soak 8 hours
Drain cashews and blend in small smoothie cup with Qspice & coconut milk until velvety thick.
Let set 3 hours in refrigerator before using.

shortDescription: If you need to leave out the dairy, enter the cashew! This nut delivers a buttery-smooth consistency helping you whip up a voluptuous cream that swings both ways. Top sweet desserts and savoury dishes alike. Use wicked healthy coconut cashew cream for fresh fruit salad, berry crisp, hot breakfast cereal, vegetables, pasta, rice, potatoes, grilled meat, as a flatbread sauce or a rich layer in parfaits.

directions.direction: Start sauteeing lardons on medium high heat.
Add next 4 ingredients and saute another 5 minutes.
Take off stove & add spinach to wilt.
Meanwhile, mix cashew butter, mayonnaise, dijon & sryracha.
Add artichoke and mayonnaise mixture to pan and stir well.
Bake in parchment lined small cake pan 15 mins @375F.

expertTips: Lardons is simply short, thin strips of bacon.  For vegan, simply substitute with 1/2 Tbsp olive oil.
For appetizer, microwave large de-stemmed mushrooms to extract most of the liquid.  Then stuff mushroom caps with dip, sprinkle a little nutritional yeast on top and bake 12 minutes @375F.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: This dip usually gets demolished but don’t fret about it cooling off; it’s equally good at room temperature. Crackers and crusty bread handle this hardy scoop best.  Stuff artichoke spinach dip into mushroom caps for an exquisite appetizer!

directions.direction: Bloom Qspice & cumin in olive oil.
Add and sautee garlic, onion & pepper until browned a bit.
Stir in beans with aquafaba & simmer gently until reduced to 1/4 of original liquid (about 25 minutes).
Mash & set aside.
Meanwhile, put all salsa fresca ingredients in a manual food processor and give a few twirls (alternatively, small-chop everything by hand).
Set aside.
Mix all chorizo spices in a bowl, add ground meat and vinegar and blend well.
Fry in a pan just until no longer pink & set aside.
Meanwhile make tostadas; whisk eggs in a bowl, add water then whisk in cornmeal.
Whisk in Qspice, baking powder, salt, tapioca starch, almond flour & nutritional yeast.
Pour in 2 parchment lined 12″ pizza pans & bake @450F for 16 minutes. Watch my video below for the easiest way to parchment line pans.
Meanwhile, make mayonnaise (or use store-bought) then mix all ingredients for the elote and spread evenly on the blanched corn.
Once corn crust is cooked, reduce oven heat to 400F & roast corn on parchment lined cookie sheet about 10 minutes or until browned.
Meanwhile assemble tostadas by first spreading refried beans on the crust then sprinkle lettuce, chorizo, salsa, avocado and drizzle with mayonnaise.

expertTips: Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
Vegans use cooked brown lentils in the chorizo meat & sautee in olive oil with the rest of ingredients.  Then substitute chia eggs in the tostadas and make fabonnaise instead of mayonnaise.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
If dairy is part of your diet, plain Greek yoghurt can spread on the tostadas instead of mayonnaise for a fresher taste.
shortDescription:
Tostada is a Mexican staple food similar to pizza and elote is grilled street corn. Nothing here is difficult to make from scratch, but there are quite a few steps with a lot of spices. There’s always the grocery store with canned refried beans, a jar of salsa and pre-made chorizo sausage for backup. Although nothing compares with the cornmeal crust, tostada shells work.

It’s a meal you can prepare mostly ahead of time then assemble and heat when it’s time to come together and fiesta!

ingredient: 2 Tbsp red wine vinegar or pomegranate juice (32g)

directions.direction: Start rendering lardons in instant pot then add celery & onion halfway.
Cook well then remove to bowl and set aside.

Sear beef in olive oil & Qspice in instant pot.

NOTE: Making great stew is about proper searing and deglazing to keep the rich flavour the maillard reaction creates. Visit the link if you’re not sure about this technique.
Set aside with bacon and vegetables.
Cook out tomato paste in instant pot and add garlic, oregano, parsley, bay leaf & dill in last 2 minutes.
Deglaze with stock, lift fond, add back meat and vegetables and pressure cook on high 30 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Stir in caraway seed, paprika, potatoes, cabbage, beets, parsnip & carrots and pressure cook 10 minutes on high.
Stir in red wine vinegar, fresh dill and parsley.
Option to garnish with dollop of our homemade mayonnaise,  greek yoghurt or sour cream.
Reheat leftovers and serve over creamed polenta for a new meal.

expertTips: No problem if you don’t have an instant pot.  Just do everything the same in a heavy bottom pot stovetop only the cooking time changes.  Cover your pot and gently simmer beef for one hour then add vegetables and gently simmer 1 hour more.

The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Deglazing lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
Pomegranate juice has tannins just like red wine vinegar that add a complex undertone to the au jus.
Lardons is the French term for small matchstick-cut pieces of bacon.
shortDescription: We made a sophisticated beef stew with an amazing array of vegetables of the Ukrainian wintertime soup classic. It’s a deeply satisfying earthy bowl with a sweet-sour finish. The list is long but the ingredients are simple.

ingredient: 1 ½ Tbsp white or chickpea miso (42g)

directions.direction: Whisk first five ingredients well to make brine.
Crumble or small dice tofu.
Mix into brine and let marinade in fridge 8 hours.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique flavour and similarity to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Miso is traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with salt and rice or barley malt. Buy organic miso to avoid GMOs.
The meaty texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.
shortDescription: Finally, an alternative that tastes, crumbles and broils like real feta! Introducing my vegan feta cheese hack. Nowadays, just like eggs, the health benefits of organic soy products such as tofu, miso, yuba, tempeh, and edamame have been scientifically documented. So go ahead and change up your protein with some from plants.

directions.direction: Toss all ingredients in a microwave bowl.
Microwave on high for 1 minute, stir and cook 30 seconds more.
Sprinkle with nutritional yeast.

expertTips: Whether you're sauteing zoodles in a pan or microwaving them, remind yourself that your intention is merely to heat them up so they become pliable and not really to “cook” them.  Otherwise you may end up with a mushy mess of runny noodles!
When topping zoodles with sauce, olive oil can be omitted.

Baking zoodles at low heat on paper towels helps slowly release and wick away the moisture.
Line a baking sheet with a double layer of paper towels and then place the zoodles on top. Sprinkle with Qspice and bake for 30 minutes in a 215F preheated oven.  Transfer to bowls and drizzle with olive oil and nutritional yeast or sauce as usual.
shortDescription:
Convert zucchini into oodles of zoodles, something so much more than it was before! These low-carb noodles can be the star of so many dishes. They're a great way to reduce calories and get more veggies into meals from pastas to salads to stir-fries.

See my hack on how to bring zoodles closer to spaghetti noodle texture in third tip below.

directions.direction: Cut through all dates to make sure no pits remain then place in glass measuring cup or bowl.
Add boiling water & let sit 30 minutes.
Pour into food processor bowl & process on high for 2 minutes.
Scrap down sides and process until smooth & creamy.
