Store in small containers in the fridge up to a month or in the freezer indefinately.
Date paste doesn’t freeze solid making it easy to scoop exactly what you need for each recipe.

expertTips: The dates will get lighter in colour as you process them but will darken again once the puree sits.
This recipe makes 3 1/4 cups but can be halved.
shortDescription: Dates are the ultimate natural sweetener due to their fibre, nutrients and antioxidant content! Date paste is a fantastic alternative to table sugar and even agave in your recipes. Stir it in hot oatmeal, use it in baking and add it to smoothies and puddings. Did I mention it’s easy to make and stores well (see video)? Win-win.

directions.direction: Spritz prepared spaghetti squash rings (see instructions below) with olive oil and season with Qspice on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Roast at 400F 20 minutes.
In the meantime, grate zucchini and carrots.
Pull cooked spaghetti squash pulp from skin and separate into strands with a fork.
Heat olive oil in large skillet then add garlic, Qspice, thyme, carrot and zucchini.
Saute on medium high heat 5 minutes.
Combine spaghetti squash in and cook another 3 minutes.
Toss in nutritional yeast and parsley and serve.

expertTips:
To prepare your spaghetti squash into rings, remove the skin from both ends widthwise.   Then slice another 1” ring from each end which should give you access to the innards.  Clean out all the seeds and strings.  
Cut the rest of the squash into 1” rings using a sharp paring knife.  Pierce the squash and move downward until a ring is cut full circle.  Working your way around the skin of the squash this way takes a bit longer, but it’s easier than getting a big knife stuck halfway through a large squash and cutting yourself trying to force it all the way through.
shortDescription: All the rustic hues of this seasonal veggie dish really does dress up a table… and then you get to eat it! With Qspice and a dash of aromatics, these fall vegetables become sublime. If you're lucky enough to have leftovers, warm them up and enjoy them afresh topped with a fried egg.

directions.direction: Steam roast first 6 ingredient in parchment packet 25 mins @ 400F or until soft then let cool.
Puree all ingredients in Vitamix blender or in batches in large smoothie cup.
Chill 3 hours.

expertTips: The smoothie cup takes a bit more time but it’s less clean up than the Vitamix. Pick your poison!
shortDescription: Only high quality, ripe tomatoes and early-season tender sweet beets beget this refreshing chilled summer soup! Beet gazpacho is a stunning fuchsia side with a burger, sauce for pasta or coulis over fish and pork.

directions.direction: Grate florets in large bowl to catch schrapnel or rice them in the Trudeau manual food processor.
Drizzle oil and spices then mix well.
Roast @425F on large parchment lined cookie sheet 10 minutes stirring once.
Enjoy!

expertTips: A quick way to cook caulirice is to microwave it 3 minutes on high, fluff and serve.
Follow the exact instructions for broccorice but note that broccoli is less dense so 800g will measure just over 9 cups riced but will shrink when cooked and yield 4 cups just the same.
shortDescription: Caulirice, without exaggeration, hits the spot! For low carb diets, replace cooked caulirice cup for cup in all your usual recipes or stir it raw into tabbouleh, salads or gluten free pizza crust. Microwaving is the easiest way to cook caulirice producing a soft moist consistency while roasting it produces a more flavourful caulirice with a firm texture. No grating required; see my blog on the Trudeau manual food processor.

ingredient: ½ cup vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon (125g)

directions.direction:
Place all jam ingredients in small pot and simmer gently 30 minutes.

Note: Make our Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Stir in basil & set aside.
Whisk all bread ingredients in little bowl then pour into 4 greased 6″ ramekins.
Bake 10 mins @375F then let cool (or microwave on high for 90 seconds).
Cut bread in half making half moons and toast fully.
Spread all jam evenly on half moons then top with sliced avocado & sprouts.
Sprinkle with Qspice. Mmmmmmmm!
NOTE: Substitute store-bought bread, english muffin or bagel here. For a Mexican flare, make our corn tostada, for the base.

shortDescription: Jump back on the avocado toast train! If you think the brunch trend is passe, give this version a whirl. Sweet savoury tomato jam and mildly nutty sprouts dial it all in. And the polarizing contrast of crunchy toast, buttery ripe avocado and tender alfalfa sprouts takes you there again.

directions.direction: Spritz onion and eggplant halves with oil and sprinkle with Qspice then place flesh side down on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Roast in upper third of oven @500F for 30 minutes or until skin charred.
Flip eggplant flesh side up and let sit 10 minutes allowing steam to soften flesh.
Assemble the rest of the ingredients in the food processor then scoop out and add warm eggplant flesh with all the liquid.
Process only 30 seconds or so keeping some chunkiness with the creamy texture.
Drizzle with olive oil then serve at room temperature with crudites, crackers and pita bread.

expertTips: Garnish baba ganoush with toasted pine nuts and sumac or pomegranate seeds for festive occasions.
Charring the skin of the eggplant imbues the pulp with a smoky flavor.

Tahini is sesame butter commonly found in the ethnic aisle of the grocery store. If the oil has settled at the top of the jar, it needs to be re-incorporated and will be very stiff to stir. It’s well worth the muscle though; tahini also makes delectable salad dressings!

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
shortDescription: All hummus-ed out? Or need a free-for-all recipe to accommodate several diets? Baba ganoush to the rescue! Its name sounds intimidating but anyone can pull off this silky, smoky roasted eggplant dip. Beyond a healthful and tasty dip, savour baba ganoush spread on sandwiches, toast, flatbreads and in wraps or dolloped on eggs, poke bowls, pasta, potatoes and rice.

ingredient: ¼ cup coconut oil, room temp (70g)

directions.direction: Thaw frozen bananas in bowl to room temperature.
Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
Mix dry ingredients well.
Cream coconut oil in large bowl.
Beat in the rest of the wet ingredients in order.
Add dry ingredients and beat on low until just combined.
Bake in regular sized (9x5x2 ½”) parchment lined loaf pan 60 mins @ 350F. NOTE: Baking times vary from oven to oven - test carefully for doneness.

expertTips: This recipe works perfectly in 12 greased or lined muffin cups. And why not throw in a handful of chocolate chips while you are at it?! Only bake 30 minutes @ 350F.
Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the structure of this dough.

Peel overripe bananas and freeze some sliced and single layered on a cookie sheet then stash them into a plastic bag for later when you can blitz them into smoothies or stir them into hot porridge.  Others you can freeze whole for baking into muffins, breads and cookies.  To use frozen bananas in baking, completely thaw bananas in a bowl so not to lose any of the melted sweet syrup.
shortDescription: Elevate the ubiquitous banana bread from bit player to star! Ours is uber healthy while keeping the spongy, moist texture of the regular variety. The level of sweetness is partially due to using brown bananas, but did you know that freezing and thawing ripe bananas converts more of their starch into sugar leaving them even sweeter tasting!?  Feel good about having this ideal snack anytime.

ingredient: 1/4 tsp dried thyme leaves (1/8 tsp ground)

directions.direction: Put egg in small pot of water and bring to boil.
Time 10 minutes on gentle simmer.
Meanwhile wash and trim chicken livers of the membrane that connects the 2 lobes then cut each lobe in half. Let dry in colander.
Cool boiled egg in cold water then peel.
Heat oil on medium high heat then add onions and saute 2 minutes.
Add chicken livers and garlic to pan and saute until cooked - about 8 minutes. NOTE: Chicken livers still appear slightly rosey inside when fully cooked but shouldn't have any blood.
If not using store-bought, make our homemade mayonnaise while livers cool.
Add cooled livers, boiled egg and 3 Tbsp mayonnaise to 2-cup measuring cup.
Use immersion blender to process paté to desired smoothness then place in ramekin and refrigerate 1 hour.
Enjoy paté with crackers or crostini or make it lunch with a fresh baguette, condiments and sides like grilled fennel!

shortDescription: Chicken liver pate is a classic as an appetizer or on charcuterie boards, with a wonderfully smooth and gently rich flavour. I'm just gonna say it, although chicken liver is milder, nothing camouflages the taste of liver entirely. Liver is strong and bold and unapologetic about its place in the world of things that have tastes. People either love it or they learn to tolerate it in tasty recipes like our paté to benefit from the plethora of nutrients it supplies.

ingredient: 1 1/4 cup el dente brown lentils (225g total)

directions.direction: Brown first six ingredients on high heat about 7 minutes.
Whisk together the miso and vinegar, then drizzle on vegetables.
Stir garlic, chia, psyllium husk and parsley into vegetables and set aside.
Process next six ingredients to chunky crumb.
Add to vegetables and blend well.
Form into 10 – 1/2 inch thick patties and refrigerate 2 hours.
Bake on parchment lined cookie sheet for 50 mins at 350F turning once (or grill indoor in panini press on medium heat for 15 minutes). Let patties set-up 10 minutes before lifting from pan or grill.
Serve in bun, pita or lettuce leaves with Qspice Alldip and your favourite toppings and condiments.
Dig in!

expertTips: Patties keep in fridge for several days and freeze well.  Thaw in refrigerator overnight and follow same baking instructions as for fresh patties.
Larger patties will cook in the same amount of time as long as they are 1/2 inch thick.

Brown lentils are ideal for this recipe because they hold their shape well during cooking.  Gently simmer 1/2 cup raw brown lentils in 2 cups salted water for 18- 20 minutes.  Be careful not to overcook them as they turn mushy; they need to be a bit chewy.  Drain well.

Miso is traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with salt and rice or barley malt. Buy organic miso to avoid GMOs. Don’t do soy? Chickpea and rice based miso is similar in flavor and texture to white and yellow misos and can be used in the same repertoire of dishes.
Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the structure of this dough.
Use porcini powder like a spice and a little goes a long way.  Just grind dried porcini mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift.  Add larger bits to sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
Nothing ruins the flavour of food quicker than rancid flax. The off taste is very distinguishable; always taste flax meal before adding it to recipes.
shortDescription: ‘Where’s the beef?’ From the crunchy outside crust to the soft chew middle, our garden burger has perfect texture and lip-smacking savour to impress carnivores and vegans in one fell swoop! Browned eggplant skin imbues an essence of smoke rounding out the meaty taste throughout.

ingredient: 1 frozen recipe or 2 cups grated mozarella

directions.direction: If using Qspice melting cheese, prepare day prior.
Make pizza crust:  Whisk first 3 ingredients in order in bowl.
Blend in egg & set aside.
Sift 5 dry ingredients in another bowl, add to wet gel and form into dough.
Wrap in plastic and refrigerate while preparing pesto sauce.
Add all Qspice parmesan cheese ingredients in small smoothie cup and blend.
Add pesto ingredients to smoothie cup containing Qspice parmesan cheese and blend until tomato bits are evenly sized then set aside.
Divide dough in half and roll out 2 thin 10″ discs on parchment paper (or 4 balls and flatten in tortilla press) then slide onto two pizza pans with paper.
Bake 12 minutes @450F on pan on bottom oven rack.
Pull Qspice melting cheese out of freezer to somewhat thaw.
Take crusts out of oven, lightly spritz with olive oil and flip over.
Spoon pesto around edges of each pie dividing evenly and spread to centre.
Grate Qspice melting cheese evenly and directly over pizzas then bake another 12 mins (note: Qspice Melting cheese is not spreadable – it sticks immediately upon contact).

expertTips: To avoid a pizza soggy centre:
•do no use thin, runny sauce
•spread scant layer full-bodied sauce
•cover pizza evenly with sauce, Qspice Melting cheese & toppings starting at the edges working towards centre
•avoid topping heavily; less is more when using tasty, quality ingredients
•bake at bottom of oven

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: The important questions: what makes pizza a pizza? If you say crust, sauce and cheese but you can’t have gluten, sugar or dairy, this is your slice! Don’t let commercial pizza weigh you down. Master these basic pizza components – crisp thin crust, delectable pesto sauce and melty cheese made with real food – then go crazy with the umpteen topping options.

ingredient: 1 lb strip loin or tenderloin beef (454g)

directions.direction: Combine all dressing ingredients in a jar. Shake well.
Layer Vegetable ingredients in 4 large bowls.
Thinly slice beef. Stir fry beef with sesame oil over high heat seasoned with Qspice & Chinese 5 Spice to medium doneness.
Top bowls with beef, drizzle on dressing then garnish with cilantro & green onion.

expertTips: Replace kasha with any whole grain or legume like chickpeas, rice or quinoa.

Kasha typically refers to toasted buckwheat groats. It is steamed much the same way rice is but cooks in only 10 minutes. You can achieve a dry texture like rice or wet texture like oatmeal by adjusting the water to grain ratio.
Replace beef with any tender meat, fish or plant protein.
Hay-cut refers to a rough julienne cut which can be achieved with a mandolin or by hand.
shortDescription: An artfully loaded bowl of raw or roasted vegetables, whole grains, protein and robust dressing. For an impromptu buddha bowl, collect leftover bites and fresh tidbits of anything then marry the lot with our delectable sauce. The Buddha bowl is about balancing different types of food, not eating too much of any one thing and synonymous with nourishing meal.

ingredient: 1 cup broth or Qspice Chickeny Bouillon (250g)

directions.direction: Start hogao by sweating onion in olive oil 5 minutes.
Add six spices and bloom 1 minutes more.
Stir in tomato and garlic then cook out until pasty; about 12 minutes.
Mix in cilantro, green onion, raisins & olives & set aside in large bowl.
Sautee Qspiced beef in same pot until almost cooked.
Add broth, potatoes and saffron then simmer uncovered about an hour. Try our homemade Qspice Chickeny Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Meanwhile make dough by pureeing the beans and aquafaba in smoothie cup.
Stir in egg.
Mix dry ingredients together then add liquid.
Form dough, wrap in plastic & refrigerate 3 hours.
Combine cooked beef with hogao and let cool to room temperature.
Roll 17 – 40g balls from dough.
Flatten in plastic lined tortilla press then place dough disc on empanada press.
Place 2 Tbsp (50g) filling in centre then seal (see video)
Spritz with olive oil and bake 20 minutes @375 on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Serve on their own or spruce up with avocado slices and chimichurri aioli.

expertTips: Hogao is a paste flavour base for many Central American dishes.
Substitute 2 cups cooked brown lentils for ground meat for vegetarian.
Splitting this cooking project into two segments makes empanadas less daunting.  Prepare the filling and dough in the morning then fill and bake them late afternoon for dinner.
Aqua faba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas or beans. Vegans use it to make things like butter, mousse, cheese, mayonnaise and meringue.
Store bought puff pastry or egg roll wrappers are pre-made dough options.  Follow baking instructions on the package.
shortDescription: An empanada is effectively a savoury or sweet stuffed bread pocket. When baked, they come out like calzones and when fried they come out like samosas. Eaten as a snack or meal, this South American inspired beef recipe is the most popular in the Western hemisphere of the world. Having said that our scrummy little pies are a bit of work from scratch, they’re healthful and worth it! See my empanadas making hack.

ingredient: 1 tbsp fresh sage, minced - or 1 tsp dried leaves

directions.direction: ﻿Toss bread cubes in oil & Qspice.
﻿Toast 15 mins @ 350F.

﻿Meanwhile brown next 8 ingredients in large, heavy bottom pan for 10 minutes.

Optional: Make Flash-fried sage leaves to add a toasty-warm crisp texture and more approachable flavour than fresh sage.
﻿Beat egg with water & set aside.
﻿Deglaze vegetables with wine.
﻿Add bread, parsley & egg wash to pan and mix well.
Transfer mixture to greased casserole then bake 30 mins @375F removing lid for last 10 mins.

expertTips: Can be prepare day before, refrigerated and baked when needed.
Bacon grease instead of olive oil adds a smoky savoury element.

A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.

Dried leaves of herbs are different from ground dried herbs.  I prefer dried leaves because oxidation causes ground herbs to lose their potency and you never know how long it's been since that dried herb has been ground.  As a general rule of thumb, use half the amount of ground herbs when dried leaves are called for and conversely double the amount of dried leaves when a ground herb is called for.
shortDescription: A homey herb blend with tart sweetness of green apple and musty hazelnut crunch makes this dressing so much more than a stuffing for turkey! Move over meat, this earthy side will steal the spotlight of any roast dinner.

directions.direction: Saute onions in olive oil on medium heat for 2 minutes in large pot on medium heat.
Add rice flour and cook and stir 2 minutes more to make white roux.
Stir next 4 seasonings into almond milk.
Whisk almond milk into roux and bring to boil to thicken sauce. Take off heat.
Stir potatoes into white sauce then spread in parchment lined 9" round or 8" square casserole dish with lid.
Sprinkle nutritional yeast evenly over top.
Bake at 375F covered for 30 minutes.

shortDescription:
Why are they called scalloped potatoes? It's basically a definition for how the potato is sliced in thin rounds.

Uniformly cut potatoes mixed with seasoned onion cream sauce are layered in a casserole dish and baked. The result is savoury, creamy potatoes that are dairy-free in the most indulgent way! Bring elegance to any table while still maintaining a cozy character.

directions.direction: Whisk all ingredients well in bowl.
Heat lightly oiled cast iron pan to medium.
Pour about 1/4 cup batter in centre and quickly swirl out (same technique as crepes only thicker).
Cook about 2-3 minutes per side depending on thickness. They should be brown on the outside and no longer gluey in the centre.
Keep in warming oven with parchment separating each naan while you grill the rest.

expertTips: Use only full-fat real coconut milk here. Tetra packs are processed beverage products with coconut milk added and will not work in this recipe.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
Once you have the feel for how these cook up, get two pans going at once to speed up the process.
For larger groups or crispier naan, brown the naan 2 minutes each side then single layer them on cookie sheets and finish baking them all at once in a 400F oven for about 3 minutes.
shortDescription: Incredible comfort food in minutes!  Stack up crisp and tender pan-fried naan or adapt the instant batter for gluten free wrappers - taquitos, empanadas, spanakopita, perogies and samosas. They’re best eaten hot off the grill and once you get the knack, will become a staple for all your flatbread occasions.

directions.direction: For pizza, whisk eggs then add milk (see focaccia bread instructions in TIPS)
Sift dry ingredients then whisk into wet until incorporated.
Pour into 14” parchment lined pizza pan and spread to desired thickness. Watch the video below for my easiest trick ever to line pans with parchment.
Bake 10-12 mins @425 F depending on thickness.
Flip crust over, top with sauce, cooked toppings & cheese.
Bake another 8-10 mins.

expertTips: To make plain focaccia, sub rosemary for Italian seasoning & bake in one parchment lined 9″ cake pan for 14 minutes. Spritz with olive oil hot out of the oven then cut into wedges for a side with soups and salads or with bread dipper.
Bump up the flavour of your focaccia by adding chopped black olives & sun dried tomatoes to the batter.
To make flatbread, bake in 2 parchment lined 9″ cake pans for 12 minutes.  Brush with garlic olive oil while hot.  Makes scrumptious bruschetta.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
shortDescription: Besides being quick and easy, flatbread is adaptable for pizza crust or focaccia. Conventional pizza lovers give our crust the thumbs up! The versatility of this bread crust keeps you returning to it time and again and you may never buy croutons once you’ve had homemade ones. Click the video below to view my parchment paper lining hack.

ingredient: 1 Tbsp powdered sugar or 1/4 tsp stevia - optional

directions.direction: Preheat oven to 375F.
Beat eggs then incorporate date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
Whisk in rest of ingredients except fruit – batter will be runny.
Grease or parchment line 9″ flan dish.
Single layer berries on bottom then cover with batter.
Bake about 35 minutes & let set 7 minutes before cutting.

Option to sprinkle stevia or powdered sugar for garnish.

NOTE: Stevia is a natural non-caloric sweetener that’s an increasingly popular alternative to artificial sweeteners and table sugar. Read more about stevia.

expertTips: Substitute blueberries with fresh pitted, halved cherries or raspberries.
shortDescription: Clafoutis, an elegant flan to savour summertime fruit. This simple and rustic fruit-studded dessert with a texture that hovers between cake and custard is served lukewarm with an optional light dusting of powdered sugar. There's a blurred line here where clafoutis consists of all the usual pancake suspects - eggs, flour, milk and fruit - and has healthy brunch written all over it!

directions.direction: Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Use focaccia for gluten free croutons.
Drizzle olive oil and stir well until all cubes are well coated.
Spread single layered on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Bake 10-15 minutes @350F. Stale bread will brown faster than fresh – keep an eye on them.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique flavour and similarity to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Homemade croutons are unsung garnish heroes! There is no comparison between the commercial variety and fresh croutons toasted in your own oven. Spruce up soups, scrambled eggs and salads with little crispy crunches of flavour.

ingredient: 18 pearl button mushrooms or 150g sliced mushrooms
½ Tbsp chopped dill or ½ tsp dried dill

directions.direction: Mix all ingredients except ground beef for meatballs then incorporate beef.
Scoop mixture with tiny trigger-release scoop (#60 / 15 ml / 1 1/4″ diameter) and release 46 baby meatballs onto parchment lined cookie sheet.
Roast 8 minutes @ 450F then set aside.
Meanwhile, saute pearl onions and button mushrooms with olive oil & Qspice until golden.
Add garlic & porcini powder, pepper flakes for 30 seconds then tomato paste & stir for another minute to cook out.
Deglaze fond with sherry & worcestershire sauce.
Add bay leaf, water & coconut milk & simmer 15 minutes to reduce.
Add meatballs & gently simmer another 5 minutes.
Stir in parsley, lemon juice, dill & paprika.
Serve over rice pasta with steamed peas or broccoli.

expertTips: For vegan version use seitan.

The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Deglazing lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
Meatballs don’t have to be time consuming unless there’s a law against them being dome shaped?  Just scoop the mixture, level against the side of the bowl and release onto baking sheet; repeat.

To substitute sirloin cap strips for meatballs, simply season them with Qspice and sear in olive oil first. Then in same pot carry on with the recipe at the sauteing onions and mushrooms step. And add a tsp dijon with the tomato paste.

I use porcini powder like a spice and a little goes a long way.  Just grind dried porcini mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift.  Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
shortDescription: There are countless variations of this popular dish that over the years has spread around the world. Create a luxurious meal minus the effort by using pearl onions and pearl button mushrooms then delight in popping velvety smothered mini meatballs into your mouth.

directions.direction: Place all ingredients in food processor and process to desired coarseness.
Drizzle olive oil on top to serve with crudites, pita wedges and crackers.

expertTips: Pomegranate syrup is simply a reduction much like the fruity balsamic.  The commercial version has sugar but you can easily make your own when pure pomegranate juice goes on sale.  Simmer 1 cup of juice + 1 t Qspice 30-40 minutes until reduced to 1/3 or 1/4 of the volume you started with.  Cool, bottle & refrigerate.
Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
shortDescription: It’s micro nutrient packed yumminess made even better with early-season tender beets! Deep fuchsia roast beet hummus is as sweet for a holiday dip as it is for a summertime staple!

directions.direction: Sweat shallot in olive oil.
Add & saute berries & Qspice until they start bursting.
Add last 5 BBQ sauce ingredients & simmer 50-60 minutes; to desired thickness.
Meanwhile, remove the silver skin from the pork tenderloin (see instructional video in description), spritz with olive oil & season with Qspice.
Roast uncovered 5 minutes @ 450F then reduce to 400F for about 18 minutes or to an internal temperature of 145F (done medium). Let rest 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, use emersion blender to puree blueberry BBQ sauce to desired consistency.
Slice pork in one inch coins and top with sauce.
Serve with roasted beets, carrots and fingerlings and a greens salad with Qspice vinaigrette.

expertTips: Trichinosis is an antiquated disease so it’s perfectly safe to eat medium pork now even though it freaks a lot of people out.
For a slight change, 1 small clove of minced garlic can be added after the blueberries pop.
shortDescription: Basic cooking skills garner a gourmet meal your guests will rave about! And the affordability of pork tenderloin makes it a good choice when feeding larger dinner parties. This recipe doubles easily and our blueberry BBQ sauce is equally memorable on grilled chicken.

ingredient: -or any gluten free pasta like quinoa or rice

directions.direction: Sweat first 3 ingredients 5 minutes.
Add next 6 ingredients & saute until cooked – about 15 mins.
Deglaze with wine and cook off 5 mins.
Add tomatoes and cook out 15 mins more.
Heat almond milk in microwave to temper it then add it with a pinch nutmeg to the sauce and simmer gently 40 mins uncovered.
Serve over noodles sprinkled with nutritional yeast.

expertTips: Take all the time called for in the recipe… this builds flavour body.

A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.
For vegan, use ground round of preference or cooked brown lentils.

I use porcini powder like a spice and a little goes a long way.  Just grind dried porcini mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift.  Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Be mindful of three subtle differences for successful cooking  of gluten free pasta:
•stir every 30 seconds in the first 3 minutes of simmering: noodles stick together easier because they contain more starch.
•cook to exactly al dente: pasta will fall apart if it’s over cooked.
•do not let sit in colander: the carry over cooking will leave you with a ball of mush.
shortDescription: Not your run-of-the-mill spaghetti sauce, this classic Italian ragu includes minced vegetables and is finished with milk. While you’re at it, take a break from your usual pasta and give different noodles a twirl. If the comfort of a starchy bowl is called for, boil up some whole grain pasta but if you’re needing tasty lightness, have vegetable noodles. And who can say what might happen if you mix half and half?!

directions.direction: Make Qspice Bouillon if you haven't purchased any.
Mix all ingredients in a shaker bottle.
Serve with your favourite dipping bread. NOTE: Our focaccia is gluten free and simple to make!

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

Pour only a thin layer in a shallow dish so people can sop up more or less.  Keep replenishing.  Alternatively, give your guests their own appetizer plates and put out the bottle of dipper with a basket of bread punks.  You shake and pour the first round.
shortDescription:
Nothing beats this Italian restaurant favourite and now you can enjoy the quintessential appetizer at home! Jazz up your best olive oil and balsamic vinegar and grab a fresh-baked baguette for dipping.

I give you the base recipe… what you do with it is your business! I love this dipper with punks of focaccia and a charcuterie board. It also doubles nicely as a marinade for tofu, meat and vegetables.

directions.direction: Press mashed potatoes into greased 9″ deep pie plate.
Bake 30 minutes @350F.
Meanwhile, whisk eggs with almond milk, dijon, sage, Qspice & nutritional yeast.
Arrange all leftovers over hot crust.
Pour egg mixture over everything and bake another 30 minutes or until set.
Let stand 10 minutes, cut into 6 wedges and drizzle with warmed gravy.
Serve with spinach, pecan and dried cranberry salad dressed with Qspice Vinaigrette.

expertTips: Any leftover roast, vegetables and mashed potatoes works in this recipe following the 2 1/4 cups measure for the filling.
Sub nutritional yeast with 1 Tbsp parmesan cheese.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Quiche is the happiest ending for any leftovers! You will hardly recognize your turkey dinner in this egg pie with mashed potato crust.

directions.direction: Add first 5 ingredients to 2 cup measuring cup or mason jar.
Place immersion blender at the very bottom and slowly add olive oil while blending to emulsify and thicken.
Refrigerate until use.

expertTips: Douse meat, fish, vegetables or tofu with buffalo sauce then roast.
Saute ground meat and minced vegetables with buffalo sauce for salad, pasta or flatbread topper.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Buffalo sauce is basically a jazzed up perennial hot sauce that makes everything perfect… if that’s your culture. Our buffalo sauce made with Qspice and olive oil is a game changer! Drizzle, dunk and dip to your heart’s delight.

ingredient: 1 Tbsp olive oil or bacon lard (15g)

directions.direction: Sautee brussels sprouts, carrot, onion, garlic, Qspice & coriander in olive oil until browned.
Try our homemade mayonnaise.
Mix all ingredients together.
Use medium ice cream scoop to place on parchment lined cookie sheet & flatten a bit.
Bake 20 mins at 450F.
Drizzle with Qspice Alldip.

expertTips:
Any cruciferous vegetable works in this recipe. What the heck are those?
Arugula. Bok Choy. Broccoli. Brussels Sprouts. Cabbage. Cauliflower. Collard Greens. Kale.
Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!
shortDescription: Traditionally bubble & squeak patties were made to neatly dispense the Sunday roast leftover mashed potatoes, ends of cheese and vegetables. These scrumptious fritters are the perfect side for breakfast, lunch or dinner. A drizzle of Qspice Alldip goes a long way to camouflage the fact that you’re eating vegetables!

ingredient: 1 cup vegetable broth or Qspice Chickeny Bouillon

directions.direction: Soak cashews in water at least 4 hours then drain.
Sear chicken seasoned with Qspice in olive oil in batches & set aside.
In same pot, bloom ginger, chilli powder, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, cumin, curry leaves & red pepper flakes in coconut oil.
Add garlic, onion, celery, carrot & bell peppers with 1/2 Tbsp Qspice and sautee on medium heat until vegetables are sweating and fond is lifting from the bottom.
Add tomatoes & soaked cashews then cook out for 10 mins.
Add chicken broth or Qspice Chickeny Bouillon let simmer another 10 mins more then puree to desired texture with immersion blender (for silky smooth gravy, puree in vitamix style blender).
Submerge chicken & simmer gently 1 hour covered.
Temper mayonnaise then add with peas & almond milk & simmer another 10 mins.
Finish gravy by stirring in cilantro & lemon juice.
Serve over rice with a head of roast cauliflower.

expertTips: Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.

Curry leaves are an herb and they are not related to curry powder.  Curry powder is a blend of different spices which likely does not include curry leaves.   When fried in oil, they release a delicious, nutty aroma and will bring non-butter chicken over the top!  Buy them at Indian or Asian markets and freeze them.

Tempering is the process where hot liquid is slowly added to other foods that need to be incorporated into hot sauce or soup without curdling.  In this case, it slowly raises the temperature of the eggs in the mayonnaise so they don’t coagulate.
Substitute roast paneer, young green jackfruit, eggplant and/or tofu for vegan version of this recipe.

The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Sweating vegetables on medium heat afterwards slowly lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
shortDescription: While the famous butter chicken was concocted accidentally with leftover tandoori chicken, this revamped, buttery vegetable-cashew gravy is intended to surprise all categories of foodies; tasting is believing! There are many ingredients and several steps to this big batch so why not invite company to share it or freeze some?

ingredient: 2 lbs chorizo sausage meat or ground pork (900g)
½ head red or green cabbage, small diced (700g)

directions.direction: Make chorizo sausage meat if using homemade (instructions below in Chef's Tips).
Sautee first 4 ingredients until cooked.
Add next 8 ingredients and cook out to bloom spices.
Add cauliflower and cabbage and sweat out 5 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes, water & caraway then simmer gently uncovered 30 minutes.
Stir in parsley and paprika & let stand 10 minutes before dishing up.

expertTips: For more traditional cabbage roll taste use straight up lean ground pork meat.
For vegan variety, sub ground meat for crumbles extra firm tofu in chorizo sausage meat recipe below. Let marinade 3 hours.
For a more substantial meal, scoop mashed potatoes or steamed rice atop the hash.

To adapt for instant pot, simply sautee everything on high in instant pot in the same stages as directions for the stovetop. Then pressure cook on high 10 minutes (instead of simmering 30 minutes) allowing the pot to do its regular pressure build and steam release cycles. Stir in parsley and paprika after lid releases.
*CHORIZO SAUSAGE MEAT* - 2 lbs (900g) - Homemade sausage is simple and leaves out harmful additives and preservatives.
1 lb each - lean ground beef and pork (454g each)
1/2 Tbsp Qspice (6g)
1/4 tsp of each – celery salt, nutmeg & red chili pepper flakes
1 tsp of each – garlic powder, chipotle pepper & oregano
1/2 tsp of each – pepper, cumin, chili powder, onion powder & coriander
3 Tbsp white vinegar (40g)
Mix spice in a large bowl then stir in vinegar.  Add ground meat and blend well.
shortDescription:
A medley that offers all the elements of classic cabbage rolls without the hassle! Basic at its core, our modern adoption calls for highly aromatic caraway seeds to muddle the chorizo’s heat revealing a flavour stunner. Cabbage is brimming with glutamine and vitamin C helping protect against the common cold.

This recipe freezes and halves nicely. While you are at it, why not try your hand at simple homemade chorizo sausage?!

ingredient: 150g baby kale (or thin sliced dinosaur kale)

directions.direction:
Make Qspice Caesar Dressing by layering first ten ingredients in 1 cup measuring cup.

NOTE:  If you like lots of dressing on your salad, make a full recipe and reserve leftover in the fridge. Nutrition data is based on 2 Tbsp (32g) each salad.
Place immersion blender in very bottom pulsing to start then slowly lifting head as dressing thickens.
Stir in pepper, parsley and water (more water or less water depending on preferred thickness) then refrigerate while preparing the salad.
Flatten chicken thighs to even thickness, season with Qspice, garlic salt & pepper then grill or roast @450 about 12 minutes (less time for smaller, thinner thighs).
Arrange salad ingredients in order then top with warm chicken thighs.
Dollop dressing among 4 salads.

expertTips: Robust flavour and juiciness of chicken thighs are sure to win over chicken breast lovers.  Note however that doneness tests are different.  For a chicken breast, you look for the meat to change colour from pink to white. But the dark meat of chicken thighs looks pinkish brown even when they are thoroughly cooked.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Construct this classic salad at home with creamy fresh tangy Qspice Caesar Dressing. Dressing is pivotal to salads and ours is bursting with savour! If you’re looking to step up your caesar salad, plump cherry tomatoes, buttery ripe avocado and crisp umami bacon will do the trick.

ingredient: 1/4 tsp sea salt or black salt
1 Tbsp minced parsley (1 tsp dried flakes)

directions.direction:
First make Qspice Lemono Sauce. Layer first 11 ingredients in order in a tall cup then blend with immersion blender starting at bottom.

NOTE: Top switch it up, substitute 2 1/2 cups of any pasta sauce. Try making our Bolognese Sauce
Stir in parsley then set aside.
Boil salted water then simmer pasta 3 minutes less than called for.
Add carrot noodles and bring back to simmer then start timing 2 minutes.
Add zoodles & peas, bring back to simmer and time 1 last minute.
Drain and immediately stir in sauce then let sit 5 minutes to thicken.

expertTips: Any kind of pasta can be used being mindful of cooking time.
Take this dish to the top by swapping out the zoodles for julienned asparagus.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Pasta and vegetable noodles are not an either-or proposition; they happen to work wonders together! Vegetable noodles mingle seamlessly with pasta filling your bowl with a decent portion of vegetables. Twirling saucy vegetables around a fork and stuffing a big bite in your mouth is a more enjoyable experience than stabbing a chunk. Elegant canoodles are unanticipated and smothered in our Qspice Lemono Sauce, just as satisfying as a big bowl of buttery pasta.

directions.direction: Blend Qspice buffalo sauce.
Cut tofu into about 3/4 x 3/4 x 2 inch sticks.
Marinade 3-4 hours in fridge.

Bake 15 minutes @425F on parchment lined cookie sheet or grill 10 minutes @ 500F turning 3 times to brown all sides. Alternatively you can also grill in George Foreman-style grill on high for 5-6 minutes.
Serve with carrot and celery sticks.

expertTips: The meaty texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

The result is an addictive finger food that tastes a lot like the classic bar staple,  Buffalo wings; especially when you dunk them into Qspice Alldip spiked with crumbled blue cheese.

ingredient: 1/4 tsp sea salt or black salt
1 Tbsp minced parsley (1 tsp dried flakes)

directions.direction: Layer all ingredients except parsley in order in a tall cup then blend with immersion blender starting at bottom.
Stir in parsley.

expertTips: If you have aquafaba, it gives this sauce an elusive nuttiness.
Qspice lemono sauce keeps in the fridge one week… but there’s no way you will be able to abstain from it!

Toss pasta first with one recipe Qspice lemono sauce then 1 diced small english cucumber, 1/3 cup small diced red onion, 1 1/2 cups halved cherry tomatoes, 1 diced green pepper, 1 tsp Qspice & 1/4 tsp dried oregano. Let sit in fridge 4 hours for flavours to penetrate the pasta.  To serve, refresh the salad by tossing with olive oil and more Qspice if needed then garnish with 2 Tbsp chopped parsley, 1 cup tofeta and 16 black olives to serve.  Opa!

shortDescription: Qspice Lemono Sauce is much greater than the sum of its humble ingredients! This raw Greek sauce punches everything up instantly, and did I mention it takes 5 minutes to make? It’s a staple flavouring for rice, quinoa, potatoes, pasta, eggs, vegetables, fish, seafood, meat, poke bowls and all things salad. See my best ever Greek pasta salad recipe in TIPS below.

directions.direction: Make our homemade mayonnaise. Refrigerate leftovers.

Mix first 9 ingredients and spoon evenly atop salmon fillets.

NOTE: For the tails of salmon fillets fold the thin side under to even out thickness, achieving more consistent doneness throughout.
Bake on parchment lined cookie sheet @425F about 10-12 mins depending on thickness. Broil top 2 mins more.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Twenty minutes to elegant and tasty salmon… no muss, no fuss! The mayonnaise promises an intently browned cap with a flaky moist centre.

ingredient: 4 cups vegetable stock or Qspice Bouillon

directions.direction: Caramelize onion, fennel, celery & mushrooms with olive oil and Qspice in soup pot – takes about 30 minutes.
Add garlic & thyme in last 5 minutes of caramelizing vegetables.
Add lemon juice & stock then gently simmer 10 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Warm milk in microwave then add to soup pot.
Immersion blend to silky texture or puree in Vitamix.
Stir in parsley.
Serve with Qspice croutons or crackers.

expertTips: The immersion blender takes time to achieve a velvety texture but it’s less clean up than the Vitamix. Pick your poison!
shortDescription: Fennel takes on a whole other personality when cooked. Slow browning vegetables is a fuss-worthy culinary technique that releases their natural sugar leaving sweet nutty flavour here. Harmony is created in this soup with earthy mushrooms and bright lemon.

directions.direction: Cut Cauliflower into golf ball sized florets
Mix first 5 ingredients with electric beaters.
Slowly stream in olive oil beating constantly to bind ingredients and thicken sauce.
Toss florets in sauce and roast @400 uncovered for 30 mins.

expertTips: Make sure cauliflower is completely dry otherwise sauce gets diluted and doesn’t stick.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

To roast the whole head, rinse cored cauliflower & thoroughly let drain.  Turn core side up & drizzle in half buffalo sauce then brush rest on top side.  Bake core side down in covered casserole 30 mins @ 375 F then roast uncovered for another 30 mins (or to desired softness).  Rest 7 mins to allow moisture to redistribute.
shortDescription: Addictive and secretly healthy, this tender white vegetable is perfect for taking on any flavour you throw at it. Discover that it’s more about the sauce than what you douse in it with these spicy little bites!

ingredient: 1 cup vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon
2 cups mixed frozen or fresh chopped vegetables

directions.direction: Make citrus-scented rice recipe.
Melt coconut oil and bloom next 7 ingredients.
Add onion & sweat.
Add tomato & cook out 5 mins.
Add vegetables & broth then simmer 5 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Add rice and caraway then cover to steam 5 minutes.
Garnish with toasted cashews, a squeeze of lemon & chopped cilantro.
Serve with fresh cut cucumber, peppers and cherry tomatoes.
Naan Bread goes famously with biryani.

expertTips: Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
You can add any cooked meat at the same time as you add the rice to the pot.
Garam Masala is a staple blend of spices used in Indian cuisine – the equivalent of Chinese 5 spice.
shortDescription: Biryani is an Indian one-pan rice dinner that starts with steamed rice and can take in a melting pot of ingredients. The bloomed spices emit grand aroma that announces biryani to the whole house and has them smacking their lips in anticipation!

ingredient: ½ Tbsp fine grated lemon zest (4g)

directions.direction:
Saute rice a couple minutes in coconut oil & Qspice to toast.

NOTE: Any type of rice can be used in this recipe once you learn how to get the proper ratio of water to rice.
Add water & lemon peel and bring to boil.
Put tight fitting lid on, reduce heat to lowest and steam 15 minutes.
Make sure rice is cooked then turn off heat.
Sprinkle with lemon juice and parsley and cover.
Let sit 20 minutes more.
Fluff & serve.

expertTips: Substitute lime and cilantro for the lemon & parsley to accompany Spanish food.
shortDescription: Universal rice is now a thing… here’s the recipe! Make a double batch to have an excellent leftover base for fried rice (video worth watching if only once). The secret to perfect rice every time starts with the right ratio of liquid to rice, steaming at consistent low heat without peeking and finally allowing it to rest covered before fluffing with a fork.

ingredient: 4 gluten-free slices of bread or bagel halves

directions.direction: Gently simmer eggs 6 minutes for soft yolks.
Meanwhile, halve and pit avocado, scoop flesh and slice thinly.
Toast bread.
Peel eggs.
Spread each toast with 1/4 alfalfa sprouts, smoked salmon, avocado slices and half an egg.
Sprinkle with Qspice and capers. Savor a bite!

shortDescription:
Easiest ever, our bagel-and-lox-inspired open-faced sandwich should convince you to brunch at home!

﻿It combines avocado, smoked salmon and sprouts dappled with boiled egg and briny capers. Buttery avocado takes the place of cream cheese while Qspice brings everything into balance.

ingredient: 1 lb white sea bass, shrimp or halibut
¼ cup ginger ale or soda (60g)
2 Tbsp minced poblano or green pepper (30g)

directions.direction: Coagulate fish in lime juice one hour then drain.
Mix in remaining ingredients and serve with taco chips or crackers for finger food or in avocado boats over greens as a meal.

expertTips: Substitute fish with chopped young green jackfruit or mushrooms for vegan version.
shortDescription: Ceviche is raw seafood or fish “cooked” by lemon or lime juice. The acid in the citrus juice denatures the proteins in the fish, causing it to become opaque and producing a firm texture. Now don’t wrinkle your nose… it’s invigoratingly delicious as long as you use the freshest of ingredients! Ceviche is equally appreciated as a finger food, appetizer or salad. One made with fresh white sea bass is a favourite.

ingredient: 3 apples or pears - cored and thin sliced (500g)

directions.direction: Mix first 4 ingredients in order & set aside.
Cream coconut oil then beat in psyllium gel.
Sift dry ingredients then incorporate into wet to form dough.
Wrap dough in plastic and refrigerate.
Meanwhile, saute fruit in pan with coconut oil to brown.
Add spices and bloom a bit.
Stir in water & syrup then cook out 10 minutes to soften fruit and create glaze.
Stir in vanilla & lemon juice & let cool until just warm.
Roll out, fill and bake galettes for 30 minutes @375F.
Enjoy with ice cream.

expertTips: Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the structure of this dough.
Fruit may be added with or without peel.  Eating whole fruit is a healthy approach to weight management.
shortDescription: Galette is any round or free-form tart enfolding sweet or savoury fillings. Distinctly elegant, this easy rustic pie is a great choice when you find yourself with a bounty of peak season produce. In reality, galettes are one of the easiest homemade pastry items once you learn one of my favourite hacks to get the dough thin and even in seconds… the tortilla press!

directions.direction: Soak 8 skewers in water.
Make Qspice Buffalo Sauce by adding first 5 ingredients to 2 cup measuring cup or mason jar.
Place immersion blender at the very bottom and slowly add olive oil while blending to emulsify and thicken.
Marinate shrimp with 1 cup buffalo sauce for 1 hour.
Meanwhile fill celery ribs with blue cheese, cut into 4 sticks each and refrigerate.
Grill shrimp on high heat about 2 minutes per side.
Plate shrimp and celery sticks together and put out extra buffalo sauce for those who like it hot.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Juicy shrimp with all the buffalo zest and spice brings the vintage appetizer of crunchy celery filled with creamy, pungent blue cheese up to speed! Easy does it for these outstanding nibbles that are the first to go at any gathering.

directions.direction: Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
Beat first 5 ingredients together until smooth.
Add next 3 dry ingredients and combine well.
Incorporate pecans & cherries into dough.
Drop with small trigger-release ice cream scoop (#60 / 15 ml / 1 1/4″ diameter) onto parchment lined cookie sheets.
Press hole in centre with floured rolling pin handle.
Bake 20 mins @ 350F.
Mix filling ingredients and let cool to room temperature while cookies are cooling.
Drizzle chocolate in centre of cookies and let set.

expertTips: Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago, I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
shortDescription: One smart cookie… Make and share these dark chocolate dotted gems with your sweeties!

ingredient: 1-20oz can young green jackfruit in brine, drained

directions.direction: Pull apart jackfruit with a fork.
Mix dressing ingredients in medium bowl.
Add jackfruit and rest of salad ingredients except lettuce to dressing. Blend well.
Let stand in fridge an hour or so to get cold.
Serve in lettuce cups (or any of the suggested alternative options in the description at the top).

expertTips: If it isn't obvious, 2 1/2 cups of shredded cooked chicken is a fantastic sub for the jackfruit in this recipe.
shortDescription:
Meet young jackfruit. Have you tried this funky-looking canned fruit before? Demystify this bland fruit with our waldorf inspired Jackfruit "Chicken" Salad Lettuce Wraps. When you pull it apart, you end up with something resembling shredded chicken that takes on any flavour it mingles with.

This classic mixture doesn't have to be served in lettuce cups. Spread it on crackers or rice cakes, pile it on salads, and tuck it between two slices of bread. It's great any way you serve it!

directions.direction: Mix psyllium husk, water and vinegar in small bowl and set aside.
Combine both flours and salt then set aside.
Cream coconut oil in another bowl.
Beat in egg, then psyllium gel.
Incorporate flour mixture into wet ingredients forming a dough.
Shape dough into a disk, wrap in plastic then refrigerate 1 hour.
Meanwhile, blend filling ingredients together in order.
Roll dough out making 8”x12” rectangle then top with filling.
Roll into a log from long side and cut 1” discs.
Bake pinwheels on parchment-lined cookie sheet 20 minutes @ 375F (may take longer – oven to oven is different).

expertTips: Filling needs to be tepid to spread well. If too hot, the filling will melt the dough and if too cold, it will tear the dough.

Alternate lemon poppyseed filling: Mix together 
1/3 cup liquid honey (150g)
pinch Qspice
1 Tbsp fine lemon rind (about 1 lemon)
2 Tbsp coconut (12g)
1 tsp poppyseeds (4g)
Fill with soft Nutella if nothing else.
Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the structure of this dough.
shortDescription: Growing up, this shortcut cinnamon roll was made with rerolled pie crust trimmings after other holiday pies were created. Our simple cinnamon pinwheels recipe cleans up well! It’s a quick fix for pastry cravings with different filling options.

ingredient: 8 cups chicken broth or Qspice Bouillon
2 cups cooked white fava beans -398ml can, drained
½ cup small pasta, quinoa ditalini or orzo (100g)

directions.direction: Sear first 3 ingredients on high saute in batches in 6L instant pot.
Deglaze with broth or try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Pressure cook on low 10 minutes.
Do natural pressure release.
Add vegetables, pasta and beans and pressure cook on low another 10 minutes.
Stir in spinach, parsley and lemon juice then serve with a punk of bread.

expertTips: The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Sweating vegetables on medium heat afterwards or deglazing with liquid slowly lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
Chicken Fagioli can be made on the stovetop in a soup pot following the exact instructions only gently simmer chicken covered for 30 minutes then add vegetables and slowly cook another hour covered.
shortDescription: Extra flavourful comfort food and one of the best rustic stews you’ll ever find! Make any cold day better… think snowy winter or rainy summer. Traditionally this dish focuses on pasta and beans but here, chicken and vegetables are the stars.

ingredient: 1 lb thin sliced pork loin strips (454g)
1-540 ml can drained red kidney beans (365g)

directions.direction: Marinade pork 8 hours.
Steam rice as usual. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Blend chimichurri ingredients in large smoothie cup.
Stir fry pork over high heat to medium done.
Layer in order rice, beans, pepper, cabbage, pork, tomatoes and jalapenos.
Douse with chimichurri sauce and serve with chips.

expertTips: Substitute the rice for shaved lettuce and mix the chimichurri sauce and mayonnaise 3:1 ratio to make a salad dressing and voila… a fresh summer salad.
Mix half mayonnaise into avocado chimichurri for a dip or burger condiment.
Marinade tofu, young green jackfruit, eggplant or mushrooms for the vegan version of this recipe.
shortDescription: The name is a combination of chicharron (fried pork skins) and frijoles (beans); it’s two main ingredients. The dish is lined with rice, topped with salad add-ons and drizzled chimichurri. Like most Costa Rican fare, chifrijo is nutritionally well rounded and cooked from scratch from fresh ingredients. Chimichurri is a raw herb sauce that’s rich in antioxidants and a superfood of dressings. This translation is a mild, tasty dose of Central America!

directions.direction: Add dates to 24oz smoothie cup then top with boiling water to soften dates for 15 minutes. Drain well.
Add all pudding ingredients and blend until completely smooth.
Refrigerate pudding for 2 hours. Or pour into fudgesickle molds and freeze 6 hours.

expertTips: For creamy texture, thaw fudgesickles 15 minutes before eating.
For mocha flavour, simply add 1 tsp instant coffee granules before blending.

For black forest flavour first reduce almond milk to 2/3 cup (150g) then add 2/3 cup whole, dark sweet cherries (100g) before blending then another 1/2 cup chopped cherries (100g) after blending.  Costco carries organic, frozen cherries that taste great in this recipe.
Previously frozen, partially thawed ripe avocados work nicely in this recipe.
shortDescription: A rich, dark and delicious dessert or a snack full of healthy fats?! This raw chocolate pudding tastes better than it’s conventional counterpart and you now have a clever use for those fickle, ripe avocados. For a refreshing treat the whole family will love, freeze the pudding in fudgesickle molds (see photo in gallery).

ingredient: 1 ½ cups English cucumber slices, unpeeled (175g)

directions.direction: Add all ingredients to manual food processor.
Twirl to desired texture. Enjoy!

expertTips: Be mindful that although a generous portion of our salsa is healthful, the calories and sodium of tortillas chips can add up quickly.  What you dip with matters; the smart dipper is vegetables.  When cut into wafer-like shapes, bell peppers, cucumber, carrots, jicama and zucchini make excellent scoops.
shortDescription:
What do you get when you combine cucumber and pineapple?  A healthful salsa with immune-boosting and antihypertensive properties that adds tons of flavour without adding many calories!  

Consider how you can use salsa as a condiment to kick up your dishes. Salsa strewn over baked eggplant, potato, tofu or zucchini fries, on top of a salad or an egg dish, in a sandwich or on top of a burger or any grilled meat can be a delicious complement.

directions.direction: Mix first 3 ingredients in small bowl.
Whisk in olive oil in slow stream to make a temporary emulsion dressing.

Pour dressing over kale and massage a couple minutes.

NOTE: Finely chopping kale does the same thing as massaging it.
Toss carrot in & let sit in fridge.
Mix four ingredients for pecan parmesan.
Plate four salads then top with parmesan and cranberries.

expertTips: Bacon, avocado and tomato or pomegranate seeds, almonds and feta make for tasty switch up toppings.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Our rudimentary kale salad infuses a pungent garlicky dressing that will develop and unending hunger for kale salad! We top it off with pecan parmesan but any topping works with this mineral powerhouse of a salad base.

directions.direction: Blend first 7 dry ingredients.
Mix next 3 wet ingredients in a cup.
Blend wet into dry ingredients and form into dough.
Shape into 5 balls.
Flatten each ball in tortilla press then cut into crackers.
Lightly sprinkle with flaked salt then bake at 325F on parchment lined cookie sheet for 15 minutes flipping half way.

expertTips: Longer baking time makes for crunchier crackers.
Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the structure of this dough.
shortDescription: If homemade crackers strike you as one of those things likely to be more effort than they’re worth, think again. In reality, crackers are one of the easiest homemade pantry projects once you learn one of my favourite hacks to get the dough thin and even in seconds… the tortilla press! Experiment to your heart’s content and find the exact combination of thickness, seasonings, and baking time that turn out crackers to your liking.

ingredient: 19 oz can white kidney beans with aquafaba (540ml)

directions.direction: Puree gravy ingredients in smoothie cup.
Sautee shrimp seasoned with Qspice and red pepper flakes on medium high one side for 2 minutes.
Flip shrimp and cook 1 minute before deglazing with wine.
Cook one minute more then transfer shrimp to plate and add bean gravy to pan.
Simmer gravy gently 3 minutes then add chiffonade basil, spinach and cooked shrimp and simmer 1 minute more.
Serve over steamed squaghetti (or any pasta) and zucchini sticks or broccoli.

expertTips: Substitute shrimp with chicken or vegetable medley for vegetarian.

A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.

The bright, bold taste of ripe tomatoes intensifies a few times over when the tomatoes are dehydrated. Sun dried tomatoes can vary widely in umami flavour depending on the degree of drying. Know your brand and adjust the amount called for in recipe accordingly!
Aquafaba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas or beans. Vegans use it to make things like butter, mousse, cheese, mayonnaise and meringue.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Tuscan inspired tender shrimp coated in a creamy bean gravy with basil, garlic, sun dried tomatoes and spinach! Treat your friends and family to the decadence of this popular dish any day of the week with our stress and guilt free adaptation!

ingredient: 175g whole grain spaghettini or ramen noodles
2 cups matchstick-cut crimini or shitake mushrooms

directions.direction: Cook noodles in salted water to al dente & drain well.
Meanwhile blend sauce ingredients in smoothie cup.
Saute meat with oil & Qspice halfway then add celery, mushroom, broccoli slaw, carrot & zucchini and saute to al dente.
Add spinach, green onions & sauce then toss with noodles to heat everything.
Plate & garnish.

expertTips: For vegan, use ground round instead of pork.
Food cooked al dente is generally cooked about 80% and is still firm when bitten.
A good variety of fresh vegetables are available cut up at the grocery stores now.  Buy those if you’re short on time.
Lotus Foods brand millet & rice ramen noodles are available in most natural food sections of grocery stores.
Be mindful of three subtle differences for successful cooking  of gluten free pasta:
•Stir every 30 seconds in the first 3 minutes of simmering: noodles stick together easier because they contain more starch.
•Cook to exactly al dente: pasta will fall apart if it’s over cooked.
•Do not let sit in colander: the carry over cooking will leave you with a ball of mush.
Add more crushed Sichuan peppercorns for extra spicy numbing-ness.
shortDescription:
Enjoy a popular Chinese street food at home courtesy of the electrifying Sichuan peppercorn. We added vegetables to this classic Sichuan noodle dish for a one-bowl healthful meal adored even by foodies from outside China.

Dan Dan is a traditional pole carried over the shoulder with two baskets attached at either end. Walking street vendors who sold the dish to passers-by carried noodles in one basket and sauce in the other.

ingredient: 1 ½ Tbsp coconut oil, room temperature (25g)
¼ cup date paste, room temperature (100g)

directions.direction: Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
Cream coconut oil.
Beat in date paste then eggs one at a time.
Blend in zucchini, rosemary and Qspice.
Add last 4 ingredients in order & mix until just blended.
Bake in small, 4”x8”, parchment lined loaf pan 50 mins @350F.

expertTips: Make sure this loaf is fully cooked before pulling it from the oven and completely cooled before putting in plastic bag.  Otherwise it will be soggy in the middle.
Store in refrigerator or freeze in individual slices.
shortDescription: Enjoy a new-fashion slice of our grandma-approved loaf for your weekday snack, Sunday brunch and everything in between. Make chic croutons by cutting batons or cubes from this loaf and slowly drying them in the oven. A baton crouton fancies any salad and these cube croutons make an exceptional panzanella.

ingredient: 1 1/2 lbs extra large shrimp, peeled (600g meat)
1/4-1/2 tsp red pepper flakes (to personal taste)

directions.direction: Whisk four marinade ingredient together then toss with shrimp. Chill uncovered for at least 30 minutes and up to one hour.

From scampi section, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat and cook shrimp mixture, being careful not to let shrimp or garlic brown, until shrimp is pink but still slightly underdone, about 1 minute per side depending on size.
Transfer to plater with slotted spoon leaving oil in pan.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes to hot oil and toss for 30 seconds or until fragrant then add lemon juice and wine.
Stir and cook until reduced by half. This will take 3-4 minutes.
Add butter swirling around pan until sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes more.
Add shrimp and all juices back into the skillet tossing to coat with sauce. Cook a minute or 2 more until shrimps are cooked through.
Toss in pasta or dish up immediately then garnish with parsley.

expertTips: Don’t skip the marinade step - it really amps up the flavour and sets this recipe apart. Use the time to make a green salad or boil pasta.  Shrimp overcooks and turns rubbery in a minute so be sure everything else is set up for your meal.
If you prefer butter, simply sub the second 3 Tbsp olive oil with 1/4 cup butter (60g).  You need a bit more butter because the water will evaporate leaving the milk solids to make the sauce.
It's so versatile; serve it as a meal with a green salad and bread for dipping, or tossed with pasta or over steamed rice to sop up the sauce, or straight up as a luxurious appetizer.
shortDescription:
Most of us love garlicky shrimp so why do we leave Shrimp Scampi off the every-so-often dinner rotation?

A slight deviation from the norm, this simple dish is made with a handful of bright flavourful ingredients that all come together perfectly compliments of Qspice. There's no wrong way to scampi!

directions.direction: Slice eggs in half and remove yolks to a bowl.
Mash yolks & add mayonnaise, curry powder, Qspice, lemon juice & sriracha. Blend well.
Fill a tiny trigger-release ice cream scoop (#100 / 8 ml / 1 1/8″ diameter) and drop in hollowed half egg whites.
Sprinkle with paprika and minced cilantro then refrigerate a couple hours for flavours to marry.

expertTips: An ice cream scoop makes sense for devilled eggs.  There’s too much loss using a piping bag and the results are just as elegant.
Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago, I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
shortDescription: Devilled eggs are ingenious. They take one of the world’s most perfect foods and elevate them to chic bites worthy of many occasions. From summer picnics and Easter brunch to afternoon and Sunday supper, devilled eggs are far more than appetizers!

ingredient: 4 tilapia, sole, pickerel or basa fillets (400g)

directions.direction: Mix Qspice Alldip and refrigerate.
Pat fish fillets dry, place on parchment lined baking sheet & season.
Roast fish 8-10 minutes @ 425F depending on thickness.
Meanwhile mix coleslaw, tomatoes and herbs with Qspice Alldip.
Fill lettuce leaves with coleslaw then top with whole or chopped hot fish.

expertTips: Nutrition data is based on lettuce leaves.
Any cooked fish, seafood or meat can be substituted in this recipe and served cold.  Refresh seasoning of leftover protein with a sprinkling of Qspice.
To easily make commercial packaged coleslaw finer, give it a couple twirls in the Trudeau manual food processor.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Salpicons are Latin American salads often concocted to repurpose cooked meat. A hodgepodge of minced meat, fish and vegetables are bound by a thick sauce, eaten cold or at room temperature. Salpicon is also used as a filling for things like tortillas and puff pastry or a stuffing for mushrooms and peppers.

ingredient: ½ cup vegetable broth or Qspice Chickeny Bouillon
optional - 200g chopped raw shrimp or pork (200g)

directions.direction: In the meantime, blend tapioca starch & water.
Thicken simmering broth then set aside.
Beat eggs, soy sauce, garlic powder, sriracha, Qspice & bonito.
Beat eggs, soy sauce, garlic powder, sriracha, Qspice & bonito.
Add bean sprouts, green onion, enoki, shrimp and/or pork & celery.
Heat sesame oil to medium high and fry omelette patties in batches of three.
Serve over rice vermicelli and ladle heated miso gravy over.
Roasted sesame garlic snap peas make a nice side dish.

expertTips: Miso is traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with salt and rice or barley malt. Buy organic miso to avoid GMOs. Don’t do soy? Chickpea and rice based miso is similar in flavor and texture to white and yellow misos and can be used in the same repertoire of dishes.
Get bonito flakes at asian markets or substitute them with fish sauce.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
Use shitake powder like a spice; a little goes a long way. Just grind dried shitake mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift. Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
Any leftover poultry gravy spiked with a pinch of Chinese 5 spice and miso will do the trick here.  For that matter, you can sub the protein with leftover cooked poultry too!
shortDescription: Add this Chinese Indonesian omelette to your repertoire of great home-cooked eats! Fried enoki mushrooms impart more intense caramel umami than white mushrooms. Use leftover patties in wraps, between a toasted hamburger bun or filling in salad rolls.

ingredient: 1 lb lean ground beef or pork (454g)

directions.direction: Boil potatoes in salted water until soft.
Meanwhile, saute ground meat with next 5 ingredients until browned.
Mix in salsa and set aside.
For cream corn: with potato masher or immersion blender, process corn, mayonnaise, Qspice and cilantro to desired fineness.
Drain potatoes then mash with milk and Qspice measuring about 5 cups.
Layer in a deep 7x9x3″ casserole dish starting with meat mixture, cream corn and cover everything with mashed potatoes.
Spritz top with olive oil & bake uncovered @375F for 30 minutes.
Let set 10 minutes before scooping.
Garnish with more cilantro and avocado cubes to serve.

expertTips: If dairy is part of your diet, sprinkle some grated cheddar cheese on top in the last 10 minutes of cooking.
To make rustic mashed potatoes, dice potatoes fairly small then simply mash with cooked skin, milk and Qspice.
Sub green bell pepper if you can’t find any poblano but the poblano variety adds distinctively Mexican savour.
Shepherd’s pie neatly uses up leftover mashed potatoes.
Vegans use 2 1/2 cups cooked brown lentils for protein.
shortDescription: Shepherd’s pie is comfort food at its finest but this one comes with a spiced base and cream corn centre for comfort that’s off the charts! And mashed potatoes to tuck that all in… come on!

ingredients.dish: Filling (or use 1 2/3 cups raspberry jam instead)
ingredient: 1 1/4 cups chopped, pitted dates or figs (200g)
1 cup gluten free flour or flour blend (110g)

directions.direction: Simmer filling ingredients 10 minutes then set aside to cool. See how to zest and orange.
Meanwhile mix honey with melted coconut oil in medium bowl and let cool.
Mix next 7 ingredients well. NOTE: Stevia is a natural non-caloric sweetener that’s an increasingly popular alternative to artificial sweeteners and table sugar. Read more about stevia.
Add to honey and oil then blend until loose dough forms.
Press 2/3 of crumbs (340g) into greased square baking pan.

Spread filling over base then sprinkle remaining 1/3 crumbs and pat down lightly. NOTE: It looks like the filling and topping is too runny at this point. Baking it will transform it into a cookie bar.
Bake 40 mins @ 350F rotating once.
Let bars cool and set at least an hour.
Enjoy warm like a crumble with coconut cashew cream or to cut intact bars, refrigerate the cooled pan a few hours.

expertTips:
The dough is made easier by blending it in Trudeau Manual Food Processor. 
Just add the 7 ingredients one by one to the bowl, top with the melted oil and honey then spin until soft dough forms.
Orange zest is the colored outside portion of its peel. It brings a citrusy, tangy flavor to recipes.  Be careful not to include any of the white pith beneath the peel - it's unpleasantly bitter.
shortDescription: Our modern cookie bar is made up of a jammy layer of date sandwiched by an oatmeal biscuit base and crumble top using the same mix. You'll like the way the light sweetness of the dates and crumb really help the fruit flavour of the filling shine through. Raspberry jam gives you a twofer recipe that's a snap!

directions.direction: Process all ingredients to desired texture.
Plate and garnish with black sesame seeds.
Serve with crudites and rice crackers.

expertTips: Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
No need to cook frozen edamame as it’s already been blanched.

Miso is traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with salt and rice or barley malt. Buy organic miso to avoid GMOs. Don’t do soy? Chickpea and rice based miso is similar in flavor and texture to white and yellow misos and can be used in the same repertoire of dishes.
Don’t do soy? Chickpea miso exists but isn’t readily available.
shortDescription: The green soy bean with a fancy name has a subtle buttery texture and nutty flavour. Our hummus is as ridiculously easy to make as it is to impress! Edamame, the wonder vegetable, contains all nine essential amino acids making it a complete protein source. Spread edamame miso hummus on rice cakes for a quick snack or use it as a dip for shrimp cocktail or salad rolls.

directions.direction: Bring water, Qspice & salt to simmer & gradually whisk in cornmeal.
Cook with gentle bubbles about 8 minutes or until mixture pulls away from sides of pot.
Stir mayonnaise and nutritional yeast into hot polenta and pour onto plate scraping with a spatula.
Top with ratatouille, sauce or ragout.
Pour any leftovers in a plastic lined pan then refrigerate for slicing and grilling another day.
NOTE: Store-bought tubed polenta is fully cooked, ready to assist in your creation of tasty dinners.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Substitute butter for mayonnaise if desired.

Make extra polenta for the best ever croutons.  Just pour the hot polenta in a parchment lined cookie sheet to about 1 cm thick and chill to set.  Cut polenta slab into 1.5cm square cubes, toss in olive oil and sprinkle with a little Qspice Bouillon then roast at 425 single layered for 35 minutes (or until desired crispness).

Or cut polenta slab into strips for fries.  Toss polenta strips with a bit of olive oil then in a mixture of equal parts Qspice Bouillon breadcrumbs. Bake single-layered on a parchment lined cookie sheet in a preheated 425°F oven for 35-40 minutes, flipping halfway. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
shortDescription: This elementary dish of boiled cornmeal is to Northern Italians as mashed potatoes are to North Americans.
