Polenta is a quintessential that may be eaten as a hot porridge, used as a vessel for any sauce or ragout or cooled and set into a loaf to be sliced then baked, fried or grilled and served with bruschetta-like toppings.

ingredient: 3 Tbsp olive oil or bacon fat (50g)

directions.direction: Parboil fiddleheads in salted water 6 minutes.
Meanwhile, steam quinoa with Qspice and water as usual.
Then start mushrooms and onion sauteeing in fat and 1/2 tsp Qspice for 5 minutes.
Drain fiddleheads well, then add to mushroom pan along with garlic and the other tsp Qspice.
Sautee on medium heat 5 minutes more.
Splash with lemon juice and parsley and serve over hot quinoa.
Sprinkle with soy sauce if desired.

expertTips: Parboiling helps reduce the risk of foodborne illness related to the consumption of fiddleheads. The cause is likely an unidentified natural toxin in fiddleheads therefor they should never be consumed raw or undercooked.
Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!

We usually get in a few feeds of fiddleheads each year so I like to mix it up.  Toss hot, buttered gnocchi in at the end instead of serving over quinoa for a different dish.  Or double the batch and turn it into a salad bowl.  Just layer everything over a bed of lettuce and top with chopped cucumber and cherry tomatoes then dress with any of our Qspice Dressipes.
shortDescription: These little green furled tips of ferns have a short season and are somewhat of a food lovers delicacy in North America. Fiddleheads are only available two to three weeks every year so grab them when you see them and get cooking! Their woodsy flavour is fine enough on its own but paired with morel mushrooms, this dish captures the essence of spring.

directions.direction: Add all ingredients to food processor and mix 2 minutes.
Drop onto greased parchment paper with baby ice cream scoop and flatten slightly.
Bake 34 mins @375F flipping over half way.

expertTips: Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the structure of this dough.
Aquafaba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas or beans. Vegans use it to make things like butter, mousse, cheese, mayonnaise and meringue.
shortDescription: Once considered the preserve of the vegetarian, falafel is the proper fast food in the Middle East. Hot and crunchy on the outside, fluffy and herby on the inside, pile this fritter on a burger, stuff it in a pita or punch it in a salad. And don’t skip out on sauce; falafel can be a bit dry so creamy tzatziki, velvety Qspice Alldip or nutty tahini can really help balance it out.

ingredient: 1 long English cucumber, fine grated with peel
½ Tbsp chopped mint (4g) (or ¼ tsp dried)

directions.direction: Mix salt with cucumber and let drain in strainer 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, make aioli with immersion blender (same as mayonnaise technique) & refrigerate.
Squeeze all liquid from cucumber.
Mix in last 4 ingredients & refrigerate 4 hours.

expertTips: Squeeze the cucumber hard in your hands ending up with tight little balls.
Aquafaba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas or beans. Vegans use it to make things like butter, mousse, cheese, mayonnaise and meringue.
shortDescription: Tzatziki is a fragrant, creamy Greek sauce that is served alongside grilled meats, pita, vegetables, spanakopita & falafel. This version keeps two weeks in the fridge… theoretically.

directions.direction: Peel, slice and steam beets.
Trim stalks from fennel and pluck 1/4 cup soft fronds.
Cut fennel bulb in half lengthwise, mist with oil then season with Qspice.
Charbroil on medium high 4 minutes per side then slice in half again.
Segment orange and grapefruit.
Mix dressing.
Layer arugula, orange and grapefruit, beets, grilled fennel, goat cheese or tofeta, pine nuts & fennel fronds.
Drizzle dressing over.

expertTips: Fennel is sweet and tastes like cool, crisp licorice. Cooking fennel melts it to it’s mellower personality.
Only use the hollow, whiter parts of the fennel stalk and the fuzzier, tender fronds here. The rest of the woodier stock and stiffer fronds are better for soup.
shortDescription: The light, bright essence of fennel gives this salad flair. Sour grapefruit and pungent arugula balance the sweet orange and beet; and the dressing brings good quality flavours together. It’s gorgeous for a luncheon or dinner party. Serve it with a few grilled shrimp for the perfect summer main dish salad!

directions.direction: Oil, season & grill or roast fennel & onion about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, gather rest of ingredients in manual food processor.
Add roast fennel & onion and process to desired texture.
Serve at room temperature with green apple slices, crackers or chewy bread and goat or blue cheese.
Store in fridge.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Trim woodier stalk parts and stiffer fronds - they are better for soup.
When pairing our fennel relish with fish and seafood, garnish with a few briny capers.
shortDescription: Fennel is a vegetable with a lot going for it! Raw, it is crisp and sweet tasting of cool licorice while cooked, it becomes toothsome revealing its mellower personality. Unusual and extraordinary, this versatile condiment befits specialty sandwiches, cheese and charcuterie plates or serving with fish, seafood and meats.

ingredient: 4 cups riced cauliflower (500g or 1/2 large head)

directions.direction: Scramble eggs and Qspice in a bowl, fry in wok with sesame oil then set aside on covered plate to keep warm.
In wok on medium high, stir-fry Qspiced celery, mushrooms, carrots, and broccoli in sesame oil on high 5 minutes.
Add Qspiced caulirice, bean sprouts, green onion and edamame seasoned then stir-fry another 5 minutes.
Stir in dill , soy sauce and cilantro then top with egg.
Put soy sauce on the table for those who like more.

expertTips: Many grocery stores now sell pre-cut matchstick carrots and riced cauliflower in the produce department or frozen.
Sliced cooked meat or shrimp can be added at the rice stage.

Substitute some or all of the caulirice with steamed rice.  
NOTE: Nutrition data is based on cauliflower.
Excessive "ricing" or processing of cauliflower florets and/or overcooking caulirice makes it mushy.
Make caulirice by grating cauliflower on the large holes of a box grater.  I like do this in a large bowl set in the sink to catch the shrapnel.
shortDescription: Fried rice, outright comfort food, just got even better! One of the secrets of fried rice is that the ingredients are cooked separately — helping them maintain their distinct flavours — and then combined in the final stages of cooking. There is enough protein from the egg and edamame for this recipe to serve as an adequate meal. Once you get acquainted with the process, it becomes very adaptable to leftovers; the only constants are the rice, bean sprouts and egg.

directions.direction: Layer ingredients in order in widemouthed jar big enough for your emersion blender.

Option to boost sweetness with stevia liquid or powder.

NOTE: Stevia is a natural non-caloric sweetener that’s an increasingly popular alternative to artificial sweeteners and table sugar. Read more about stevia.
Stir everything a bit with a spoon so the chia seeds don’t clog the blender head.
Blend.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour.
Spread on pancakes, bagels and toast or spoon into oatmeal, yoghurt and parfaits.
Will keep in fridge 2 weeks.

expertTips: Suggested fruits - mango, blueberries, raspberries, peaches, strawberries or cherries.  My favourite fruit combination is 33% blueberry with 67% raspberry. Any proportion works as long as the total amount is minded.
Peach and mango chia jam will darken if not eaten same day.
shortDescription: Preserve the nutrients of your chosen fruit in raw jam rather than destroying them with heat. The gelling power of chia seeds turns any mashed fruit into spreadable, spoonable conserve. Homemade goodness without cooking or refined sugar… now that’s my jam!

directions.direction: Butterfly chicken breasts , or pound them, to make equal thickness.
Mix rest of ingredients in plastic ziplock bag.
Place chicken in bag and marinate at least 4 hours.
Grill @450F 2-3 minutes per side depending on thickness.
Make it a complete meal with our Quinotto recipe.

expertTips: Even thickness and exact cooking make for moist chicken breasts. Remove them from the grill once the internal temperature reaches 165F.
Make it vegan by marinating extra firm tofu cutlets instead of chicken breasts.
shortDescription: Real simple, real good! Grilled chicken breasts are tricky to keep moist; this marinade fits the bill. You’ll come back to this staple recipe for burgers, loading quesadillas, topping salads or the protein of any meal.

ingredient: chopped green onion & toasted sesame seeds

directions.direction: Mix coating in plastic bag.
Cut chicken thighs into equal fingers against the grain then shake in coating.
Single layer chicken strips apart on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Roast 8 mins @500F.
Meanwhile, combine and blend sauce ingredients in small smoothie cup.
Take cookie sheet out of oven & reduce temperature to 400F.
Flip each chicken finger then spoon sauce evenly over.
Bake another 10 minutes.
Garnish with chopped green onions & sesame seeds if desired.
Great served over steamed rice with a medley of sauteed waterchestnuts and snap peas.

expertTips: Alternatively you can spoon General Tso’s sauce over any store-bought chicken fingers at about the halfway cooked mark.
For vegan, cut tofu strips, dry with paper towel, toss in a bit of oil then coat. Carry on with recipe same as for chicken.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: General Tso’s Chicken is a favourite Chinese takeout dish. Feel good about putting our homespun plate on the table. The only thing missing from our baked chicken fingers smothered in zingy sauce is excess calories… treat you and yours anytime!

ingredient: 2 cups cooked peas or green chickpeas (300g)

directions.direction: Blend all in food processor to desired coarseness. Refrigerate 2 hours.
Serve with crackers, pita and crudites.

expertTips: Green chickpeas are young, fresh chickpeas that are found in the freezer section at Costco and most East Indian grocery stores.
Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
shortDescription: Hummus is a dip that is so much more than the sum of its parts and some of the best stuff on earth! Our green chickpea hummus with mint is a refreshing change to brighten up any gathering. These little vegetable gems are brimful of protein and fibre.

ingredient: 5 thick centre cut pork chops, bone in (1100g)

directions.direction: Mix all ingredients except pork chops in large, thick plastic bag.
Add pork chops & marinate 8 hours.
Grill 4 minutes per side on BBQ @ 450F for medium – 5 minutes per side for well done.
Serve with steamed green beans and baked potato topped with Qspice Alldip.

expertTips: For vegan, substitute the pork for tofu or seitan cutlet.
shortDescription: Cumin lends itself to many ethnic flavour profiles; here we use it in a teriyaki of sorts. And food just seems to taste better when you put a fire under it! Get in on the joys of winter grilling and you have a primo meal to offer up year-round.

directions.direction: Gently wipe mushrooms of debris with damp cloth.
Place gill side up in baking dish.
Pour Qspice balsamic vinaigrette evenly among 4 mushrooms & let marinate no more than 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with a bit more Qspice then grill on BBQ or roast in oven @ 500F – 4 minutes per side for steak-like shrooms or 5 minutes per side for softer.

expertTips: These are perfect as is, but if you need to switch it up add a bit of thyme, minced garlic, minced onion, minced parsley and / or lemon juice at the marinate stage.  Don’t overthink it, just do it!
Any oil and vinegar with Qspice gives you our signature vinaigrette.  See recipe on the back of every package for exact proportions of eac.
shortDescription: If you are a fungi fan, these portobellos will top your grilled vegetable list. This meaty umami mushroom is burger-sized and can be a place-holder for beef… to be enjoyed by everyone!

ingredient: 1/2 tsp dried oregano leaves (1/4 tsp ground)

directions.direction: If not using store-bought, make mayonnaise.
Layer all queso dip ingredients in order in a large smoothie cup.
Blend to velvety smooth.

shortDescription: Queso has taken over the Tex-mex world. Its popularity inspired our dairy-free queso dip. Soft tofu skillfully achieves the thick and creamy aspect of this healthful appetizer or side dish sanctioning it a staple in Mexican cooking. In minutes whip up a dip for veggies and corn chips, sauce for pasta and salads or a topping for grilled meats and tacos!

ingredient: 1 1/3 cups veg stock or Qspice Bouillon
½ Tbsp bacon grease or olive oil (10g)
1 Tbsp bacon grease or olive oil (15g)

directions.direction: Toast quinoa to golden brown in saute pan then set aside.
Mix next 5 ingredients in glass measuring cup. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Saute asparagus with fat & Qspice in medium sauce pan to el dente then set aside.
In same pan, sweat mushrooms & onion in fat with thyme & Qspice.
Deglaze with wine and cook 1 minute.
Meanwhile microwave milk mixture to hot.
Add quinoa and about 1 1/2 cups of milk mixture to mushrooms; then bring to gentle simmer.
Once liquid is almost absorbed, add another half cup milk mixture.
Keep adding like this until quinoa is fully cooked – about 25 minutes.
Stir in nutritional yeast and asparagus. Let sit 10 minutes.

expertTips: You know quinoa is done when there are no more white specs in the centre of the seed and it looks like it has popped open revealing the germ.

A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.

Substitute fiddleheads for a decadent treat. Fiddleheads are only available 3 weeks each year starting about the first of May. Be aware that they need to be steamed or blanched about 10 minutes before sauteeing.
Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

I use porcini powder like a spice and a little goes a long way.  Just grind dried porcini mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift.  Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
shortDescription: Take the guilt out of risotto with our dreamy quinotto. It’s textured creaminess that’s nutty with earthiness from the mushrooms. Quinoa is a complete protein and quinotto is a winner of a light summer meal on its own!

directions.direction: Gently simmer potatoes in salted water until just cooked (about 15 minutes depending on size).
Let cool down to handle.
Gentry thread potatoes on rosemary sprigs.
Spritz with olive oil and Qspice.
Charbroil to crisp skins & serve with Qspice Alldip.

expertTips: Nutrition data does not include Qspice Alldip.
shortDescription: Anything mini is just fun! These thin-skinned little nuggets don’t need peeling and roast up quickly. Grilling time lets you decide the perfect harmony between that golden crisp coating and soft creamy centre. Paired with Qspice Alldip they’re real gems!

ingredient: 1 lemon - 1 tsp fine zest (3g) + 3 Tbsp juice 50g

directions.direction: Add all ingredients to food processor and blend well.
Use trigger-release baby ice cream scoop (#100 / 8 ml / 1 1/8” diameter) and press into balls.
Refrigerate 3 hours.

expertTips: When grating your lemon peel for zest, use the finest grate to avoid getting any pith.  Pith is the white spongy later between the fruit and the peel, and it has a very bitter taste.
Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago, I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
shortDescription: Pucker up for these simple, raw dessert bites or pick-me-up snacks bursting with lemon! Include lemon drops on your deconstructed dessert plates, the tart component nicely offsets the sweet.

ingredient: 1 Tbsp water for desired sauce consistency

directions.direction: Cut potatoes to uniform tablespoon size, toss with tomatoes in oil, dill & Qspice.
Roast on large parchment lined cookie sheet 13 minutes @ 400F.

Meanwhile spritz salmon and asparagus with oil, season with Qspice.

NOTE: For the tails of salmon fillets fold the thin side under to even out thickness, achieving more consistent doneness throughout.
Gather potatoes and tomatoes to centre of cookie sheet then place salmon on edges and asparagus on top of potatoes.
Roast another 12-15 minutes depending on thickness of salmon.
Meanwhile mix all ingredients for satin lemon sauce. Try our homemade mayonnaise.
Plate dinner and drizzle 3 tablespoons satin lemon sauce over salmon.
Bon Appetit!

expertTips: Sub extra firm tofu cutlet for vegan.
Fold thin side of salmon fillet under to even out thickness, achieving more consistent doneness throughout.
For a muted lemon sauce flavour try meyer lemons.
If someone doesn’t like fish, roast a portion of chicken or pork tenderloin for them.
shortDescription: A snap to put together, this dish using the darling herb of French cuisine, tarragon, is wonderful for entertaining. Dijon mustard is integral to this tangy, buttery sauce that goes on everything and pairs especially well with salmon and vegetables.

ingredient: 1 1/2 lbs beef or pork stew meat (675g)

directions.direction: Mix first 8 spices in a small bowl & set aside.
Start lardons frying in 6L instant pot until grease begins to render.

Add meat cubes, season with Qspice and sear well.

NOTE: Making great stew is about proper searing and deglazing to keep the rich flavour the maillard reaction creates. Visit the link if you’re not sure about this technique.
Remove meat and set aside leaving fat in pot.
Add spice mix & stir while blooming on high one minute then and onion, celery, mushrooms & pepper.
Sweat vegetables fully then add beer to deglaze fond.
Add meat back to instant pot and sprinkle with coffee, honey and tomatoes on top of meat (do not stir in tomatoes as their sugar burns when on the bottom of the instant pot).
Pressure cook on high 35 minutes.
Stir in lime juice & cilantro before serving.
Serve with mashed potatoes & creamy coleslaw.

expertTips: The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Deglazing lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
Mole stew can be made on the stovetop in a soup pot following the exact instructions only simmer gently 1 1/2 hours partly covered.
Prepare potatoes and coleslaw while stew is cooking.
Sub green bell pepper if you can’t find any poblano but the poblano variety adds distinctively Mexican savour.
Lardons is the French term for small matchstick-cut pieces of bacon.
shortDescription: Mole is the generic rich sauce of Mexican cooking. Our stew is a lite, chocolate-tinged poblano and tomato jus that’s heavy on flavour!

ingredient: ¼ cup minced pecans or walnuts (30g)

directions.direction: Soak cashews 8 hours in water then drain well.
Cook pasta in salted water to al dente.
Meanwhile mix topping & set aside.
For butternut cheese sauce, puree next 10 ingredients in blender or extra large smoothie cup to silky consistency.
Thicken sauce in medium pot over medium heat until simmering then stir in drained, hot macaroni.
Spoon into parchment lined baking dish and sprinkle with topping.
Bake @ 350 until heated through and topping toasted – about 15 minutes.

expertTips: Crispy bacon lardons can be added to topping for decadent variation.
Food cooked al dente is generally cooked to 80% and is still firm when bitten.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Eat this comfort food extraordinaire as often as you like because it’s packed with goodness! When squash goes on sale in the summer, steam it in chunks then measure and freeze them in exact portions so you can turn out this lush creaminess in a snap. Sneak lightly steamed vegetables like broccoli, peas or brussels sprouts in the mix for a balanced bowl or stuff leftovers in roasted peppers for a spiffy new meal.

ingredient: 1 small sprig thyme / ½ tsp dry

directions.direction: Saute mushrooms on high heat in olive oil 5 minutes.
Add lemon zest, lemon juice, garlic, Qspice and thyme.
Serve hot as a side dish or let cool and serve at room temperature as an appetizer.

expertTips: Browned, flavourful mushrooms can be tricky to achieve.  Moisture is the problem, high heat is the solution.  If the heat isn’t high enough, mushrooms boil and steam in their own released water.  The water must evaporate the instant it is released.
shortDescription: Ten minute marinated mushrooms are a great appetizer that can be served with just about any menu. Add them to an antipasti plate, salads or charcuterie and mezze boards or process them into a tapenade. Have a crusty baguette handy to dredge through the dip-worthy marinate on the bottom. The clincher is that they can be made a week in advance and tucked away in the back of your fridge until you’re ready for them.

directions.direction: Roast first 5 ingredients 15 minutes @400F then add cashews and roast another 5 minutes.
Meanwhile mix Qspice masala dressing in a shaker bottle.
Toss vegetables with onions, herbs and dressing.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

expertTips: Indian eggplants look like baby ones. Use regular eggplant when not available. Slice 1/3″ thick strips lengthwise, then cut those into 1″ x 1″ squares to ensure even roasting with the other vegetables.
shortDescription: A sunny, earthy dish that’s a welcome low-carb option. Turn out our distinguished salad for dinner company or your next potluck. Roasted cauliflower has the dandy ability to sop up the warm, bitter, pepper-like flavour of the masala dressing.

ingredient: 2 large andouille or mild Italian sausage, coined
1 ¼ cup chopped, yellow and/or green beans, thawed

directions.direction: Sear sausage in heavy saute pan & set aside.
In same pan, bloom chili powder, thyme, oregano, Qspice and cayenne in olive oil.
Add onion, celery, red and green pepper and sweat.
Preheat oven to 325F.
Add tomato and garlic and cook out five minutes.
Add rice and saute 3 minutes more.
Pour water over top then sprinkle clams along with sausage. Return to gentle simmer.
Cover & bake 20 mins.
Sprinkle parsley, paprika and beans on top and return to oven 10 minutes more.
Let stand 20 minutes on stove top covered.

expertTips: For vegan, use tofu sausage and omit clams.
Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
Clam liquor is the liquid from clams used to fill up a can of clam meat.
shortDescription: Just about any meat, rice, and veggies in the creole mish-mash based on Spanish paella ends up in deliciousness. Jambalaya begins with the cajun holy trinity consisting of onion, celery and green pepper; the backbone of most cuisines of Louisiana. Serve with a simple tossed salad and it’s another super star one-pot meal for a crowd!

directions.direction: Blend all ingredients for aioli except mayonnaise until smooth.
Incorporate mayonnaise slowly.

Smear aioli evenly atop salmon fillets.

NOTE: For the tails of salmon fillets fold the thin side under to even out thickness, achieving more consistent doneness throughout.
Bake on parchment lined cookie sheet @425F about 10-12 mins depending on thickness. Broil top 2 mins more. Alternatively, grill on a piece of tinfoil on BBQ 12-14 minutes with lid closed.
Serve with sticky rice, steamed julienne carrots, julienne daikon and snap peas garnished with black sesame seeds.

expertTips: Miso is traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with salt and rice or barley malt. Buy organic miso to avoid GMOs. Don’t do soy? Chickpea and rice based miso is similar in flavor and texture to white and yellow misos and can be used in the same repertoire of dishes.
Don’t do soy? Chickpea miso exists but isn’t readily available.
Try roasting tuna, shrimp, scallops, lobster, broccoli, cauliflower or asparagus with miso aioli.
You know those white beads that appear on the surface and sides of the fish?  That’s a sign it’s overcooking.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Fork over maximum flavour in 20 minutes with miso salmon. White, yellow or red miso all impart umami taste and full body the same way sun dried tomatoes, dried mushrooms, parmesan cheese, nutritional yeast or toasted walnuts might. It’s worthy addition to your asian flavour repertoire considering it’s affordability, convenience and health benefits.

ingredient: 1 ¼ cup date paste, room temperature (350g)

directions.direction: Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
Mix first 6 dry ingredients.
Cream coconut oil then beat in rest ingredients one at a time.
Gently incorporate wet & dry ingredients then bake in parchment lined square pan for 18 minutes @ 350F.
Cool 10 minutes then remove brownies on parchment paper from pan onto wire rack and put in fridge 1 hour. This helps seize the chocolate making them fudgy.
Frost with Nutella if desired then cut into 16 square.

expertTips: Beat in your eggs for a good minute. This step is crucial for that crackly top.
Do not over mix your batter once the dry ingredients are added. That creates air pockets in the batter which will give you cake-like textured brownies.
Omit or substitute nuts as needed.
shortDescription: Fudgy treats that satisfy your sweet tooth without being too sweet! These rich, nutty brownies are irresistible… and easy to make using ordinary pantry items. Warm and a la mode them for a gooey dessert.

ingredient: 1 lb ribeye, sirloin or tenderloin beef sliced

directions.direction: Shake first 8 sauce ingredients in small jar.

Salt & Chinese five spice season beef strips then stir fry on high in grapeseed oil in wok to rare.

NOTE:  Pork tenderloin is far more economical and can substitute the beef in this recipe. Cut it into medallions first then strips.
Set aside.
Sautee water chestnuts, broccoli, mushrooms & Qspice in same wok in grape seed oil 5 minutes.
Add bok choy & sauce, cover and cook 3 minutes more.
Stir in beef to heat up.
Serve with vermicelli, rice or soba noodles if desired.

expertTips: For vegan, substitute beef with 2-8 oz packages seitan strips.
shortDescription: Save yourself from take-away Chinese food in a white carton with this superb alternative. We use the most tender cuts of beef to save the time of marinating. Organization and high heat is key to a successful stir-fry. Have all the meat and vegetables ready before starting to saute and cut the vegetables so they all cook in about the same amount of time.

ingredient: ½ - 227ml can sliced water chestnuts, drained, 70g

directions.direction: Mix first 14 ingredients.﻿
Clean and scrape mushroom caps then mist tops with olive oil.
Fill each cap evenly & roast on a grill rack 40 minutes @375F.
Serve burgers in a lettuce wrap or burger bun. They're excellent with our peach ketchup.
Side recommendations: roast edamame and sweet potato fries.

expertTips: Pre-packaged coleslaw can be substituted for the grated cabbage and carrot; just run a sharp knife through it to mince it.
Take the time to properly prepare the portobello mushrooms. See the link provided in the instructions
Potsticker Salad Wraps can be made from leftovers. Simply wrap burgers with lettuce, tomato and cucumber in rice paper then dip in peach ketchup.
shortDescription: Homemade potsticker filling is easy to make and tastes a bazillion times better than store-bought! Convert the appetizer dumpling into burgers to be enjoyed between lettuce leaves, mushroom caps or a bun, enveloped in a rice wrapper or open-faced with a knife and fork.

directions.direction: Chunk tomatoes, cucumber and onion then slice garlic.
Place all ingredients in manual food processor and twirl to desired texture (or chop by hand).
Refrigerate 45 minutes to marry flavours.

expertTips: Mix in some chopped mango or black beans and corn for variety.
Sub 10g fresh jalapeno for pickled jalapeno.
This fresh vibrant salad is best eaten the same day it's prepared.
shortDescription:
Bottom line, pico de gallo has the same ingredients as salsa only it's always raw and is a salad or filling whereas salsa is a dip. In Mexico, pico de gallo may also be called salsa fresca (fresh salsa), salsa cruda (raw salsa) and salsa huevona (lazy salsa).

The tomatoes make or break this recipe; only fragrant, ripe tomatoes will do! Eggs, tacos, quesadillas, avocado toast and all things grilled – sandwiches, vegetables, fish, meat - get an instant flavour upgrade topped with pico de gallo.

directions.direction: Cover cashews with water & soak 8 hours.
Mix all poaching liquid ingredients in shallow sauce pan and simmer pears on medium heat for 10 minutes cut side down.
Flip pears, cover & simmer 5 minutes more.
Let cool covered.
Drain cashews and blend in small smoothie cup with Qspice & coconut milk until velvety thick.
Refrigerate pears and creamy topping 3 hours before assembling and serving.

expertTips: This recipe halves nicely.
shortDescription: Poached in a mixture of port wine and spices, these pears make a beautiful, elegant dessert for holiday and special occasions. They really are the be-all-to-end-all of desserts. They pair with nearly any dinner, are not complicated, can be made days ahead and what’s more, they're good for you!

ingredient: 1 1/3 lbs chicken breasts, cut into 8-75g cutlets

directions.direction: Simmer potatoes in salted water about 10 minutes depending on size.
Meanwhile, portion and season chicken breast cutlets with Qspice.
Mix Dijon, garlic & mayonnaise.
Lay out prosciutto slices then slather with sauce on one side.
Place basil leaf in centre of prosciutto then a chicken cutlet and roll.
Melt both fats & brown chicken packets on first side @ med high heat 5 mins.
Flip chicken, add cherry tomatoes & brown 2 mins more.
Deglaze pan with wine & chicken stock. Note: Try our Qspice Bouillon ﻿and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Add potatoes & asparagus then simmer & reduce 7 minutes.
Squeeze lemon over & garnish with parsley.

expertTips: If potatoes are not all the same size, even them up by cutting them.
Sub half the oil with bacon grease, aka liquid gold, to enhance the prosciutto dimension.

A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.
shortDescription: A classic Italian ingredient, salty prosciutto, promises a tender moist chicken with minimal time or effort. If bacon makes everything better, then prosciutto makes everything perfect! Indulge in this impressive one-pan dish without veering from your wholesome eating plan.

directions.direction: Put 1 inch of water and edamame pods in a large saucepan with lid.
Steam on high heat for 5 minutes.
Drain beans in a colander, place back in saucepan, sprinkle with Qspice Bouillon and toss.
Enjoy!

expertTips: Edamame are also available shelled which are handy for adding to salads, soups, stir-frys and rice.  Find them in the frozen section of your grocery store.  You can sub 1 1/2 cups of shelled soybeans in this recipe.
shortDescription: Finger food fun in minutes! Simply toss steamed edamame pods with Qspice Bouillon so that the flavour gets on the green soybeans while you’re eating - you don’t eat the shells. Popping edamame right out of the pod with your teeth is both delicious and nourishing.

directions.direction: Melt coconut oil & maple syrup in microwave.
Stir in Qspice, salt & vanilla then toss nuts until evenly coated.

Convection bake @ 260F single layered on parchment lined cookie sheet in middle of oven for 25-30 mins stirring halfway. NOTE: Set your timer and start watching carefully at the 20 minute mark until you know how your oven cooks these pecans. They can burn in a minute. *Convection roast bakes hotter than convection bake setting. Also keep in mind that if you do a double batch and have cookie sheets on both the middle bottom and middle top racks, they need to be rotated halfway vertically because each tray will roast at different rates.

Slide parchment with hot praline pecans off the cookie sheet onto the counter to cool. The hot cookie sheet will further cook the pecans and can take them from perfect to burnt. Pecans are expensive; pay close attention your first couple gos at this recipe.

expertTips: Cool completely if packaging. Qspice Pralines keep well in a sealed container for weeks.  Do not freeze as moisture turns the coating sticky.
For a hint of heat, add 1/16 tsp turmeric.
Cashews and almonds are equally good only bake them separately; the glaze adheres more readily in the nooks and crannies of the walnuts and pecans.
shortDescription: Caution: highly addictive! Keep these nutritious nibbles that eat like treats on hand for snacking or show up to dinner with a nice tin of them for your hostess. You’ll surely get invited back. Garnishing desserts, casseroles and salads with these swavoury tidbits takes them to the next level.

directions.direction: Simmer all ingredients except vanilla 45 minutes.
Stir in vanilla & let cool.
Serve at room temperature or cold.

expertTips: The texture of this recipe is more like rice pudding. Add more almond milk if you like it runnier like tapioca pudding.
shortDescription: Often considered a superfood, quinoa is high in protein, extremely nutrient dense and gluten-free. Quinoa pudding makes for excellent eats breakfast, lunch or dinner. Serve this decadent pudding warm or chilled with nut and fruit toppings.

ingredient: 3 thick salmon steaks cut into 30 cubes (600g)

directions.direction: Soak 10 – 8″ wood skewers overnight if possible.
Build skewers using first 4 ingredients.
Mist skewers with olive oil then sprinkle with Qspice and cayenne.

Meanwhile, combine sauce ingredients in food processor and process to desired creaminess.

NOTE:  Fire roasting red peppers isn’t hard, it just takes time.
Charbroil two sides of skewers @450F for 4 minutes each on lightly oiled grill.
Drizzle skewers with romesco sauce.
Steamed quinoa and broccoli sides go nicely here.

expertTips: Substitute tofu for vegan version.
Repurpose leftovers into a meal salad by tossing some fine-ribboned kale and a couple tablespoons nutritional yeast with leftover quinoa, broccoli, and romesco sauce topped with salmon skewers.
One of my favourite uses for leftover Romesco sauce is on grilled calamari steaks.
shortDescription: Fishermen in Spain made this hearty romesco sauce to be eaten with seafood & fish but nowadays we use it like a condiment. A small amount of this complex piquant sauce is usually all that’s needed to fire up any grilled meats, fish, vegetables, breads, eggs, salads or pastas. It keeps a couple weeks in the fridge so make lots to spread on sandwiches & pizzas, flavour soups & stews or serve as a dip at room temperature.

directions.direction: Sweat first 6 ingredients.
Mix in last 4 ingredients & gently simmer 30 mins.
Cool, jar & refrigerate.

shortDescription: Our peachy keen ketchup hits many of the same notes as its customary counterpart only with more complex sweet, fruity and savoury flavour. It’s versatile enough as a chutney and stir fry sauce or a simple condiment for rice, samosas, pot stickers, egg rolls or grilled sandwiches.

ingredient: 6 cups cooked quinoa or rice pasta (240g dry)

directions.direction: Saute first 5 ingredients 10 minutes.
Add water and Qspice Bouillon, cover and gently simmer for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook pasta to el dente, drain and return to pot.
Transfer contents of carrots pot into a large smoothie cup or vitamix. Add miso and puree to silky smooth.
Toss sauce with hot pasta, plate and garnish with cilantro and walnuts.
Serve with a side of steamed edamame, broccoli or peas.

expertTips: Switch it up by tossing carrot miso sauce with hot gnocchi or spoon over eggs, baked potato, steamed rice, zoodles or daikon or enoki mushroom noodles.
Sauteed shrimp makes a great add on if you must have meat.
shortDescription:
If you need confirmation that plant-based cuisine can be delicious and satisfying, this is it. Carrots aren't the most exciting ingredient for most people, but when miso releases its salty umami to balance the sweetness of the carrot, it rises to an irresistible silky delight!

No convincing required; even picky eaters will naturally eat their vegetables concealed in this pasta sauce.

ingredient: 1 1/2 cups cooked rice ramen noodles, cooled-250g

directions.direction: Blend sauce ingredients in smoothie cup and refrigerate.
Roll salad rolls in order (see video for technique). Harder ingredients that could poke out and puncture the wrapper get placed in the middle of the roll.
Serve with dipping sauce.

expertTips: Any cooked protein or edamame will do in these rolls.
Large lettuce leaves can be used in place of rice wrappers and sub ramen noodles with daikon noodles, bean sprouts, bell pepper strips or pea shoots for paleo variety.

Daikon is a root vegetable that resembles a large, white carrot with a pungent peppery flavour similar to radish when eaten raw.   When cooked, it has a concentrated sweet flavour similar to cooked turnips.
shortDescription: Fresh and healthy Vietnamese inspired salad rolls are full of bright flavours, herbs and vegetables with just a bit of protein. Magic happens when roll hits the peanut sauce – a sweet, spicy and sour elixir for all salad ingredients!

directions.direction: Toss all ingredients together except pomegranate seeds.
Roast 25 minutes @400F single layered on cookie sheet.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds.

expertTips: For vegan, omit bacon and increase olive oil to 2 1/2 tablespoons.
shortDescription: Brussels sprouts are the cilantro of vegetables – you either love them or leave them. Maybe knowing that they are high in protein and fibre will coax your taste buds to come around? Give this combination a whirl.

directions.direction: Steam quinoa in water as usual & let cool.
Toss with rest of ingredients except tofeta.
Garnish with tofeta or goat cheese. (See how to make it a meal salad below.)

expertTips: Make it a meal by garnishing this salad with a grilled tofu or halloumi steak (omit tofeta garnish). Halloumi is a salty grilling cheese from the Greek Islands. Marinade extra firm tofu steaks as in the tofeta recipe. Both the tofu steak and halloumi can be brushed with a bit of olive oil then either grilled 3 minute per side in a pan or on the BBQ, or 4 minutes total on a panini grill.
We use less water to cook the quinoa so it has absorption room to soak up the watermelon juice. However, the quinoa needs to still be fully cooked; no white specks in the centre of the grains.

If you rinse your quinoa make sure to let it drain in sieve at least 10 minutes shaking out most of the water. Plus you need to reduce the amount of water by 10 percent for the water absorbed and left in the quinoa.
shortDescription: A refreshing salad with sustenance! Fill up yet feel light with protein-packed quinoa and hydrated with watermelon. It’s the perfect summer meal solution!

ingredient: 1 Tbsp olive oil or bacon fat (15g

directions.direction: Whisk dressing ingredients together
Toss carrots, parsnips and beets in olive oil and Qspice then roast at 425 until soft.
Toss arugula, roasted vegetables, pomegranate seeds and cashews with dressing.

expertTips: Substitute cashews with toasted pine nuts.
Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!
shortDescription: A perfect pair happens when starchy sweet fall harvest vegetables and the gem of fall fruit, tart and juicy pomegranate seeds, hook up. Raw beets have an earthy, bitter flavour that turn candy-like when cooked. Here's a hardy salad that when topped with cold roast beef, is ripe for dinner.

directions.direction: Preheat oven to 400F.
Mix Qspice Alldip.
Pat cauliflower completely dry.
Place on parchment lined cooked sheet or in cast iron pan.
Smear evenly with Qspice Alldip then sprinkle with nutritional yeast.
Bake uncovered in middle of oven about 55 minutes for el dente
Turn off oven, crack oven door and let cauliflower rest in cooling oven 10 minutes before cutting.

expertTips: Alternatively for quicker cooking time, cut cauliflower into steaks and roast 30 minutes or into small flowerets and roast 20 minutes.
If you don’t do ketchup, substitute it with 1 tsp tomato paste + 1/2 tsp maple syrup in the Qspice Alldip.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

There’s no reason why this can’t be cooked on a sheet of tinfoil in the BBQ; just keep in mind it will take a bit longer to cook depending on how often you open the lid to grill your other food items alongside.
shortDescription: Behold the roasted cauliflower head dressed to impress cauliflower skeptics and cauliflower lovers alike! Our straightforward recipe presents itself well, tastes fantastic and is good for you… any questions?

directions.direction: Toss onion and eggplant halves in oil and Qspice then place flesh side down on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Roast in upper third of oven @450F for 30 minutes or until skin charred.
Flip eggplant flesh side up and let sit 10 minutes allowing steam to soften flesh.
In soup pot, bloom next 5 spices in sesame oil 30 seconds.
Scoop, scrape and add warm eggplant flesh with all the liquid to the pot with charred onions.
Saute another 5 minutes to blend flavours.
Add stock, cover and gently simmer 15 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Puree until smooth with immersion blender or in Vitamix.
Stir in parsley and lemon juice.
Drizzle a bit of olive oil then garnish with Qspice croutons & sesame seeds.

expertTips: The immersion blender takes more time to get a velvety texture but it’s less clean up than the Vitamix. Pick your poison!
shortDescription: A simple yet novel soup that’s sure to intrigue. Just roasting eggplant generates a slight smoky essence and buttery smooth mouth-feel in and of itself. And thanks to a middle eastern blend of spices, this soup is nothing if not flavourful!

directions.direction: Gently blend all patty ingredients.
Drop patties with ice cream scoop onto parchment lined cookie sheet and slightly flatten.
Bake 15 minutes @400F.
Meanwhile, mix ingredients for satin sauce. Try our homemade mayonnaise to take this sauce all the way!
Make a meal of your choice with the salmon cakes and satin lemon sauce.

expertTips: Make a primavera salad by tossing raw cucumber, zucchini & carrot noodles with a couple cherry tomatoes and handful of arugula seasoned with a tad of Qspice.  Use the Satin Lemon Sauce to dress.
The homemade mayonnaise takes this satin sauce all the way.
For satin lemon sauce, 1 Tbsp water is optional depending on desired sauce consistency - leave out if using as condiment on burgers.
shortDescription: Salmon cakes fashion a tasteful meal that’s affordable and versatile. These medallions are as scrumptious over a bed of greens as they are between a bun. Get a flaky, meaty patty with a salmon filet or a softer croquette with canned salmon, a pantry hero.

directions.direction: Blend dates, Qspice, cardamom and almond milk in smoothie cup and spoon evenly into ramekins.
Line bottom of rectangle baking dish with a tea towel then place ramekins on top.
Whisk eggs in bowl then add vanilla & maple syrup.
Scald almond & coconut milk. Temper eggs by slowly adding hot milk while constantly whisking.
Gently pour custard into ramekins over caramel. Bake 50 mins @300F in hot water bath.
Let cool then refrigerate at least 4 hours.
Serve with fresh berries.

expertTips: Be careful not to get water in the cups when filling for hot water bath.
shortDescription: Most cultures make this magical custard dessert only by a different name. Our interpretation of this silky smooth glazed flan is a nutritious delight!

directions.direction: In instant pot, bloom turmeric, chili powder, coriander, cardamom, curry leaves and Qspice in coconut oil.
Add red onions and green chili & brown.
Add tomatoes and worcestershire & cook out.
Layer broth, lentils, squash, eggplant, okra, zucchini and red pepper in order. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Pressure cook on high 20 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice, cilantro and tuna.
NOTE: Go the extra mile on special occasions or if you need to stretch leftover sambar, make a batch of our naan bread, which goes famously with this meal.

expertTips: To make Sambar stovetop, follow the same instructions in a large pot only cover and simmer gently an hour instead of pressure cooking 20 minutes.
Young and tender okra are 2-3 inches long. Find it fresh with the produce or frozen.
Vegetarians can substitute tuna for chopped young green jackfruit.
Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.

Curry leaves are an herb and they are not related to curry powder. Curry powder is a blend of different spices which likely does not include curry leaves. When fried in oil, they release a delicious, nutty aroma and will bring sambar over the top! Buy them at Indian or Asian markets and freeze them.
Make a new meal of your leftovers.  Just top your reheated stew with a scoop of piping hot mashed potatoes (see photo in gallery).
shortDescription: Sambar is Indian vegetable and lentil stew made easy in the instant pot. This stew can’t happen without delicious okra. Sliced okra pods exude a thick and sticky juice that’s excellent for thickening soups and chowders and the flavour blends well with acid foods like tomatoes. Enjoy a satisfying change that’s packed full with wholesome flavour!

ingredient: 1 lb ground chicken or lean ground pork (454g)
1 cup diced roma or cherry tomatoes (150g)
Chopped fresh herbs - oregano, dill and/or mint

directions.direction: Blend dressing ingredients in large smoothie cup or with immersion blender and refrigerate.
In large saute pan, sweat mushrooms, onions and cumin in olive oil over medium high heat until liquid starts expelling.
Move vegetables to the outer edge of pan, add ground meat in the middle then sprinkle with Qspice and lemon rind.
Flip meat once it starts browning then add chickpeas on top and let bottom side of meat brown half way.
Mix everything in the pan together and saute until cooked through.
Stir in lemon juice and set aside.
Layer salad ingredients on plates, top with warm meat and generously drizzle with dressing
Garnish with tofeta , olives and herbs if using.

expertTips: Crumbled extra firm tofu fills in nicely for the ground meat here. Add an extra tablespoon of oil and start tofu pan frying before adding the vegetables.
Aquafaba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas or beans. Vegans use it to make things like butter, mousse, cheese, mayonnaise and meringue.

Tahini is sesame butter commonly found in the ethnic aisle of the grocery store. If the oil has settled at the top of the jar, it needs to be re-incorporated and will be very stiff to stir. It’s well worth the muscle though; tahini makes delectable salad dressings!
If you do dairy, substitute Greek yoghurt for the mayonnaise in the dressing.
For extra flavour depth, add 1/2 tsp each chili powder, oregano, cardamom and pepper when sweating mushrooms and onions.
shortDescription: Shawarma has enjoyed a sudden rise in popularity and no two are the same. Chickpeas, tahini, lemon, garlic and cumin create the classic Arabian flavours in our meal salad that delights the tastebuds without betraying the waistline!

ingredient: 3 cups chopped yellow wax or snap beans (330g)

directions.direction: Sweat onion in fat with thyme & Qspice in large saute pan.
Add red pepper, zucchini & garlic and saute 3 mins more.
Add beans & edamame and saute 3 mins more.
Deglaze pan with broth, cover and steam 3 mins. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Remove lid, sprinkle paprika and cook out on low until liquid evaporates.

expertTips: Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!
For vegan use 1/4 cup olive oil.
This dish makes great use of leftover corn on the cob.  Simply cut kernels off the cob and substitute for yellow beans or use half and half.
Substitute edamame with green chickpeas or green lima beans or combine any of these.
Burnt paprika has a bitter taste and may ruin the entire dish.  Avoid frying paprika at high temperatures.
shortDescription: Succotash is one of the most delicious things you can do to vegetables! Albeit traditional with corn and lima beans, give this interesting version a go. In the unlikely event you have leftovers, stir in a bit of Qspice Alldip and eat it like a chopped vegetable salad.

directions.direction: Blend all ingredients in smoothie cup.
Pour into glass.  Bottoms up!

expertTips: For ultimate slush every time it’s important to weigh the ingredients.
shortDescription: Chill out with an instant refreshing bevvie for the whole gang on a hot day!  Go ahead and spike a glass of summer slush with a splash of gin – cocktail or mocktail it’s thirst quenching and full of the good stuff!

ingredient: 1 tsp wasabi paste or 1/2 Tbsp horseradish
- or any leftover cooked fish or shrimp

directions.direction: Blend sushi dressing ingredients in smoothie cup.
Start by layering rice then next 5 vegetables in shallow pasta type bowls.
Top with salmon.
Drizzle 1/4 cup dressing over entire bowl.
Toast nori if using then garnish salad.
To reduce carbs by half, replace steamed rice with caulirice.

expertTips: Substitute fish with avocado for vegan variety.
Nori is dried seaweed sheets.  Toasting nori brightens its briny umaminess and crisps it so it can be crumbled on top of dishes.  Easy does it though, it burns within seconds.

Daikon is a root vegetables that resembles a large, white carrot with a pungent peppery flavour similar to radish when eaten raw.   When cooked, it has a concentrated sweet flavour similar to cooked turnips.
shortDescription: Even for most people who love sushi, making it at home is a big as if. This deconstructed roll packed into a bowl is the answer to your sushi quandary. You get loads of healthy umami deliciousness all in a fraction of the time! The toppings are just a suggestion so customize yours with all your favourite sushi ingredients; it’s the dressing that pulls it all together.

directions.direction: Simmer first 2 ingredients about 30 minutes reducing to 2 Tbsp.
Make flatbread.
Meanwhile, seed tomatoes then mix all topping ingredients together.
Spread on hot flatbread and return to oven 3-4 minutes to warm up topping.
Cut, plate and drizzle with balsamic reduction.

expertTips: Your favourite store-bought brand of balsamic reduction can be substituted.
Seeding tomatoes prevents flatbread from getting soggy.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique flavour and similarity to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Any toasted baguette slices will do for bruschetta.
shortDescription: An easy, fresh appetizer that captures the beautiful flavour of ripe roma tomatoes and basil. Our rustic shrimp version on gluten free flatbread is a stand-alone appetizer.  Add a simple green salad of spinach or arugula and you end up with a gratifying meal! Top grilled eggplant or polenta medallions with bruschetta to change things up.

ingredient: ¼ cup ginger ale or soda (60g)
2 Tbsp minced poblano or green pepper (30g)

directions.direction: Coagulate shrimp in lime juice one hour.
Meanwhile make tostadas; whisk eggs in a bowl, add water then whisk in cornmeal.
Whisk in Qspice, baking powder, salt, tapioca starch, almond flour & nutritional yeast.
Pour in parchment lined 12″ pizza pan & bake @450F for 16 minutes.
Drain shrimp and mix with remaining ceviche ingredients.
Top tostada, garnish with radishes & serve immediately.

expertTips: Garnish with small-diced ripe avocado if desired.
You can make 4 individual tostadas in 6″ pans but make sure to line them with parchment.
Substitute shrimp with chopped jackfruit or mushrooms for vegan version.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Tart, refreshing ceviche transports you to days of fun in the sun. Elevate this summertime classic meal to a soiree on the deck by pairing it with a crisp, light-bodied pinot grigio wine or lager beer.

ingredient: 1.75 lbs cubed sirloin tip beef steak (800g)

directions.direction: Make marinade with first 9 ingredients in large heavy plastic bag.
Add beef cubes and marinate in fridge overnight.
Skewer zucchini, pepper, onion and mushroom on 8 sticks.
Brush with olive oil & sprinkle with Qspice.
Thread 3 potatoes on rosemary sprigs.
Brush with olive oil & sprinkle with Qspice
Skewer marinated beef on 8 sticks.
Grill everything at once on high heat about 8 minutes for medium beef turning once.
Serve with Qspice Alldip.

expertTips: Soak bamboo skewers in water overnight so they don’t burn on the grill.

Pork tenderloin is a nice substitution here. And if you have access to a butcher shop, beef sirloin cap makes very tasty, juicy shishkebabs. Both these cuts of meat are tender to start so only need a couple hours marinating for flavour absorption.
Repurpose leftover shishkebabs into Steak & Potato Salad. Just small-chop everything, mix with Qspice Alldip and pile high over lettuce bed. Garnish with chopped dill pickles and tomatoes.
shortDescription: Meat on a stick is an awesome idea – quick to cook and easy to eat. Tasty, tender morsels of beef are mostly dependant on the choice of cut. Tenderloin is the best but it comes with a hefty price tag. Sirloin tip is a good balance between flavour, tenderness, and value. And how fun are these rosemary skewered creamers?

ingredient: 1 lbs lg peeled, cooked shrimp 26/30 count (450g)
1/8 - ½ tsp red pepper flakes or as preferred

directions.direction: Mix first 4 ingredients and let marinade while making sauce.
Sweat onion in oil with Qspice & oregano for 5 mins.
Add tomatoes & garlic then cook out 5 mins.
Deglaze with lemon juice & wine then simmer about 10 mins until sauce thickens a bit.
Add shrimp with all marinade and cook just until everything is hot.
Stir in parsley & basil.
Serve over vegetable noodles or creamed polenta.

expertTips: A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.
Sautéed eggplant penne & slivered yellow peppers or braised fennel are excellent bases for this recipe.
Serve shrimp diavolo over grilled eggplant rings for paleo bruschetta.
To use raw shrimp, saute them in 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp Qspice and 1/8-1/2 tsp red pepper flakes until just about opaque then set aside.
shortDescription: Boast of a devilish weeknight dinner in a snap!  Shrimp diavolo turns a pile of pasta, rice, polenta or vegetable noodles into a spicy, memorable meal.

ingredient: ½ cup date paste, room temperature (150g)

directions.direction: Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
Mix oil & cocoa in small bowl to make chocolate.
Beat next 6 wet ingredients into chocolate until smooth.
Mix in coconut and oats with wooden spoon until well blended. This step may take a little elbow grease.
Press hard into parchment lined square cake pan, cover & refrigerate 3 hours.
Cut into 20 bars.

expertTips: The trick to these bars sticking together is taking the time to press them well into the pan.
For decadent macaroon bars, spread some warmed nutella on top before cutting. Microwave the nutella only 20 seconds to make it spreadable.
shortDescription: There is no substitute for the real raw ingredients of our homemade chocolate macaroon granola bars! Macro nutrient dense and perfectly portable, snacker bars are ideal backup fuel to keep you full between meals.

directions.direction: Make tofeta.
Sweat first 5 ingredients.
Add next 4 ingredients to complete filling, mix well & set aside.
Whisk 4 ingredients for the crepes batter well.

Make 20 – 5″ crepes then stuff rolls equally. NOTE: Take the 7 minutes to watch my video if you can’t have gluten. These shells are bit of a learning curve but once you get the knack, it’s no more effort than regular dough.
Bake 30 mins @375F flipping once.

expertTips: If you’re good with gluten you can substitute frozen store-bought puff pastry for the shell. Follow baking instructions on package.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
shortDescription: Mouth-watering filling of spinach, onion, feta and dill enrolled in tender crisp pastry! The coconut milk and almond flour crepes shell in our creation replace the traditional Greek pie of buttered phyllo sheets achieving the same richness yet supplying good fats. Well worth the effort, spanakopita rolls are impressive for any food occasion.

ingredient: 2 ½ cups small bread cubes (1cm x 1cm) (100g)
(use our flatbread recipe for gluten free)

directions.direction: Sautee first 7 ingredients until just cooked.
Stir in maple syrup then divide meat among 12 buttered muffin cups (or lined with parchment paper muffin cups).
Layer cranberries and bread cubes next.
Mix eggs, almond milk, Qspice, parsley, nutritional yeast and nutmeg then pour over bread cubes.
Cover with plastic and set in fridge overnight.
Remove from fridge 30 minutes before cooking.
Bake 15 minutes @ 375F.
Serve with a green salad of pears, pomegranate seeds and hazlenuts dressed with Qspice vinaigrette.

expertTips: Sub 2 Tbsp parmesan cheese for the nutritional yeast.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

This recipe doubles well. This recipe can also be made into 6 giant strata cups; just bake 25 minutes. Or if time is of the essence, layer this recipe in a buttered 10×15 lasagne pan, bake 40-45 minutes, rest 5 minutes then cut into squares.

Turn leftover turkey dinner into Bubble & Squeak strata by layering mashed potatoes, chopped turkey, vegetables, gravy, cranberry sauce and stuffing topped with the omelette mixture. Get creative; leftover pizza can be turned into amazing lunch strata cups!
shortDescription: Assemble your breakfast muffins ahead and bake in the morning for a laid back brunch! They’re oh so delicious, excellent protein and perfect for feeding a crowd without much effort. Repurpose any leftovers into strata cups with this key recipe that binds ingredients using eggs.

ingredient: 1/2 cup roast red pepper (60g) (1/3 of  298ml jar)

directions.direction: Try fire roasting red peppers . It's not hard it just takes time.
Process everything to desired chunkiness.
Enjoy with pita, crackers, bread or crostini and crudites.

expertTips: Traditionally tapenade uses black olives processed to a paste consistency and spread on crunchy bread.
Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
shortDescription: A salty, briny paste that will get taste buds dancing! Nibble on this staple Mediterranean hors d’oeuvres, smear it on pizza and focaccia, stuff it in mushrooms and eggplant or mix it in with pasta and creamed polenta. Tapenade is a novel way to enjoy olives!

directions.direction: Cut tofu into desired stick size.
Marinade in next 4 ingredients for 4 hours turning once.
Pat tofu sticks dry then mist with olive oil.
Grill 10 minutes @ 500F turning 3 times (or bake in the 15 minutes @425F).
Serve with Qspice Alldip or your favourite french fry condiment.
Broccoli and sweet potato make excellent sides with tofries.

expertTips: The texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.
shortDescription:
This recipe may just be the gateway to tofu you weren’t looking for! Tofu is a readily available, economical plant protein source. Forks are optional with these finger-lickin’ sticks.

They're also great cold so make extra to snack on or add protein to work week lunches and meals.

directions.direction: Steam quinoa in water & Qspice as usual then let cool.
Mix dressing.﻿
Small chop first 6 softer vegetables in manual food processor (or by hand) & place in large bowl along with quinoa.
Small chop next 3 harder vegetables in manual food processor (or by hand) & add to bowl.
Mix quinoa, minced vegetables, dressing & lentils blending well.
Refrigerate an hour to marry flavours.
Option to garnish with avocado and/or toasted nuts of any sort.

expertTips: A nice variation is to substitute the lentils with 1-540ml can drained chick peas.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

’m not a gadget person; I find them more work to clean than chopping by hand. The Trudeau manual food processor is my exception; I use it for coleslaw, guacamole, caulirice, bread crumbs, tabbouleh, salsa fresca, tapenade, baba ganoush or any dip that needs texture. I liken it to my salad spinner and wouldn’t be without it!
The serving size shown is for a side salad.  Double the serving and garnish to make it a meal.
shortDescription: Tabbouleh is generally a super healthy Lebanese salad of fine chopped tomato, cucumber and parsley with grain. Quinoa goes anywhere grains go so we did the change-up to get complete protein and keep you full longer. This recipe makes enough tabbouleh to take in bagged lunches avoiding the feud of dibs on the leftovers!

directions.direction: Whisk all ingredients except chicken or tofu cutlets together.
Add chicken to completely coat.
Place in giant airtight ziplock bag & marinade overnight.
Grill 16-18 minutes @ 400F flipping once.
Generously garnished with chopped cilantro.

expertTips: The meaty texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed and comes in 4 bricks which you simply cut in half horizontally to get 8 cutlets. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.
Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
Once you go through a bottle of any spice, refill it with bulk for a fraction of the cost.
shortDescription: Get acquainted with Indian cuisine by giving this not-too-hot dish a try.  Indian food always delivers on flavour and the heat can be controlled. Complete your dinner with lemon scented rice, steamed peas and a tomato, red onion, cucumber salad tossed in masala dressing.  Our quick naan bread has you covered for those occasions when you like to go all out!

ingredient: 400g pkg extra firm tofu - sliced into 8 cutlets
1 Tbsp olive oil or bacon lard (15g)
½ cup broth or Qspice Bouillon (120g)

directions.direction: Mix first 6 ingredients (shake and bake) in plastic bag.
Mist or brush tofu with olive oil then shake in mixture to coat.
Roast 15 minutes @425F on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Meanwhile, cook pasta adding broccoli in last 3 minutes of simmering.
Then saute next 6 ingredients until caramelized.
Deglaze pan with wine & lemon juice.
Add broth, garlic, capers, dijon & both milks and gently reduce about 10 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Stir in parsley.
Serve over hot pasta and broccoli.

expertTips: Piccata sauce is also delightful with chicken, turkey, veal, pork or fish. To substitute the tofu with meat, follow the cooking instructions provided in our shake & bake recipe.

A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.
The meaty texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.
I use porcini powder like a spice; a little goes a long way. Just grind dried porcini mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift. Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Repurpose any leftovers over a bed of lettuce making a piccata salad.  Refresh with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of Qspice.
shortDescription: Piccata is a light, easy sauce that’s divine on any cutlet. The lemon, the capers, the wine and the broth all form a confluence that is almost three-dimensional. Traditionally the cutlet is fried to obtain a crispy outside but shake & bake is a healthier method to this end.

directions.direction: Mix all ingredients in bowl and form into dough.
Separate dough into 4 equal parts and roll into balls.
Use empanadas technique with tortillas press to form 4 tortillas.
Fry on medium heat in oiled pan 3 minutes per side.

expertTips: Buy psyllium husk in any health food section of grocery stores or the Bulk Barn. Psyllium husk has a light flavour when it’s fresh and is responsible for the flexible structure of this dough.
Psyllium husk is a prebiotic fiber that feeds the probiotics in our gut microbiome.
shortDescription: Thin unleavened flatbreads have changed how we think of sandwiches. Bring it to breakfast, lunch, dinner or snack time with our wraps that handle anything you throw at them!

ingredients.dish: Tropical Chia Parfait Tropical Chia Parfait

directions.direction: Blend first 8 ingredients in smoothie cup.
Stir in chia seeds, flax and hemp hearts and pour into 4 serving cups.
Refrigerate overnight.
Enjoy along with your hot morning beverage.

expertTips: A parfait is convenient snack to eat at your desk anytime during the day.
Nothing ruins the flavour of food quicker than rancid flax. The off taste is very distinguishable; always taste flax meal before adding it to recipes.
shortDescription: Creamy tropical luxury sweetened with fruit will get the day off on the right foot or be the perfect ending to any meal! There’s good reason for all the buzz about chia seeds. Consume the seeds for energy and sustenance, and the micro-sprouts for nutrient density. Completely flavourless the tiny seeds absorb the taste of what you mix them with.

directions.direction: Begin by trimming the ribs of any excess fat or sinew and removing the silver skin from the back side.
Make the rub by combining all the spices. NOTE: See Chef's Tips for basic ribs seasoning.

Cut slabs to desired length and place close together, single layered on foil lined cookie sheets. Make sure to use heavy-duty foil (otherwise the rib bones will poke through) and leave extra to fold over and make packets.
Sprinkle dry rub generously on meat side first then lightly on bone side. Leave bone side up so all the flavour released from the bones permeates the meat .
Seal pouches well and bake about 3 hours @275F.
In the meantime, place all BBQ sauce ingredients in smoothie cup & blend then simmer 30 mins.
Carefully make a small opening in foil pouches and bake 30 minutes more.
Remove ribs from oven and let meat rest 15 mins for juices to redistribute.
Turn ribs over so the meat side is now up. Slather with bbq sauce and let sit uncovered one hour on counter.
Reheat in 350F oven for 10 minutes or on the BBQ.

expertTips: For basic ribs, simply season with 3 Tbsp Qspice and roast as per instructions.  Use 1 1/2 cups of your favourite store-bought BBQ sauce (or Qspice Blueberry Balsamic BBQ sauce from the Blueberry Balsamic Pork Tenderloin recipe).
shortDescription: Don’t reserve tequila and fresh lime for margaritas, they make a great combo for BBQ sauce. I’m sharing the best way I’ve found to have tender, moist ribs with all the flavour intact and the fat rendered. You’re welcome!

directions.direction: Thin slice eggplants with mandolin - about 2 mm thick.
Arrange slices close but in single layer on 3 large, parchment lined cookie sheets.
Lightly spritz with olive oil.
Sprinkle lightly with Qspice Bouillon.
Roast one hour at 230F.
Flip eggplant over, rotate sheets on the racks and roast another 45-60 minutes. NOTE: Every oven is different - roasting time will vary. A good sign that the chips are crisp is when they darken.

expertTips: It's easy to make even eggplant slices with the mandoline but you can totally slice them by hand instead.  Just make sure they're all the same thinness so they bake at the same rate.
shortDescription: Who knew that sprinkling eggplant slices with Qspice Bouillon and slow roasting them for a couple hours would create such a delicious healthy snack? Set aside the processed potato chips and enjoy these eggplant chips for only 167 calories in an entire eggplant!

ingredient: 1 large chopped green or poblano pepper (150g)
1/4 cup homemade mayonnaise or sour cream

directions.direction: Mix everything up to the lime zest and marinade one hour.
Meanwhile, steam rice as usual.
Mix pepper, tomatoes, onion, corn with tofu then roast 20 minutes @ 400F.
Layer rice, roast tofu & vegetables, beans & avocado.
Garnish with cilantro and optional garnishes.
Try our homemade mayonnaise﻿! Refrigerate leftovers.

expertTips: The meaty texture depends on using extra firm tofu.  I like the Mandarin organic brand as it’s already pressed. Most extra firm tofu is good as is to go into recipes; no need to press it further.
shortDescription: A fusion of American and Mexican cuisine, this easy one-dish meal is your answer for chock-full flavour and goodness. Fuel up with our scrumptious bowl and find out that plant protein can be filling!

ingredient: 1 lb beef striploin or sirloin cap (454g)

directions.direction: Immersion blend all dressing ingredients in large cup & set aside.
Line 4 large shallow salad bowls (or one large community platter) with lettuce and vegetables in order.
Pan sear or BBQ Qspiced beef to no more than medium & rest 5 minutes (recommended doneness medium rare).
Thin slice beef then toss with cilantro and mint.
Top salad with beef strips and drizzle with dressing.

expertTips: Fresh lemon grass imparts a bright mix of citrus, floral, and minty notes while dried lemon grass contributes a less complex, woodsy flavour.  Dried is a very acceptable substitute.  One trimmed, minced fresh lemon grass stalk = 1 teaspoon lemon grass powder = 1 1/3 tablespoon dried lemon grass = 1 tablespoon lemon grass paste (16g).

If a butcher shop is accessible, the greatest value for a tender beef cut is the sirloin cap aka coulotte steak.  Sear whole steaks, make into strips for stirfry or cut into large cubes for kebabs.  This tender, tasty cut has good marbling and doesn’t require marinating.
For more heat, include the jalapeno pith, ribs and seeds.
shortDescription: Ordering a Thai salad at the restaurant will be a thing of the past once you’ve tasted our deceptively easy depiction at home! Thinly sliced meat, crunchy fresh vegetables and the heady aroma of mint and cilantro tossed with salty-sweet, slight-heat dressing seem made for hot days and nights.

ingredient: 2 cups broth or Qspice Chickeny Bouillon (125g)

directions.direction: Steam rice as usual.
Meanwhile, braise bok choy, broccoli & carrot pasta in broth, Qspice and sesame oil.﻿
Pour off liquor into a cup and set it aside then put a lid on vegetables to keep warm.
Sweat mushrooms & shallots in coconut oil in large saute pan.
Push vegetables aside and add curry powder & Qspice to centre of pan then bloom 1 minute.

Deglaze pan with stock, reserved braising liquor & coconut milk then simmer uncovered about 15 minutes to reduce. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Season fish with Qspice then add to simmering liquid.
Return to gentle simmer, cover & poach 6-8 minutes depending on thickness of filet.
Stir chiffonade basil & lime juice into sauce.
Arrange warm vegetables in the bottom of bowls then place a scoop of rice to one side.
Top with fillets, ladle sauce over and garnish with cilantro, green onions & pepper.

expertTips: Use regular broccoli and mushrooms if you don’t have access to the Asian versions.
Culinary liquor is a flavoured broth resulting from the cooking of meat or vegetables, especially greens.
Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
shortDescription: White fish is the perfect vessel for the subtle, aromatic flavour that poaching imbues; and flakier fillets like haddock and pickerel stand up to this gentle simmering technique.  This dish lives up to the Thai culinary promise of light texture and intricate flavour with a harmonious finish.

directions.direction: Start salted water boiling & cook pasta to el dente.
Meanwhile, sweat shallots in oil in large saute pan.
Add garlic, Qspice, red pepper flakes & tomato paste and cook out 2 minutes.
Deglaze with lemon zest, squeeze of one half lemon, wine & water.
Simmer and reduce 5 mins.
Add clams to pan single layered cover and about simmer 6 mins stirring halfway.
Drain and add hot pasta then let simmer 1 min more.
Brighten up flavours by adding a turn of olive oil, squeeze of other half of lemon & the parsley. Toss well.

expertTips: A solid alcohol-free option for dry white wine is white wine vinegar. Since it’s made from white wine, it’ll have some of the intended flavours only more acidic.  Dilute it by mixing equal amounts water to white wine vinegar to compensate.
Do not add salt other than pasta water as clams & mussels have their own natural salt.
Food cooked el dente is generally cooked to 80% and is still firm when bitten.
shortDescription: This succulent seafood pasta is so quick, one batch and you’ll be hooked! Although you can substitute other seafood, clams or mussels work best because the nectar released when they open rounds out the briny flavour and helps create the brothy sauce.

directions.direction: Make Qspice mayonnaise. Refrigerate leftovers.
Add all ingredients to Trudeau manual food processor﻿.
Mince to desired fineness.

expertTips: If dairy is part of your diet, amp up this coleslaw with a crumbled goat or blue cheese garnish!
Grilled chicken wings or crispy chicken fingers alongside makes this chopped salad a full meal deal.
shortDescription: There’s a lot to love about the simple salad blended of apples, celery, and walnuts with just the right amount of good quality mayo and lemon, maybe some grapes. There’s even more to love about our iteration of a classic with the addition of cauliflower!

ingredient: 3 cups soft navy beans (2-15oz cans, drained)

directions.direction: Sautee sage & rosemary in hot oil 2 mins adding garlic after 1 minute.
Place all ingredients in food processor & puree to desired texture adding water to thin if needed.
To serve, dollop in the middle of a platter and swirl with the bottom of a soup spoon. Drizzle a bit more oil on top & serve with any chip and crudites.

expertTips: Crudites is an assortment of pretty-cut raw vegetables served as an hors d’oeuvre, usually alongside a dip.
Suzie’s organic thin cakes made with quinoa and brown rice are light and crisp.   Find them at Costco.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique flavour and similarity to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Dried herbs can be used only use one third of the amount called for and sautee for only one minute with garlic.
Careful not to burn garlic as it becomes rancid.
shortDescription: Step aside hummus, there’s a new protein dip in town. The humble bean is a trend setter championing great taste and nutrition. Creamy bean dip is a good excuse to eat your vegetables and give in to your snack attacks! White beans are fairly bland and take on just about any flavour so substitute the sage and rosemary for herbs you have on hand.

ingredient: 4 tilapia, sole, pickerel or basa fillets (400g)

directions.direction: Use mandolin to sliver slice potatoes, zucchini, onion & tomatoes.
Toss vegetables in olive oil, Qspice and herbes de provence.
Divide among 4 jumbo muffin cups to make provencal vegetable stacks & bake covered with tinfoil 45 minutes @ 375F.
Meanwhile, process all pistou ingredients to desired texture.
Mix fish coating ingredients, pat fish fillets dry & shake in coating.
