Once vegetables are out of the oven, increase temperature to 425F and roast fish 8-10 minutes depending on thickness.
Place a vegetable stack and fish filet on each plate then top with pistou and sprinkle olives.

expertTips: Although every good cook has their own recipe for herbes de provence, they almost all include thyme and savoury. Decent blends can be found at most grocery stores.
Tapioca starch aka tapioca flour is ground from the root of the cassava plant. It is used mainly as a thickener in gluten free cooking.
If provencal vegetable stacks are too time consuming, simply place vegetables in baking dish, sprinkle with oil and spices then roast until soft.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: Herbes de provence is the classic aromatic blend that’s a staple in french cooking. Our dish comes full circle paired with pistou; cold provencal sauce akin to pesto. Make fish a healthy, satisfying part of your meal plan more often.

directions.direction: Mix gnocchi ingredients together to form soft dough.
Roll into 3/4″ cord and refrigerate 4 hours.
Meanwhile, make mushroom pesto by caramelizing mushrooms in olive oil, Qspice & porcini dust (if using).
Add thyme and garlic in last 2 minutes of cooking.
Process all pesto ingredients in food processor to desired texture then set aside.
Cut off 1″ dumplings and simmer in salted water 2 minutes.
Toss with mushroom pesto.
Serve with steamed vegetables or green salad.

expertTips: This recipe doubles as tater tots. Just spritz dumplings with olive oil after cutting & bake 20 minutes @ 350F or until the outside is a little brown. The outside gets a crust while the inside stays pillowy.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

I use porcini powder like a spice and a little goes a long way.  Just grind dried porcini mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift.  Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
shortDescription: There is no better winter treat than this insane gnocchi classic! These tiny dumplings yield sublime flavour and pillowy texture beyond all pasta plus they double as tater tots. Gnocchi is a labour of love and shows anyone you serve them to that they are special.

directions.direction: Cream coconut oil.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
Add zucchini & date paste and blend again. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is to make date paste.
Sprinkle the salt, thyme, Qspice, baking powder & almond flour in order then beat just until all blended.
Bake in small, 4″x8″, parchment lined loaf pan 50 mins @350F.

expertTips: Make sure this loaf is fully cooked before pulling it from the oven and completely cooled before putting in plastic bag.  Otherwise it will be sticky in the middle.
Store in fridge or freeze in individual slices.
shortDescription: Atypical of all the sweet zucchini bread recipes, our savoury quick bread is nummy for all your sandwich and toasting needs. Spread satiny homemade mayonnaise on a fresh chunk; or top a toasted slice with fanned-out avocado slivers and a sprinkling of Qspice.

directions.direction: Steam green beans 1 minute in large saucepan; then add yellow beans to same pan and steam 1 minute more then finally add asparagus and finish steaming 3 minutes more for el dente.
Drain hot water, immerse vegetables in cold water bath then set in colander to drain completely.
Meanwhile mix all ingredients for dressing lastly whisking in olive oil slowly to form temporary emulsion.
Mix vegetables, beans, parsley and onion with dressing and refrigerate one hour to chill and marry flavours.
Plate & garnish.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: July is the start of yellow bean season and this easy-breezy crisp salad will help you enjoy the lazy days of summer. Strut your beautiful three bean asparagus salad at any gathering or on a bed of spinach trimmed with prosciutto and toasted almonds for a fine patio meal!

directions.direction: Saute first 9 ingredients until all liquid cooked out.
Process all ingredients in food processor to desired fineness and refrigerate 4 hours.
Serve with fennel, carrot, snap peas & cauliflower crudites, crackers, grapes and torn bread.

expertTips: I use porcini powder like a spice and a little goes a long way.  Just grind dried porcini mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift.  Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
shortDescription: Looks aren’t everything, especially when it comes to food, right? Pâté is a super tasty thing we just don’t have that much control over. This one isn’t chopped liver; you’ll have the vegans and meatatarians going back for seconds. Move pâté past its usual appetizer residence to a condiment and toss it in hot pasta and rice or spread it on sandwiches and flatbreads.

directions.direction: Saute first 7 ingredients on medium high heat in soup pot about 15 minutes stirring every 3 minutes.
Add liquid & gently simmer 20 minutes covered.
Let cool down to warm then puree in smoothie cup in batches or vitamix.
Stir in lemon juice & parsley.
Temper mayonnaise then blend well into sauce.
Use in recipe or freeze in desired portions.

expertTips: Temper by blending a little of the hot sauce at a time to the mayonnaise, gradually raising the temperature. This prevents the cooking of the eggs resulting in a lumpy sauce.
Recipe doubles well for times when cauliflower is on sale.
shortDescription: Presenting one of the 21st century dairy free mother sauces of French cuisine! Use this health-giving, satiny white sauce as the base for other sauces (like alfredo and mornay) or the backbone for casseroles (think grains and mac & cheese) and creamy soups and chowders. The long and short of it, your freezer should never be without at least a litre of béchamel sauce for backup.

directions.direction: Mix baking soda & vinegar in small dish then set aside.
Cream coconut oil then beat in next 5 wet ingredients.
Fold in soda foam.
Sift 5 dry ingredients together.
Add dry ingredients to wet & mix until just blended.
Spoon into well-greased doughnut pan.
Bake 25 minutes @350F.
Let pan sit 7 mins before gently twisting each doughnut to loosen then gently invert on wire rack.
Cool & glaze if desired.
To make glaze, whisk all glaze ingredients until smooth. Let cool to room temperature before drizzling on doughnuts.

expertTips: If you do dairy, topping these with cream cheese icing transforms them to decadence.
Nothing ruins the flavour of baking quicker than rancid flax. The off taste is very distinguishable; always taste flax meal before adding it to recipes.

Pumpkin Pie Spice recipe:                                                 
1 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon,
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg,
1/4 tsp ground ginger,
1/8 tsp ground cloves,
1/16 tsp allspice
shortDescription: You can smell it in the air. Light, fragrant pumpkin spice cake rings warm you up to the fall season! Enjoy a breakfast treat on one of those brisk, lazy mornings.

directions.direction: Steam rice as usual together with next 4 ingredients.
Mix dates, coconut & almond milk into add to hot rice.
Simmer gently 15 minutes more.
Stir in rose water, pistachios and toasted coconut.
Indulge!

expertTips: Saffron will always be expensive.  If you see a packet of a couple ounces for a few dollars just put it back.  And never buy bulk or ground saffron; often it’s cut with turmeric, paprika and bark.
Rosewater is found in the international aisle of most grocery store.
shortDescription: Rice pudding can be something extraordinary encompassing fun ingredients from around the world. The name itself is exotic and denotes the richness of a delicate Indian dessert but giving in to your cravings isn’t giving up on healthy eating with this one. Dessert snobs might even concede, the proof is in this pudding!

directions.direction: Blend wet ingredients in order.
Add dry ingredients all at once and blend.
Refrigerate 20 mins.
Drop by tablespoon or small trigger-release scoop onto parchment lined cookie sheet.
Bake 15 mins @350F.

expertTips: The flavour of this cookie depends on fancy molasses. Do not substitute cooking molasses.
For a chewier cookie, let dough ripen 24 hours in the fridge before baking.
Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago, I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
shortDescription: A sweet, sassy molasses cookie that’s spiced just right! Our unapologetically old-fashioned cakey cookie satisfies that distinct robust flavour without overdoing it. This one hits all the right notes when you’re craving something sweet.

directions.direction: Bring first 4 ingredients to boil.
Take off heat and stir in next 2 ingredients.
Layer next garlic, jalapenos and eggs in mason jar then cover with hot brine.
Refrigerate 2 weeks before eating.

expertTips: The cheater version of pickled eggs is adding boiled eggs to the brine of an empty dill pickle, pepperoncini or green olive jar with a teaspoon of Qspice and a 1/4 teaspoon turmeric per litre of brine to revive the flavour. Get creative like adding anchovy paste to the olive brine or lemon grass to the dill pickle brine, mmmmmmmm!
In a pinch, this recipe can end at adding the boiled eggs to the cooled brine.  The rest of the ingredients are all optional.
shortDescription: Pickled eggs get a bad rap for being pub grub. Full of nutrients and protein, eggs are one of the healthiest foods. Chopped pickled eggs make great garnishes for salads and pasta. If you manage to stab one from the jar, is eating it right off the fork proper etiquette?! You decide.

ingredient: 2/3 cup chopped frozen fruit or berries (85g)
¼ cup natural peanut, nut or seed butter (90g)

directions.direction: Mix first 8 ingredients well in a bowl and let stand 90 minutes.
Mix again then spoon half into 4-8oz mason jars.
Divide half fruit between each jar then drizzle in half peanut butter.
Fill jars evenly with remaining oats mixture then peanut butter & finally fruit.
Screw on lids & let sit in fridge overnight to soften oats.
Microwave to serve as warm cereal or eat cold like a breakfast parfait.

expertTips: For a sweeter cereal substitute your favourite flavour of jam instead of fruit.
Substitute quick cooking steel-cut oats for a chewy parfait. Bob’s Red Mill sells this variety of oats.
Use any frozen fruit - blueberries, cherries, mango, raspberries, strawberries, pineapple, etc.
Use nut or seed butter of preference- almond, cashew, sunflower, tahini, pumpkin, hazelnut, etc.
shortDescription:
Upgrade your granola with overnight oats. Think of it as soaked muesli; rolled oats, nuts, seeds and fruit. Uncooked oats absorb liquid during the night, softening them in the same way cooking them does, except without the work!

Qspice is that little unexpectedness that brings out the sweetness of this cereal. There're so many ingredient combinations; you’re only limited by imagination! Put together a double batch on Sunday and reap the rewards of convenient, nourishing breakfasts all week.

directions.direction: Place all ingredients in blender and puree.
Pour in individual servings and freeze 4 hours. Or pour in tub and freeze overnight.
Remove from freezer 5-10 mins (depending on container size) before serving.

expertTips: The level of sweetness is partially due to using very ripe bananas, but did you know that freezing and thawing overripe bananas converts more of their starch into sugar leaving them even sweeter tasting!?

Peel overripe bananas and freeze some sliced and single layered on a cookie sheet then stash them into a plastic bag for later when you can blitz them into smoothies or stir them into hot porridge.  Others you can freeze whole for baking into muffins, breads and cookies.  To use frozen bananas in baking, completely thaw bananas in a bowl so not to lose any of the melted sweet syrup.
shortDescription: You can’t believe it’s not real ice cream! Quick carbs in the banana and a little protein in the peanut butter make for a snack match made in heaven. The only way to miss on this recipe is by using underripe bananas.

directions.direction: Bake potatoes as usual in oven or microwave. See chef's tips.
Sweat first 6 ingredients on medium high about 5 minutes.
Add riced cauliflower and saute until browned and caramelized.
Add hot sauce and cook out 5 minutes.
Meanwhile puree tofu with immersion blender and add to pot along with nutritional yeast.
Cook on medium heat 5 minutes more.
Stir in mayonnaise, green onion & parsley. Try our homemade mayonnaise! Refrigerate leftovers.
Split, pop and fill hot baked potatoes. Option to top with cheddar or blue cheese if dairy is a part of your diet.
Serve green salad dressed with Qspice balsamic vinaigrette alongside.

expertTips: Jacket potato is a baked potato served with the skin on.  If you like the jacket of your potato crispy with a little chew, bake them unwrapped in a 450F oven for about 45 minutes depending on size.  Wrapping potatoes in tin foil and baking them in the oven steams them producing a softer skin.  Alternatively for softer skin, cook your potatoes in the microwave.

To use buffalo filling as a buffalo dip, scoop your cooked filling into a greased casserole dish, top with cheese of choice and bake @375F for 10 minutes.  Serve with carrot, celery and zucchini sticks, crackers, tortilla chips and bread cubes.
Alternative meal suggestion is to stuff warm buffalo filling in a wrap with lettuce, crispy chicken fingers and cheese!
Another meal suggestion is to top canoodles with grilled chicken then buffalo filling and cheese!
Omnivore version - sub caulirice with 454g of ground chicken.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour that’s similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
shortDescription: It’s time to broaden your horizons and consider stuffing an entire meal into a baked potato. Think about it, you have your protein, vegetables and carbs all bundled in an easy to eat container! Let there be no regrets, our Buffalo Stuffed Potato will fix a hankering for wings! You may want to double up on this one - see chef's tips for alternative meal suggestions with buffalo filling.

ingredient: 6 medium white potatoes skin on, halved (800g)
5 thin slices black forest ham, chopped (85g)

directions.direction: Seal potatoes, olive oil and Qspice in a tin foil packet and BBQ (or roast in oven) about 25 mins @500F turning once.
Drizzle cooked potatoes with dill pickle juice then reseal and let rest 30 mins.
Uncover, let cool 30 mins more then small dice.
Mix mayonnaise with dijon, paprika and Qspice.
Place celery, green onions, ham, parsley, dill pickle and eggs in manual food processor (or chop by hand).
Twirl until everything is chunky minced.
Mix together potatoes, mayonnaise, minced ingredients and peas.
Refrigerate minimum 4 hours for flavours to marry.

expertTips: No need to cook frozen peas – they were blanched before frozen.

I’m not a gadget person; I find them more work to clean than chopping by hand. The Trudeau manual food processor is my exception; I use it for coleslaw, guacamole, caulirice, bread crumbs, tabbouleh, salsa fresca, tapenade, baba ganoush or any dip that needs texture. I liken it to my salad spinner and wouldn’t be without it!
For the cauliflower version, roast the cauliflorets of one large cauliflower (800g) the same as the potatoes only reduce the time to 15-20 minutes depending on how tender you like your cauliflower.
shortDescription: The best roast potato salad you’ve never had! Plus, the mock version with roast cauliflower gives the potato a run for its money. To fashion a meal salad, pile olivier potato salad on a bed of arugula, garnish with capers and serve with a side of grilled fennel… ooh la la!

directions.direction: Cream coconut oil, beat in egg then honey.
Add next six ingredients and blend.
Add last 3 dry ingredients and blend well.
Drop by tablespoon or small trigger-release scoop onto parchment lined cookie sheet.
Bake 16 minutes @350F rotation pan halfway.

expertTips: Since discovering trigger-release scoops a couple decades ago I’m a huge fan of the ease and uniform cookies.
Nothing ruins the flavour of baking quicker than rancid flax. The off taste is very distinguishable; always taste flax meal before adding it to recipes.
For chewier cookies, allow dough to ripen in the fridge 24 hours before baking.
shortDescription: There’s nothing as enticing as the aroma of fresh baked cookies. While there’s no shortage of oatmeal cookie recipes out there, our soft drop cookie loaded with chewy raisins and a touch of cinnamon is the perfect winner to fill up your cookie jar! Drop style cookies are named for the way the cookies are traditionally shaped by sliding a heaping tablespoon of cookie dough onto a prepared baking sheet, spacing them 2″ apart.

directions.direction: Add all dressing ingredients to smoothie cup and blend. Try our homemade mayonnaise! Refrigerate leftovers.
Compose salads in order of ingredients as per photo.
Drizzle salads evenly with dressing.
Serve with fresh baguette.

expertTips: Sub the tuna for young green jackfruit and omit anchovy paste to make this salad vegetarian.
This salad can be composed while potatoes, beans and eggs are still hot for a wilted salad.
shortDescription: A main course salad done in the style of Nice that can be adapted to any season. Compose simple ingredients transcended by a robust homemade dressing for an elegant meal that’s pleasing and healthful. Make it a centerpiece by assembling all four portions on a large serving platter crowned by a slab of grilled fresh tuna!

ingredient: 1 ½ lbs lean ground veal, beef or lamb (680g)
½ cup red wine or pomegranate juice (125g)

directions.direction: Make Qspice bechamel sauce (make a full batch and freeze half for another use or make 2 pans of lasagne).
While béchamel is simmering then cooling; brush eggplant rounds with olive oil & season with Qspice then pan fry in heavy bottom sauce pan. Set aside.
In same pan, sweat onion with another tablespoon oil and 6 spices, then add garlic, green pepper and ground meat and brown fully.
Deglaze with wine lifting fond and cook off 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes & simmer gently uncovered 30 mins.
Mix parsley into sauce.
Mix nutritional yeast into 6 cups béchamel sauce.

Layer into 10×14 lasagne pan; 1/2 cup meat sauce, all sweet potato, then all zucchini topped by all the eggplant. NOTE: This is a large, deep pan; the recipe does not fit in a regular oblong pan. If you don’t have a lasagne pan, make it in a roaster or two pans, maybe an oblong and a square.
Spread rest of meat sauce evenly over eggplant.
Evenly spoon Qspice béchamel sauce on top & bake 50-60 minutes, uncovered, at 375F.
Let set 20 minutes before cutting.
Any simple green salad works as an accompaniment here.

expertTips: To save time, substitute the Qspice Bechamel Sauce with 3 cans of your favourite cream soup diluted with half the liquid called for.
Vegans use 2 cups cooked brown lentils in place of the ground meat.

The fond is the browned bits on the bottom of the pan after you’ve seared meat or vegetables. It is the fundamental flavour-booster of most good soups, gravies and sauces. Deglazing lifts those little bits to be incorporated into the sauce.
Pomegranate juice has tannins just like red wine that add a complex undertone to the dish.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
Use can use parmesan cheese instead of nutritional yeast if you do dairy.
shortDescription: Moussaka is a complex tasting Greek lasagne where eggplant is employed for noodles and Qspice bechamel sauce for cheese. Invite guests to a symposium of flavour so they too can sing the praises of this beloved dish… and the cook! And while you’re at it, make a double batch and freeze one pan to spruce up a dreary winter day.

directions.direction: Heat oil on high saute in instant pot, then add onion and next 6 spices. Saute to bloom.
Add tomato paste and cook out.
Add rest ingredients except cilantro. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Pressure cook on high for 7 minutes.
Do natural pressure release.
Stir in cilantro and let sit 20 minutes.
Serve over steamed quinoa, creamed polenta, rice or squaghetti.

expertTips: Saffron will always be expensive.  If you see a packet of a couple ounces for a few dollars just put it back.  And never buy bulk or ground saffron; often it’s cut with turmeric, paprika and bark.
Green chickpeas are young, fresh chickpeas that are found in the freezer section at most East Indian grocery stores.
Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
Reheat leftover tagine and serve with mashed sweet potato for new meal.
shortDescription: Practically any meat and vegetables can be turned into a tagine or Moroccan sweet and savoury stew using the token spices, dried fruit and nuts. Here’s your invitation to cook with saffron; known for what it does to energize dishes with a pungent, earthy essence.

ingredient: 5 cups broth or Qspice Bouillon (1.25 l)

directions.direction: Heat oil & bloom next 6 spices.
Add onion & celery & sweat out.
Stir in carrot, yam, vinegar & tomato paste and cook out 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes & cook out 5 minutes more.
Stir in broth and simmer gently 30 minutes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Puree with immersion blender or in vitamix.
Stir in peanut butter.

expertTips: Cashew butter may be subbed for peanut allergies.
The immersion blender takes more time to get a velvety texture but it’s less clean up than the Vitamix. Pick your poison!
Blooming spices is a crucial step for getting the most flavour out of them.  Gently fry ground spice in hot oil to release fat-soluble flavour compounds contained within the spices.
Soup may be thinned out with almond milk to reheat or dilute flavour.
shortDescription: Makeover tomato soup with Moroccan inspired ingredients and balanced nutrition. Ours is slightly sweet with a little heat and sticks to your ribs! Peanut butter gives it its creamy texture while adding protein.

directions.direction: Whisk dressing ingredients together in small bowl.
Place rest of ingredients in large bowl, pour dressing over and mix well.
Let stand in fridge 3 hours so flavours will marry and mellow.

expertTips: Sub dried cranberries for pomegranate seeds.
If you do dairy, crumbled feta takes this salad to the top.
Green chickpeas are young, fresh chickpeas that are found in the freezer section at Costco and most East Indian grocery stores.
Hay-cut refers to a rough julienne cut which can be achieved with a mandolin or by hand.
shortDescription: An unexpected blend of warm spices achieve this all-star salad’s complex aromatic flavour. Lemon juice adds brightness while pomegranate seeds add interest; tart sweetness from the pulp and nutty crunch from the seeds. It is crucial to allow the given time for the flavours to marry and mellow since the ingredients are raw.

directions.direction: Make tofeta.
Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Mix all ingredients except nutritional yeast and scoop evenly into both spaghetti squash halves.
Bake 40 mins covered either in large casserole dish or with tin foil on cookie sheet @ 375F.
Uncover and bake another 20 minutes or until spaghetti squash el dente.
Take out of oven, cover again & let stand 15 minutes.
Empty filling and scrape spaghetti squash.

Plate spaghetti squash, top with filling and garnish with nutritional yeast.

Note: A dollop of  tzatziki adds a special touch.

expertTips: Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique flavour and similarity to parmesan cheese when added to foods.  It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!
The proper texture depends on using extra firm tofu. No need to press extra firm tofu further.
shortDescription: We’ve come a long way from baking squash with animal fat and maple syrup to make it palatable. Not only a trendy alternative to pasta, this one is a stylish vegan dish that satisfies with the meaty texture of extra firm tofeta. Round out the complexity and acidity of this ragout with basic leafy greens, cucumber and carrot; dressed fruity sweet. Try Qspice waldorf  or mango dressing.

ingredient: (reserve aquafaba to use in other recipes)

directions.direction: Process first 4 ingredients to coarse meal in manual food processor.
Mix all ingredients together.
Press 5 jumbo meatballs and drop onto parchment lined cookie sheet.
Bake 20 mins @ 350F uncovered.
Serve kofta alongside mounded mashed potatoes topped by a huge dollop of tzatziki and briam.

expertTips: Briam is traditional Greek roast vegetables.  A nice medley is cherry tomatoes, small diced eggplant, zucchini, red onion, yellow and red bell peppers tossed in olive oil, oregano & Qspice.

For greek burgers simply shape into patties and charbroil. Serve in pita halves with lettuce, tomato, tofeta and tzatziki. Or make another meal with leftover koftas by slicing the cooked meatballs and serving them the same as burgers.
Pomegranate juice has tannins just like red wine vinegar that add a complex undertone.

Aquafaba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas or beans. Vegans use it to make things like butter, mousse, cheese, mayonnaise and meringue. Save the aquafaba from the lima beans to make homemade tzatziki and mac & butternut cheese.
shortDescription: We’ve transformed a fast food favourite into wholesome mediterranean cuisine; the perfect opportunity to get your Greek on! Greek fare is a fascinating exploration of unexpected flavours with endless variety. Kofta consists of balls of ground meat and turns out the classic taste in a jiffy.

directions.direction: In medium pot, sautee first 4 ingredients 10 minutes, add water & simmer gently 20 minutes covered.
Meanwhile in large skillet, heat olive oil & sweat onion & celery with Qspice 5 minutes.
Add ground chicken & garlic and fully cook.
Puree cauliflower mixture with immersion blender to make sauce.
Add sauce to meat mixture and simmer gently 5 minutes more.
Stir in lemon juice & parsley.
Temper the mayonnaise then blend into sauce with nutritional yeast.
Serve over zoodles, squaghetti or pasta of your choosing.

expertTips: To temper mayonnaise, stir in a little hot sauce at a time to the mayonnaise mixture, then stir the warm mayonnaise back into the sauce pot. If you just combine the homemade mayonnaise with the hot sauce you’ll end up with cooked egg bits.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

Top a baked potato with buffalo pasta sauce and cheese then rebake for a repurposed meal. Or why not use our sauce as the base for a shepherd’s pie and layer creamed corn in the centre so the sweet can offset the heat?!
Blue cheese is amazing in this dish if you do dairy. Sub it equally for the nutritional yeast.
Substitute red lentils for the vegan option here.
shortDescription: Craving buffalo wings? Try our healthful dinner substitute and see if it doesn’t become an ultimate comfort food! Cauliflower tames the heat and supplies a velvety mouth-feel here. Our sauce accommodates itself nicely to baked and mashed potatoes, stuffed peppers and zucchini or steamed rice. Take time on the weekend to double and freeze a batch for busy weeknight meals at the ready.

ingredient: 398ml can white lima beans with aquafaba

directions.direction: Sweat first 6 ingredients.
Mix in caulirice and 1 tsp Qspice and saute 5 minutes.
Puree beans, aquafaba and broth in smoothie cup then add to caulirice with peas and tomatoes. Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Simmer gently 5 minutes.
Stir in spinach and mint leaves, cover & heat through on medium 5 mins.
Meanwhile, pan fry Qspice seasoned fillets of sole in olive oil.
Dish risotto in four large shallow bowls.
Top with sole fillets and garnish with a squeeze of lemon and sprinkling of capers.

expertTips: Click on bolded word “rice” in description to learn my caulirice hack. If you don’t have a Trudeau manual food processor, grate cauliflower florets in a large bowl to catch the shrapnel.
Aquafaba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas or beans. Vegans use it to make things like butter, mousse, cheese, mayonnaise and meringue.
Omit sole and serve with a punk of bread for vegan dish.
For a quick meal, substitute leftover ham or canned salmon or tuna for the sole. Add on top after stirring in the spinach and mint leaves before heating through on medium 5 minutes.
shortDescription: Cauliflower is still the rage for pseudo starchy creations of the comfort foods we crave. From pizza crust, rice & cream sauces to mashed potatoes, there is no limit to what cauliflower ninjas do with this versatile vegetable. Its mild flavour provides cooks with a blank slate… be a palate pleaser with our gourmet cauli-risotto!

directions.direction: Make date paste. NOTE: Watch our How to video below to see how easy it is.
Cream coconut oil then beat in next 5 wet ingredients in order.
Mix next 6 dry ingredients in another large bowl.
Stir pecans & blueberries into dry mixture.
Fold wet mixture into dry until just blended.
Spoon into paper cup lined muffin tin.
Bake 30 mins @ 350F rotating tin in oven halfway.

expertTips: Half the oatmeal can be ground in the coffee grinder for more of a muffin texture.

Nutritional yeast is an inactive yeast that’s a favourite amongst ​vegans because it’s a source of Vitamin B-12 and has a unique umami flavour similar to parmesan cheese when added to foods. It’s gluten free plus high in protein and fibre!

The level of sweetness is partially due to using very ripe bananas, but did you know that freezing and thawing overripe bananas converts more of their starch into sugar leaving them even sweeter tasting!?  Peel overripe bananas and freeze some sliced and single layered on a cookie sheet then stash them into a plastic bag for later when you can blitz them into smoothies or stir them into hot porridge.  Others you can freeze whole for baking into muffins, breads and cookies.  To use frozen bananas in baking, completely thaw bananas in a bowl so not to lose any of the melted sweet syrup.
shortDescription: Perfect “on the go” and pre or post workout, these little breakfasts stick to your ribs! Make a double batch to freeze and have on hand for the whole family to kickstart every day.

directions.direction: Carve grapefruit sections and squeeze juice from leftover membrane into small bowl (about 1/4 cup).
Make dressing – add Qspice, jalapeno, salt, lime juice, honey & cilantro to grapefruit juice then whisk in oil.
Line 4 medium plates each with one cup arugula.
Option to grill avocados or scoop out raw avocado halves with a soup spoon and place on arugula.
Scatter grapefruit segments, radishes, green onion & shrimp and garnish with pumpkin seeds.

expertTips: For more heat, mince jalapeno seeds & membrane along with the flesh.

A little go-to move for underripe avocados is to grill them.  Grilling adds a subtle layer of smoke and makes the avocado really creamy.  Rub oil on avocado halves to coat & place on 500F grill 4-5 minutes.
shortDescription: Kick off juicy grapefruit season with our fresh ceviche salad! Pair this reminiscence of ceviche with a hunk of plain focaccia and you’ve got yourself a light meal salad.

directions.direction: Whisk sauce ingredients then set aside.
Saute ground pork, water chestnuts and mushrooms until 75% cooked.
Add ginger, garlic, shitake powder, Qspice and coleslaw & saute until cabbage el dente.
Add bean sprouts & saute 2 minutes.
Mix in sauce until heated through.
Garnish with green onion, cilantro, sesame seeds & sriracha.
Serve over rice or cellophane noodles.

expertTips: For vegetarian, substitute the pork for ground round or crumbled extra firm tofu.
Cellophane noodles are a type of transparent noodle made from starch of mung beans, yams, potatoes, cassava, canna or batata.

I use shitake powder like a spice and a little goes a long way.  Just grind dried shitake mushrooms in your coffee grinder and sift.  Use the larger bits in sauces and bottle the powder for sprinkling.
shortDescription: All the goodness of an egg roll deconstructed without the junk. It tastes equally delish when eaten cold only call it egg roll slaw.

ingredient: 1 tsp olive oil or bacon fat (5g)

directions.direction: Mix dressing in shaker bottle.
Arrange arugula & top with celery, grapes & walnuts.
Sautee pears in large pan on med high to el dente and slightly brown on both sides.
Arrange pears on top of salad with tofeta and onion then dress generously.

expertTips: For a meal salad, add cooked chicken.
Substitute tofeta with goat or cow feta if you do dairy.
Never throw away bacon grease… aka culinary liquid gold!
shortDescription: With only four ingredients – apple, walnuts, celery, and mayonnaise – orthodox waldorf salad is an exercise in simplicity. Our deluxe deconstructed presentation makes for a splendid meal!

ingredient: 5 cups vegetable broth or Qspice Bouillon

directions.direction: Sweat first 6 ingredients on medium high heat.
Add quinoa and toast 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook out 6 minutes.

Add stevia and broth then simmer uncovered 20 minutes.

Note: Try our homemade Qspice Bouillon and have convenient vegan broth on hand for all your recipes.
Puree with immersion blender or Vitamix.
Stir milk and parsley in.
Garnish with your favourite soup toppers to serve.

expertTips: The immersion blender takes time to achieve a velvety texture but it’s less clean up than the Vitamix. Pick your poison!
shortDescription: Rich tomato bisque is made from a list of simple, whole ingredients in 45 minutes flat. Beyond cream of tomato, our soup recipe employs vegetables to layer flavour. Basil and tomatoes are an undeniable delicious duo although too reminiscent of pasta sauce. Instead, thyme and parsley add a fresh, earthy finish to every spoonful here!

directions.direction: Cream coconut oil then beat in egg.

Scoop with small #30 trigger-release scoop (1 1/2" balls) onto a parchment lined cookie sheet.
Bake 18 minutes @ 350F.

directions.direction: Get started by watching our Qvid on Lacto-fermented vegetables.
Mix 1 tablespoon sea salt into 1 litre boiling water and let cool.

Fill 2 clean 1 litre wide mouth jars - 1 with cauliflower and next 4 ingredients and the other with carrots and caraway seeds.

NOTE: Use any vegetables and aromatics like garlic, ginger, chili peppers, whole dried leaves and spices and fresh herbs. (The vegetables will shrink a bit as they ferment; packing them in tightly so they stay submerged in the brine).
Cover vegetables to the neck of the jars with cooled brine reserving leftover for replenishing.
Place small plastic lids upside down in the mouth of each jar then screw on wide-mouth lids. Place jars on tray to catch the overflow that may happen during active fermentation.
Burp jars daily and refill with reserved brine until no more fizzing occurs: 4-5 days.
Keep jar at room temperature away from sunlight until desired flavour is achieved: 9-14 days.
Store in refrigerator up to 3 months.

expertTips: Submerging veggies under a salt water brine gets rid of the presence of oxygen and provides a safe environment for the good bacteria to thrive. While the microbes are beneficial to eat, the lactic acid they create is as well.
Enjoy these tangy vegetables straight from the jar like pickles or try chopping and adding them to grain-based salads such as tabbouleh or simply including them in any salad.
shortDescription: Lacto-fermentation actually has nothing at all to do with lactose or dairy. Here, “Lacto” is talking about lactic acid. Almost any vegetable can be lacto-fermented, and fermenting farm-fresh produce is a great way to provide good nutrition year-round! Ferment one vegetable alone or create mix of many different kinds, along with fresh herbs and whole spices, for a great variety of cultured foods.
